Shadi is a 21-year-old single young man. For 1 1/2 years, he has had a bakery. This has been a profitable project and the only source of income to him, but he also needs more support to cover its costs and his needs.

Shadi is requesting a youth loan of 3,000 US dollars (USD) from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new vehicle. He will use it for distributing bakery products to groceries and customers' homes. This will improve Shadi's work quality and increase the demand from his customers to request more bakery products. This will increase his income and offer him better living conditions. 

Shadi is photographed in the bakery.

loans.use: To purchase a vehicle for distributing bakery products to groceries and customers' homes.

loans.name: Tophil

texts.en: Tophil is 28 years old and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda, where he has worked very hard as a teacher for the last eight years. During this time, he has bought a plot of land, completed his studies and set up a retail shop to supplement his income. His main hardships are price fluctuations, inflation and inadequate capital to buy enough items to sell to his customers. His goal is to expand his business into new areas. Tophil is applying for a loan to buy more merchandise, such as soap and sugar, to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Expedita

texts.en:
Expedita is 51 years old and lives in Manila with her husband and three children. She earns a living by selling various items, mostly clothing. She is doing well because she has a good selection and competitive prices. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 a day. Expedita is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy more items to sell. She hopes that this loan will allow her to expand her business and increase her profits. Her goals for the future are to earn a good living and draw her family closer to God. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 people who study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
Bernardina tiene 56 años, su pareja es Donato, con quien tiene ocho hijos, pero ahora sólo vive con dos de ellos. Su casa es humilde, pero propia y se ubica en el centro poblado Villa Ashaninka (selva central). 
A pesar de su edad le agrada trabajar en el campo, es agricultora desde que tenía 18 años. En todo este tiempo se dio cuenta que el cultivo de frutas cítricas es más rentable si sabe cultivarlas. Posee seis parcelas de terrenos que la comunidad le otorgó y otras que adquirió gracias a su esfuerzo. En tres parcelas produce café y en otras tres las frutas. “Ahora el precio de las naranjas está muy bajo, el cajón está a 5 soles, pero igual sigo trabajando”, menciona optimista. A partir del mes de octubre los cítricos tienen mejores precios, por ello guarda fertilizantes y abono para obtener cosechas en ese mes. Bernardina está contenta con sus cultivos de naranja, porque el trabajo es más delicado, mientras que el cafetal está a cargo de su pareja e hijos, quienes también se esfuerzan por mejores resultados día tras día.

Este es su crédito número 9 con MFP y agradece el apoyo que le han dado todos estos años. Con respecto a su banco comunal “Los Naranjales”, muestra satisfacción de pertenecer a un grupo sólido con proyecciones en común.
Con el dinero de este préstamo podrá comprar bolsas de fertilizantes y abono orgánico. También preparará viveros de café y naranjas para ampliar sus cultivos, para eso comprará semillas y bolsas especiales.
texts.en:
Bernardina is 56-years-old and her spouse is Donato; they have 8 children but only two of them still live with her.  Her house is humble but hers and it’s located in the Villa Ashaninka settlement (central jungle).  Despite her age, she enjoys working in the fields.  She’s been working in agriculture since she was 18-years-old.  In all this time she’s learned that growing citrus fruit is the most profitable as long as you know how to do so.

She owns six parcels of land that the community gave her and others that she acquired through her efforts.  She produces coffee on three of them and fruit on the rest.  “The price of oranges is very low now, the crate only costs 5 soles, but even so I continue to work,” she mentions optimistically.

Starting in the month of October, citrus fruit prices improve so she saves fertilizer and manure in order to obtain harvests that month.  Bernardina is happy with her orange crops because the work is more delicate while her spouse and children take care of the coffee plants; they also strive to attain better results day after day.

This is her loan #9 with MFP.  She is grateful for the support she’s gotten all these years.  She is very satisfied with belonging to her “Los Naranjales” (The Orange Groves) communal bank, a solid group with common projects.

With money from this loan she will be able to buy sacks of fertilizer and organic manure.  She will also prepare coffee and orange nurseries to expand her crops.  To do so she will buy seeds and special bags.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Julissa Iliana

texts.es: Julissa empezó su negocio gracias a su hermana quien es graduada en químico farmacéutico y le llamo la atención a la vez que le permitía distraerse ya que estaba pasando momento difíciles personalmente por su divorcio. Con la ayuda de su hermana para obtener el registro sanitario abrió una pequeña farmacia en su domicilio. Ella noto que en su barrio no había por lo que le va bien en el negocio, trabaja de lunes a domingos desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Gracias a su negocio puede atender a su hijo y es eso lo que más le gusta, también el hecho de ser independiente saliendo adelante sola. El préstamo que está solicitando lo empleara en la compra de productos farmacéuticos, también productos para bebes. Su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio para en los próximos años poder comprar su propia casa.
texts.en: Julissa started her business thanks to her sister, who has a degree in pharmaceutical chemistry, and who suggested at the time that this business would distract her from the personal difficulties that she was going through as a result of her divorce.  With the help of her sister, she obtained a health license and opened a small pharmacy in her house.  She noted that her neighborhood did not have a pharmacy, and so her business has done very well.  She works every day from 8am until 10 at night.  Thanks to her business she is able to care for her son, and this is what she likes the most.  Also, she enjoys being independent and getting ahead on her own.  She is requesting a loan to purchase pharmaceutical products and baby products.  Her dream is to make her business grow so that in the coming years she can buy her own house.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn, 42, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is already a widow and her children are still studying.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her daily expenses.  

Evelyn operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but also a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Evelyn dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her own restaurant. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 52 years old and has earned a living for the last 10 years by working as a tailor. She enjoys her business and has been able to earn enough money to care for her children. Her goal for the future is to own a tailoring shop where she can display all of her sample curtains. Today, she needs to bring her items to market to sell them. Teresita is highly motivated to improve her enterprise and increase her income, and is requesting a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy garments, needles, thread and other materials she needs to make more curtains. She hopes to make her dreams come true through hard work and patience in managing her business.

loans.use: to buy garments, needles, thread and other materials needed to make curtains.

loans.name: Gs San Pedro Sur I Group

texts.es:
La Señora María es una persona muy emprendedora dedicada 100% a su negocio, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. En Choluteca en el sur de Honduras. Ella tiene más de 15 años de tener este tipo de negocio.
Doña María el préstamo lo invertirá en la compara de granos básicos como frijoles, maíz, manteca, carne y pollo de esta manera incrementara mas sus ventas.
Con el préstamo Doña María espera mejorar sus ventas y así atender mejor a sus clientes. Con estos fondos espera que su negocio sea más sólido y rentable. Doña María sus sueños es poder y darles a sus hijos una mejor educación y ayudar a su familia a salir adelante ya que son de escasos recursos económicos.
Marlen se dedica a su negocio de fábrica y venta de tortillas desde hace mas de 15 años en el mercado.
Ingrid se dedica su negocio de fábrica y venta de tortillas. Desde hace mas de 12 años en varios caseríos de la zona.
Choluteca, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
Señora María is a very enterprising person who dedicates herself 100% to her business.  She lives with her husband and their three children in Choluteca, in southern Honduras.  She has more than 15 years of experience in this type of business.

Doña María will invest the loan in the purchase of basic grains like beans, corn, lard, beef, and chicken. This way she will increase her sales. With the loan Doña María hopes to improve her sales and thus take better care of her customers.  With these funds she hopes the business will be more stable and profitable.  Her dreams are to be able to give her children a better education and to help her family get ahead in life since they are of limited financial resources.  

Marlen makes a living through her business of making and selling tortillas which she has done for more than 15 years in the market.
Ingrid makes a living through her business of making and selling tortillas.  She has done this for more than 12 years in various hamlets in the area.

Choluteca, Honduras - June 2012

loans.use: to buy beans, corn, lard, beef, and chicken for her business.

loans.name: Estelle

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de cinq enfants scolarisés, Estelle a encore l'enfant de son oncle à charge. Elle a une baraque sise à son domicile où elle vend des liqueurs, des œufs, des sachets et de divers depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci d'accroître son fonds de roulement et de couvrir les besoins de ses clients qui augmentent sans cesse, Estelle a sollicité et a bénéficié d'un concours financier auprès de Finadev. Ce concours lui permettra de contribuer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et de renforcer son activité. Elle envisage aider son mari à réfectionner la toiture de leur maison.
texts.en: Married and the mother of five children, all of whom are in school, Estelle also takes care of her uncle’s child. She has a store set up in her home and sells liquor, eggs, plastic bags and miscellaneous items. She stocks up at one of  Benin markets. In order to expand her working capital and meet the ever-growing customer demand, Estelle has requested and obtained financial support from Finadev. This support will allow her to contribute to the educational costs for her children as well as strengthen her business. She plans to help her husband replace the roof of their house.

loans.use: to buy two boxes of assorted liquor, two crates of eggs and 10 packs of spaghetti

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 39-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children and buy a car. He has been in transport for the last four years and his main hardship is the high fuel and transportation costs. However, he has a vision of hiring employees to help expand his business. Stephen needs a loan to buy another motorcycle, which he will hire out to riders who will be remitting 80% of the daily earnings.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a 25-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been in the motorcycle business for five years. He faces hardships of high fuel and transportation costs. However, he has a vision of expanding his business to new areas and owning at least five motorcycles so he can hire some of them to other riders who will be remitting 80% of the daily earnings. Wilson needs a loan to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: El Futuro Del Peru Group

texts.es:
HOLA!!!!!!!!!!, Les saludamos gratamente todos los peruanos, Les presento al grupo El Futuro del Perú conformado por 10 socio, ellos vienen trabajando más de un  año con EDAPROSPO, se conocen muy bien ya que están iniciando ya su quinto ciclo, todos son responsables y puntuales en sus pagos con nuestra institución.
En el grupo una de las socias mas destacadas por su carisma y empeño es Katherine, una señora de 23 años de edad conviviente con el padre de su pequeño hijo de un año y cuatro meses, empezó con su propio taller artesanal gracias a los conocimientos sobre la elaboración de ladrillos artesanales del padre de su conviviente, gracias al buen trabajo que ellos realizan, son reconocidos y su producto es muy solicitado dentro de la zona por donde viven.
Ellos tienen el propósito de crecer y tener muchos más hornos artesanales, para crecer, mejorar y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida al pequeño hijo,quien es su motor de sus vidas, ya que como padres primerizos y jóvenes tiene muchos sueños para ese pequeño.
Es por eso que Katherine solicitó el préstamo para poder comprar mas insumos para fabricar sus ladrillos (arcilla en gran cantidad, maderas, troncos,etc.)
Ella y su familia se encuentra muy agradecida con los inversionistas de KIVA por creer en sus sueños y sus metas!!!!!.

Katherine, esta con una casaca de color marrón, es la segunda de la izquierda, de la primera fila,
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru.  We present to you the group El Futuro del Perú, which is comprised of 10 members.  They have been working for over a year with EDAPROSPO and are well-know to our institution as they are starting their fifth loan cycle.  They are all responsible and punctual in their payments.

One of the group's most charismatic and hardworking members is Katherine, a 23-year-old woman who lives with the father of her little sixteen-month-old boy.  She opened her own workshop thanks to her common-law husband's father's knowledge of brick-making.  Thanks to the good work that they do, they are well-regarded and their product is much sought-after in the area where they live.

They want to grow their business and have many more brick-making ovens, so that they can provide their little boy with a better life.  He is what they live for; as young first-time parents they have a lot of dreams for this little one.

It is for this reason that Katherine is seeking the loan so that she can purchase more materials to make her bricks (large quantities of clay, boards, logs, and other materials.)

She and her family are very grateful to the KIVA lenders for believing in their dreams and their goals.

Katherine is the woman in the brown sweatshirt, second from the left in the first row.

loans.use: to buy clay, boards, logs and corn husks for binding the clay.

loans.name: Reintegracion Group

texts.es:
El grupo Reintegración está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es María Elena quien vende ropa, cosméticos y prendas más de 10 años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para agrandar el negocio.
Las otras integrantes son Concepción quien trabaja cociendo y vende material de costura; e Ingrid quien se dedica a la costura.
texts.en:
The group “Reintegración” (Reintegration) consists of three hardworking and enterprising individuals. One of the is María Elena who has been selling clothing, cosmetics, and jewelry for more than 10 years. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise so that she can expand her business.

The other members are as follows: • Concepción works as a seamstress and also sells sewing materials. • Ingrid also works as a seamstress.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as clothing, cosmetics, and jewelry.

loans.name: Gastelu

texts.es:
Gastelu tiene 30 años, su pareja es Mariela, con quien tiene un hijo de 3 años. Ellos viven en el centro poblado Villa Ashaninkam en la selva central peruana.
Su principal actividad es la pesca y la realiza en los ríos que están cerca de su localidad. Su rutina inicia desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, y espera tres horarios fijos para colocar sus mallas. Obtiene alrededor de 25 kilos de pescado entre “chupadoras”, “doncellas” y “barbones” (tipos de pescado), pero menciona que el kilo de la doncella está a 20 soles, y le conviene más, mientras que los otros los comercializa a 10 soles el kilo. Lleva toda su mercadería hacia la ciudad que está a media hora de su zona para la venta. Paralelamente tiene una parcela donde cultiva café, pero el trabajo en el campo lo realiza una vez al año y contrata personal, por ello se dedica a la pesca en mayor intensidad. 

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por ello menciona que será puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Además pertenece al banco comunal “Los Naranjales”; agradece el apoyo y las charlas educativas que le brindan.
De este préstamo invertirá 1600 soles en la compra de una malla de 50 metros, cuyo material es especial. Lo sobrante lo destinará para la compra de baldes, tinas, anzuelos y otros instrumentos de pesca.
texts.en:
Gastelu is 30 years old, and lives with his partner, Mariela, and their three-year-old son. They live in the town center of Villa Ashaninkam, in the central Peruvian jungle.

Gastelu makes a living as a fisherman, and he fishes the rivers near his home. He begins his daily routine at 5:00 in the morning, and works until 6:00 in the evening, after which he has to wait three hours to hang and dry his nets. He catches about 25 kilograms of fish of various varieties, including: "chupadoras", "doncellas", "barbones" (all different species of fish) and other species. A kilogram of doncella is the most valuable, and sells for 20 soles, while a kilogram of the other varieties sells for 10 soles. Gastelu travels half an hour to the closest city to sell the fish he catches. He also has a small parcel of land where he grows coffee plants, but he only works his land once each year and hires workers seasonally. His main focus is fishing.

This is Gastelu's second loan with MFP, and he has always made payments on time. He is also a member of the community bank, "Los Naranjales" (The Oranges), and is grateful for the support he has received from this group, as well as for the worthwhile, educational discussions they share. He plans to use the support from this loan to purchase a 50 meter fishing net that is made from a special material. With the remaining funds, he plans to purchase buckets, tubs, hooks and other fishing implements.

loans.use: to purchase a 50 meter fishing net and other implements for fishing.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen, 30, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Jun-Jun and she is a mother of two children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Helen manages her sidecar transportation business. She has two units of sidecars or bicycle carts that carry up to two passengers to their destination within the community. Her regular customers are workers and employees in the community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to maintain her sidecar. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Helen hopes to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of her sidecar unit.

loans.name: Rene Adolfo

texts.es:
El Señor Rene habitante del Barrio German Pomares, junto a su compañera e hijos, trabajan duro dia a dia para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, Rene tiene 5 años de trabajar como comerciante en la zona Norte del pais el vende calzado para damas y caballeros y artesania como. Trompos, Matracas, Boleros, Joyitas entre otros, su mayor sueño es tener mas grande su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias. con este financiamiento que se le esta otorgando podra comprar mas productos de los que vende y su negocio se agrandara un poco mas ya que sus productos obtienen mucha demanda por parte de los clientes.
Agradecido con Afodenic quien a travez de Fondos Kivas podra invertir mas en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rene lives in the neighborhood of German Pomares with his partner and children. They work hard every day in order to improve their living conditions. 

Rene has been working as a merchant in the north of the country for five years. He sells footwear for women and men and crafts such as spinning tops, noise makers, bolero toys [a stick and ball game], and jewelry, among others. His biggest dream is to have a larger business in order to obtain greater profits. 

With the funding that has been granted to him, he will be able to buy more products and his business will grow a bit more since their is a lot of customer demand for his products. He is grateful to Afodenic, because through Kiva funds he will be able to invest more in his business.

loans.use: to buy footwear, craft products, spinning tops, noise makers, and bolero toys

loans.name: Moayad

texts.en:
Moayad is a 33-year-old young man. He is married, with no children yet.

For the past five years, Moayad has been selling men's and women's clothes to customers.  It has been a profitable project, but it needs more support to cover his family's needs and its expenses.

Moayad is requesting a US$ 2,000 loan from FATEN to help him purchase a new collection of summer clothes to resell. This will gives Moayad a greater variety of clothes to sell.   That will satisfy customers and increase his sales and improve the family's income.

Moayad is photographed in his store.

loans.use: To purchase new collection of summer clothes to resell

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a hardworking married man who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He has a personal goal of educating his children to attain degrees as minimum qualifications.

He is in the transport business -- specifically, he has a taxi. His main hardship has been high fuel and transportation costs.  He would like to diversify his business to include farming and also to buy another taxi since that business makes good money.  Patrick needs a loan to buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace is 27 years old. She is a mother who is working in a sari-sari store business. Mary Grace is married to Franklin, a farmer, from the village of Baringin Sur. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with two children. As of now, Mary Grace is asking for a loan in the amount of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy noodles, sugar and kitchen needs to sell. She is hoping to meet her customers' demands for affordable prices for the merchandise she offers. She also would like to save funds to use in times of emergency.

loans.use: to buy noodles, sugar and kitchen needs to sell

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
This is Emilia, 51, who is a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a widow with two children. She manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide an income for their everyday expenses.

Emilia operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from round, palm-sized ones, to much larger doormats and other crafts that most rug-makers create every day. As rugs are a major part of Philippine housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 3,500 in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and other materials for her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.
  
Emilia hopes to increase her production and dreams to be able to give her family a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional cloth, needles, and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Sarafina Group

texts.en:
Asha is in her late thirties and married, with one child who goes to school.  

She has been running a grocery store for five years now. She works from 7 a.m. to midnight and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to buy chairs and tables and to restock her inventory.  She repaid her loan successfully.   She wants a loan to add beers to her line of products.  Her dream is one day to be able to buy her own car.

Asha will share this loan with her loan group "Sarafina."  It has 14 members who will hold one other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy beers to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
Eliana tiene 55 años, su pareja es Rosalino, con quien tiene tres hijos de 17, 16 y 12 años.
Gracias a su comunidad cuenta con cinco parcelas de terreno donde cultiva café y plátanos, a veces también produce yuca y maíz, para salir de apuros. “El maíz se cosecha en cautro meses y se vende rápido, pero solo siembro maíz raras veces”, menciona. Eliana recibe el apoyo de Rosalino y sus tres hijos, pues la actividad que absorbe su tiempo es la limpieza de sus cultivos. Cada mes tiene que cortar la mala hierba que crece entre sus plantaciones, como tiene cinco cuadras a veces ella y su familia no abastece este trabajo, por ello tienen que contratar personal adicional. Con la seguridad de tener una buena producción ofrece su café a depósitos con anticipación, quienes le dan adelantos de dinero y ella siempre está segura que cumplirá con el pedido.

Este es el crédito número 7 que recibe de MFP, por esa razón se compromete, una vez más, en pagar las cuotas mensuales puntualmente, como anteriormente lo hizo. Pertenece al banco comunal “Las Hormiguitas”, un grupo sólido, donde se siente a gusto por las charlas educativas y las visitas que se le realizan.
Con este dinero podrá comprar bolsas de fertilizantes para abonar su cafetal y además pagará a los jornaleros quienes apoyarán en la limpieza de la mala hierba.
texts.en:
Eliana is 55 years old and her partner is Rosalino, with whom she has three children ages 17, 16, and 12.

Thanks to her community she has five plots of land where she cultivates coffee and bananas and sometimes also yuca and corn, in order to get out of her difficult situation.  "The corn is harvested in four months and it sells quickly, but I rarely plant corn," she says.  

Eliana receives support from Rosalino and her three children, but the activity that absorbs her time is the cleaning of her crops.  Every month she has to cut out the bad weeds that grow between her plantings, and since she has five blocks sometimes she and her family are not enough to cover this work. This is why they have to hire additional workers.  With the certainty of having a good production she offers her coffee with advance deposits, which gives them money in advance, and she is always certain that she will complete the order.

This is her 7th loan that she has received from MFP and for this reason she promises, once again, to pay the monthly fees on time as she did previously.  She belongs to the communal bank "Las Hormiguitas" (The Little Ants), a mutually supportive group where she feels comfortable with the educational talks and the visits that they make.

With this money she will be able to buy bags of fertilizer in order to fertilize her coffee plants, and to also pay the laborers who will help them in cleaning up the weeds.

loans.use: to hire laborers to clean her crops, and to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is married with six children living in Hoima, Uganda. He is a teacher by profession and has been teaching for over 23 years. He is so proud of his job since it has enabled him to realize his dream of inspiring the young. He faces the challenge of the high prices of commodities, which makes it hard to save his salary and his family goal is to educate his children up to the university. George intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
This is Petronila, 65, a resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband is Nicanor, and she is mother to four children.  Together with her husband, she manages their own household while operating  business.

Petronila operates a variety store. It is basically a small convenient store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one packet of shampoo, PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her inventory.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Petronila hopes that her business would grow and expand. She also dreams of giving her grandchildren a good and quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week  to share stories of their work.  There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a conservative housewife, so she has asked her son to take her place in the photo.

Iman is a mother of eight. One of her sons, Ra’ad, studies at a university on his own expense. Her wish is to help him, even if for once to pay for her son’s university semester.  He is always there for her and takes care of her. She wishes to repay him by helping him finish his studies and graduate.

loans.use: To pay for her son's semester fees

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es: Cesar tiene 51 años y realiza estampados en camisas y cintas en su domicilio, el negocio es familiar ya que aprendió las técnicas de sus padres quienes las elaboraban de manera más artesanal. Empezó su negocio en 1990 cuando adquirió su primera plancha de estampado, en sus inicios realizaba el estampado a camisa actualmente tiene varios contratos por lo que también hace uniformes de equipos deportivos, de colegio y empresas. De momento realiza solo el trabajo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, su esposa trabaja de empleada domestica y sus hijos asisten al colegio fiscal. Con el préstamo comprara short, calentadores y camisas para estampar y vender al menor y mayor, espera trabajar bien con el crédito de tal manera que pueda capitalizarse para vender al mayor continuando con el negocio por varios años mas ya que es el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar is 51 years old and applies prints to shirts and ribbons. This is a family business since he learned the techniques from his parents who produced products that were handmade. He began his business in 1990 when he acquired his first printing plate. Initially he imprinted only shirts but now he has various contracts to print uniforms for sports teams, schools and businesses. 

At the moment, Cesar works alone from 8 in the morning until 5 in the evening. His wife is employed as a domestic and his children attend public school. With the loan he will buy shorts, leg warmers and shirts and print them to sell retail and wholesale. He expects the loan will work well so that he can capitalize to sell wholesale and continue his business several more years since it is his family’s means of support.

loans.use: to purchase shorts, leg warmers and shirts.

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola is a conservative woman, so she has asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Ola a mother of three. She is married, and her husband owns a small mini-market. She works from her home as a hair dresser and wishes to make enough money to help her husband in buying a new juice machine.  This will hopefully increase his sales and give his mini-market an advantage over his competitors.

loans.use: To buy a new juice machine

loans.name: Aysha

texts.en:
Aysha is a divorced lady living with her parents in Madaba.  She is trying to help with the household.  She has a small, home-based market where she sells basic products to her neighbors and the neighborhood. 

She hopes to increase the variety of the products she sells and to get larger quantities of milk to produce the famous Jameed yogurt, which is used for Jordan’s national dish.

loans.use: increase the variety of the products she sells and get larger quantities of milk

loans.name: Abla

texts.en: Abla is a married woman; her husband is a blacksmith. She is trying to help her husband with the household expenses by trading.  She sells Russian gold and perfumes from her home to her friends and neighbors.  She would love to get a loan to increase the quantity of her products to meet the needs and demands of her market.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
This is Ofelia, 43, a resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband is Rodrigo and she is a mother to her four children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business.

Ofelia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenient store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory and for the maintenance of her sewing machine. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Ofelia hopes that her business will grow and expand through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Riham

texts.en:
Riham is a married woman and the mother of four children, living in Marka, which is just outside of Amman.  She works from her home in buying and selling clothes and shoes.

She wishes to expand her business by increasing the amount of clothes she has to sell, so she can one day reach the point of opening an independent store for clothes and shoes.  She hopes to help her husband in providing a better life for her kids.

loans.use: increase the stock of clothes she has for sale.

loans.name: Ra'eda

texts.en:
Ra’eda is a conservative woman, so she asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Ra’eda is married and helps her husband, who owns a dry-cleaning shop in Madaba.  She wishes to enhance the store by changing decorations and expanding the store to be able to receive more customers and increase their profits.

loans.use: changing decorations and expanding the store

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
This is Lourdes, 33, a resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband is Expedito and she is a mother to her five children.  She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business.

Lourdes operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenient store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory and for the maintenance of her sewing machine. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Lourdes hopes that her business will grow and expand. She also dreams of giving her children a good and quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad, who appears in the picture, is a 23-year-old single man. He is employed but the low salary he gets isn't enough to cover his needs. Mohammad is requesting a $500 US loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new laptop. This will enhance his skills in using the computer and speed the process of doing reports for his work.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
This is Margie, 32, a resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband is Ruben and she is the mother of her child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Margie maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are counting on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy merchandise and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Margie dreams of expanding her business and helping her child finish his studies through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional merchandise and customer's orders

loans.name: Tamam

texts.en:
Tamam is a conservative woman, so she asked her son to take her place in the photo.

Tamam is a mini-market owner in Madaba.  She is a smart planner, and she tries to help with the household and enhancing the lifestyle of her family. 

She wishes to expand her store and increase the quantity of her goods and ther variety, to ensure an increase in her sales and profit.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of her goods and their variety.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia tiene 46 años, su pareja es Teófilo, con quien tiene ocho hijos, pero solo vive con tres de ellos (los de  8, 6 y 3 años de edad). Juntos viven en una casa rústica, pero propia que se ubica en el centro poblado Villa Ashaninka (selva central).

Se dedica a la agricultura hace más de 20 años y en todo este tiempo como trabajadora del campo ha logrado mantener y educar a sus cinco hijos, quienes ya salieron de su hogar. Ahora su esfuerzo se enfoca en sus tres últimos hijos. En sus dos parcelas de terreno, que la comunidad le otorgó, produce frutas cítricos como naranjas y mandarinas y además cacao. Sus labores las realiza por la mañana, al lado de su esposo; y por las tardes instala un pequeño carrito donde prepara hamburguesas, pollo y papas fritas, salchichas fritas, etc., de esa manera obtiene otros ingresos para cubrir gastos eventuales. Amalia iniciará ahora una siembra de maíz que cosechará en cuatro meses.

Este es su préstamo número 4 con MFP, por ello se responsabiliza de pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Los Naranjales” y manifiesta estar satisfecha con las actividades, las charlas educativas y los ahorros mensuales.
Invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de semillas de maíz y en bolsas de fertilizantes. También pagará a los jornaleros que contratará para realizar esta actividad.
texts.en:
Amalia is 46 years old and her partner is Teófilo, with whom she has eight children, however she lives with only three of them (the 8, 6 and 3 year-olds). They live in a rustic house, their own, which is located in the Villa Ashaninka settlement (in the central rainforest).

She has been a farmer for more than 20 years and during this time she has succeeded, as an agricultural worker, in supporting and educating the five children that have left her home. Now her efforts are focused on the last three of her children.

On the two parcels of land that the community granted her she has produced citrus fruits, such as oranges and mandarins, and also cacao. She works in the fields in the mornings, at her husband’s side, while during the afternoons she sets up a small cart where she prepares hamburgers, fried chicken and potatoes and fried “salchichas” (sausage), etc. Thus she earns additional income to cover incidental expenses. Amalia will now begin planting maize that she will harvest in four months.

This is her fourth loan from MFP and she is committed to making her payments on time. She belongs to Los Naranjales Communal Bank and states that she is satisfied with its activities, the educational talks and the monthly savings program. She will invest her loan in the purchase of maize seeds and in bags of fertilizer. She will also contract day laborers to plant her maize.

loans.use: to purchase maize seeds and bags of fertilizer, as well as pay for a labor force on her land.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 33 años, es soltero, pero padre de dos hijos de 7 y 4 años. Juntos viven en una casa rústica, pero propia, ubicada en una comunidad nativa de la selva central.

Él se dedica a la agricultura, lleva toda su vida rodeado de sembríos. Actualmente cuenta con cinco parcelas de terreno que la comunidad le brindó, en ellas produce café, plátanos y yucas (tubérculo oriundo). Hace una semana concluyó con la última etapa de la cosecha de café, por eso ahora piensa cultivar yucas, “el precio de las yucas está bien, cada kilo está a 1 sol y 20 céntimos”, menciona. Las yucas son rentables y se venden en cada mes del año, porque todos los pobladores lo consumen a diario. La ventaja que tiene Jaime es que cada comprador se acerca hasta su comunidad para adquirir sus productos, así ahorra en el traslado y movilidad.

Este es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP y es un de los socios más entusiastas del banco comunal “Las Hormiguitas”.
Jaime invertirá este dinero en la siembra de una parcela de yucas, comprará semillas y bolsas de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Jaime is 33 years old and a single father of two children, ages 7 and 4.  Together they live in a rustic home, but it is theirs, located in a native community in the central jungle.

He works in agriculture and has spent all of his life surrounded by plants.  Currently, he has five parcels of land that the community offered him.  On those, he produces coffee, plantains, and yuccas (native tubers).  A week ago, he concluded the last phase of the coffee harvest.  For that reason, he is now thinking of cultivating yucca.  "The price of yuccas is good, each kilo is 1 sol (Peruvian currency) and 20 cents" he mentions.  Yuccas are profitable and they sell during each month of the year, because all the local people eat them daily.  The advantage Jaime has is that every buyer comes to his community to acquire products, so he saves in transportation.

This is his fifth loan with MFP and he is one of the most enthusiastic members of the communal bank "Las Hormiguitas."  Jaime will invest the money in planting a parcel of yuccas.  He will purchase seeds and bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase yucca seeds and bags of fertilizers.

loans.name: Gs Las Delicias I Group

texts.es:
Doña Marisel es una señora muy trabajadora dedicada a su trabajo, madre de 3 hijos y vive con su esposo, ella tiene su negocio en Choluteca en el sur de Honduras. Desde hace más de 13 años se dedica a la elaboración de pan.
Doña Marisel el préstamo lo necesita Para la compra de harina, leña, azúcar y manteca. Este crédito le ayudara ya que tendrá capital fresco para invertir ya que trabaja con créditos, quincenales también ella da créditos en su negocio a sus clientes.
Doña Marisel sus sueños son de comprar un vehículo para tener mejores ingresos para bienestar de sus hijos.
Gloria se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace más de 12 años y actualmente vive con su esposo.
Juan se dedica a la compra y venta de huevos desde hace mas de 12 años tiene 1 hijo y actualmente vive con su madre.
Choluteca, Honduras - Julio del 2012
texts.en:
Marisel is a very hard-working lady and is dedicated to her work. She has three children and lives with her husband. She has her business in Cholucteca in the south of Honduras. For over 13 years she has been earning her living making bread. 

Marisel is asking for a loan to buy flour, firewood, sugar and butter. This loan will help her since she will have new capital to invest as she works with fortnightly loan and also gives loans through her business to her customers. Marisel’s dream is to buy a car to have a higher income in the future for the well-being of her children. 

Gloria has been earning her living making and selling tortillas for over 12 years and currently lives with her huband. 

Juan has been earning his living buying and selling eggs for  over 12 years. He has one son and currently lives with his mother.

Choluteca, Honduras - July 2012

loans.use: to buy flour, firewood, sugar and butter for her business.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ana tiene 53 años, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con ella vive su nieta quien la ayuda en su actividad, trabajo que realiza desde hace 30 años en la comunidad donde vive. Su negocio se encuentra en un punto estratégico, donde la fluidez de personas en es grandes cantidades, ya que esta por la calle principal y esto hace que sea muy visitado.
Doña Ana el crédito lo necesita para la compra de: pollo, carnes, embutidos, lácteos, arroz, aceite, mariscos, etc. el impacto esperado con el crédito, es que sus ventas crezcan ya que comprara bastante producto, para contrarrestar la demanda que tiene a diario de cada uno de sus clientes, los cuales visitan su negocio.
Los planes a futuro de Doña Ana es hacer que su negocio crezca día a día, y generarse mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Choluteca, Honduras - Julio del 2012.
texts.en:
Señora Ana is 53 years old and lives in the southern region of Honduras. Her granddaughter, who helps her with the work, lives with her. She has been doing this job for thirty years in the community where she lives. Her business is located at a strategic spot where the flow of people is in large numbers, as it's on the main street, which makes it frequently visited. 

Ana needs the loan to buy chicken, meat, sausages, dairy products, rice, oil, seafood, etc. The expected impact of the loan is that her sales will grow, since she will buy enough goods to meet the daily demands of every one of the customers who visit her business. 

Ana's future plans are to grow her business from one day to the next, and to generate more income to have a better quality of life. 

Choluteca, Honduras - July 2012

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, sausages, dairy products, rice, oil, seafood, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Las Progresistas Group

texts.es:
Buenas Tardes a todos, tengan todos un fraternal saludos de todos los peruanos, en esta oportunidad les hablaré del grupo LAS PROGRESISTAS, conformado por 8 socios, que ya se ido conociendo durante su primer ciclo de trabajo, ciclo donde cada uno de ellos tuvieron una muy buena experiencia, es  por eso que quieren seguir trabajando con los beneficios que EDAPROSPO les otorga. Una de las socias de este grupo unido, es Sara, una universitaria que se dedica a la venta de jugos, para poder solventarse los gastos que genera su educación, ya que la universidad donde estudia es privada y tiene que pagar mensualmente por su enseñanza, el sueño que ella tiene es el de ser una buena y reconocida profesional, es por eso que se decidió emprender un negocio que hasta la fecha le esta yendo muy bien. Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de una licuadora, porque, con la única licuadora que cuenta la coparte con su hermana que se dedica a la venta de comida en el mismo local donde alquilan.
Ella está muy agradecida, por el financiamiento de los inversionistas de kiva , ya que de esa manera asegura cumplir sus metas.
En la fotografía, es la segunda de la derecha viste con una polera color marrón.* En la parte superior está la fotografía de Mcklein.
texts.en:
Good afternoon, everyone.  Here's a brotherly greeting from all Peruvians.  At this time I would like to talk to you about Las Progresistas group, made up of 8 members who have gotten to know each during their first work cycle and are working for the benefits that Edaprospo offers them.  One of the members of this supportive group is Sara, a university student.  She sells juices to be able to cover her education expenses since the university that she attends is private and she has to make monthly payments for her classes.  Her dream is to be a good and well-known professional.  That is why she decided to start a business that so far has been going well.
She is requesting a loan to buy a blender because, the only one that she has is shared with her sister who sells food in their same rented stand.
Sara is very appreciative for the financing from Kiva lenders since this way she can achieve her goals.  She is the second from the right in the photo, with a brown polo shirt.  *In the upper part of the photo there is a picture of Mcklein.

loans.use: to buy a blender

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
This is Remedios, 42, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Daniel who works as a driver. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Remedios operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but also a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Remedios dreams of expanding her business through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products

loans.name: Frida

texts.es:
Frida tiene 37 años, su pareja es Néstor, con quien tiene cuatro hijos, pero sólo vive con dos de ellos, los de 12 y 4 años. 
Desde los 18 años ella labora en el campo, cuenta con cinco parcelas de terreno en producción, donde cultiva café y plátano. La cosecha de café se da una vez al año, mientras que el plátano lo cosecha cada quince días, así cubre sus necesidades básicas. Le agrada trabajar en los meses de cosecha (mayo hasta julio), porque se siente ocupada y atareada, y con la inteligencia que la caracteriza negocia sus granos de café en almacenes en la ciudad que está a una hora y media de su zona. “Este año el precio del café estaba bajo, a 6 soles el kilo, pero igual no se llega a perder”, menciona. 

Este es su crédito número 8 con MFP y está muy agradecida por todo el apoyo brindado. Se siente identificada con su banco comunal “Las Hormiguitas”, incluso ella es la presidenta del grupo.
Con el dinero de este préstamo podrá adquirir bolsas de fertilizantes para sus cultivos de café que quedaron débiles por la última cosecha. Además pagará a los jornaleros que limpiarán sus terrenos.
texts.en:
Frida is 37 years old and her partner is Néstor, with whom she has four children, however only two live with them, (the 12 and 4 year-olds). For the past 18 years, she has been working in the fields. She has five parcels of land under production where she cultivates coffee and bananas. The coffee is harvested once a year, while she picks her bananas every fifteen days, thus covering her basic needs. She enjoys working during harvesting months (May until July), because she keeps busy and, with her characteristic intelligence, negotiates the price of her coffee beans at stores in the city, which is about an hour and a half from the area. “This year, the price of coffee was low, only 6 soles a kilo, so we cannot afford to lose any of it,” she states.

This is loan number 8 from MFP and she is very grateful for all the support provided her. She identifies with her communal bank, "Las Hormiguitas,” and is the group's president. She will use the loan to acquire sacks of fertilizer for her coffee plants, which are still weak from the last harvest. As well, she will pay day laborers to weed her land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to pay day laborers to weed her crops.

loans.name: Naser

texts.en: Naser is a 34-year-old owner of a car garage in Marka. He is a very dedicated worker and wishes to advance and develop his skills and car shop. He requested this loan so he can add more car accessories to his shop and provide extra services that will enable him to improve and develop his business.

loans.use: to add more car accessories to his shop

loans.name: Ala'a

texts.en: Ala’a is a single ambitious young lady who lives with her family, which includes her parents and four brothers and sisters. She wishes now to continue with her studies to get a B.A. degree in hospital management. This loan will help her to pay for her university expenses.

loans.use: to pay for her university expenses

loans.name: Joanna

texts.en: Joanna is a young girl who lives with her parents in Irbid and is a university student. She wishes to get this loan to pay for her semester expenses and pay for her own education.

loans.use: to pay for her semester expenses at university

loans.name: Claudia Oristela

texts.es:
La joven Claudia tiene 29 años, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con ella vive su pequeña hija y su esposo quien la apoya en su actividad y en cada uno de sus compromisos, Claudia este trabajo lo realiza desde hace 4 años en la comunidad donde vive. Su negocio lo hace de manera ambulante, ya que distribuye su producto en varias aldeas y caseríos, como también en su misma comunidad.
Claudia el crédito lo necesita para compra de: sandalias, pantalones, camisas, camisetas, cremas, calzonetas, desodorantes etc. para satisfacer la demanda de cada uno de sus clientes.
El impacto esperado con crédito, es que sus ventas se incrementen, ya que comprara una variedad de producto  para contrarrestar cada uno de los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes todas las semanas.
Los planes a futuro de Claudia  es crecer en su actividad, y poner una tienda para generase buenos ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
Choluteca, Honduras - Julio del 2012.
texts.en:
Claudia is 29 years old and lives in the southern zone of Honduras.  Along with her lives her small daughter and her husband who supports her in her work and in all of her commitments.  Claudia has been working in the community where she lives for the past 4 years.  She does her business traveling on foot, since she distributes her products in various villages and towns, as well as in her own community.

Claudia needs the loan to purchase: sandals, pants, shirts, T-shirts, creams, swimsuits, deodorants, etc. to satisfy the demand of each of her customers.

The expected impact of the loan is that her sales will increase, since she will purchase a variety of products to complete each of the orders that her customers make every week.

Claudia's future plans are to grow her business and open a store to generate good income in order to have a better quality of life for her and her family.

Choluteca, Honduras - July 2012.

loans.use: to purchase sandals, pants, shirts, T-shirts, creams, swimsuits, deodorants, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en: Stanley is a hardworking man with four children living in Hoima, Uganda. He runs a butcher shop. With the proceeds, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and renovate his house. He has been running his business for over three years. He faces the challenge of the high cost of animals. His family goal is to educate his children; while his business dream is to own a ranch. Stanley needs this loan to buy cows for his butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy cows for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Shmsan

texts.en: Shmsan is 38 years old, and is very jolly with the motivation that characterizes entrepreneurs. Day after day, he works hard to provide for his five children. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He works hard selling sweets, working every day on a schedule. Due to his ability to persuade clients, he earns good profits throughout his shift, which allows him to afford family expenses. Nevertheless, he now has a need to continue working for his family. He applied for a loan of 350,000 YER from AMB to buy a rickshaw that he could use to sell sweets around the city. He hopes to open a big sweets store.

loans.use: to buy rickshaw for selling sweets

loans.name: Victor Ramon

texts.es:
El Señor Víctor es una persona muy trabajadora dedicada a su negocio, vive con su esposa y sus hijos. en el departamento de Choluteca en el sur de Honduras. El tiene más de 15 años de tener este tipo de negocio.
Don Víctor el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ganado vacuno de esta manera incrementara más sus ventas.
Con el préstamo espera incrementar sus ventas para atender mejor a sus clientes.
Don Víctor espera tener mejores ingresos para tener mejor calidad de vida, sus sueños es poder  terminar de  darle el estudios a sus hijos y ayudar a su familia.
Choluteca, Honduras - Julio del 2012
texts.en:
Víctor is a hard-working person who is dedicated to his business.  He lives with his wife and their children in the department of Choluteca in the south of Honduras.  He has worked for more than 15 years in this type of business.

Victor will invest the loan in the purchase of cattle in order to increase his sales.

With the loan, he hopes to increase his sales to better attend to his customers.

Victor hopes to have a better income to have a better quality of life.  His dreams are to be able to give his children the opportunity to finish their studies and to help his family.

Choluteca, Honduras - July 2012

loans.use: to purchase cattle for his business.

loans.name: Deogratius

texts.en:
Deogratius is a 32-year-old hardworking man living in Hioma, Uganda. He is married with two children who are of school-going age. He owns a general store, which he has been running for quite a long time. He started as a farmer, then diversified to his current business. He faces the challenge of high price fluctuations.

His family goal is to educate his children, and he hopes to expand his business to new markets. Deogratius needs the loan to buy general merchandise, such as salt and bread, for resale.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, such as salt and bread, for resale.

loans.name: Osaid

texts.en:
Osaid is a 21-year-old single man. He is a tailor and has a sewing workshop. His brother is a worker, and both are earning a low income which is not enough to cover their family's needs.

Osaid is requesting a USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new sewing machine. This will increase the quality and productivity of his workshop which will satisfy his customers, increase sales and improve the family's income. 

Osaid is photographed in his workshop.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is running a carpenter shop in Buchanan, where he fixes and sells a lot of household materials. He started this business with help from his father, and learned carpentry from his father as well. 

Presently, the problem he faced with is having fewer materials in stock. He is requesting a loan to buy wood, varnish, glue and others items for his business. He enjoys his business because it keeps him busy. 

George has completed the 10th grade, is 35 years old, and is married with two children, 7 and 15 years old, who are in school and live at home. George's dream is to expand his business even more, send his children to school and build a house.

loans.use: to buy wood, varnish, glue and others items for his business.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima is a hog raiser from San Roque. She has been patiently raising hogs to sell and gain profits. She has been operating her business for almost four years now and usually earns about 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) for each hog sold to butchers. Her earnings go for their meals and part of the income serves as revolving capital for the business. 

Maxima would like to keep improving the growth of her hogs. That is why she is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to sustain them. She will buy feed, vaccines and medicines for her hogs. Maxima hopes to keep growing healthy hogs to sell and meet her goal of business progression someday.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and medicines to sustain her hogs.

loans.name: Ghinhiscan

texts.en:
Ghinhiscan is 28 years old, married and has one infant child. He has aimed to upgrade their living status to give his family a better life. He has been a farmer for almost eight years, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Being a farmer is very challenging, for there are many problems and difficulties encountered before going to harvest. Despite these challenges, farmers have the determination to take risks in order to provide for their family's needs.

Due to the high cost of commodities, Ghinhiscan has aimed to improve his farming business, in order to increase his income and satisfy his family's needs. To improve the business, he is asking for additional capital of PHP20,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed for the maintenance of his vegetable production. He believes that through this loan, he will be able to increase his yields and income through patience and hard work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed for the maintenance of his vegetable production.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en: Due to the hardships of life, Luis has aimed to improve his farming business to earn sufficient income for his family. He is 54 years old and has two adult children. He has been a farmer for almost 28 years, planting and harvesting vegetables and root crops for sale. He planned to expand his vegetable plantation to increase his production, but due to insufficient capital, he is asking for an additional of PHP10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed for the maintenance of his crop production. He believes that this loan will enable him to work out his plan and is hoping that he will have a fruitful harvest to satisfy his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed for the maintenance of his crop production.

loans.name: Jhon

texts.en: Jhon is 36 years old, married, and has three school-age children. He is raising his family in a village, where he plants and harvests vegetables and root crops for sale. Since it is the major source of their income, he has planned to plant more vegetables and root crops to increase his production and income to satisfy his family's needs and support the education of his children. Due to insufficient capital, he is asking for an additional 20,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pesticides for the maintenance of his vegetable production. He believes that if he works hard and strives harder, he will improve his farming business and increase his income. In the future, he hopes that he will improve his family's status of living and educate all his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for the maintenance of his vegetable production.

loans.name: Sandra Marina

texts.es:
La señora Sandra, se dedica a su negocio de Venta de Ropa Usada y Peluches,  ofreciéndole a sus clientes variedad como ser, camisas, pantalones, short, faldas, así como peluches, cuenta con una experiencia de 10 años, sus ventas las realiza de manera ambulante en su colonia y dos veces a la semana sale a otras para poder visitar sus clientes que en mayoría le realizan pedidos, ella compra su mercadería dos veces al mes en uno de los mercados de la ciudad, aprovecha para vender toallas, ropa de cama, carteras, cosméticos, cualquier articulo que le encarguen sus clientes.
Doña Sandra esta solicitando crédito por la cantidad de L. 15,000.00 para invertirlo en compra de camisas, pantalones, faldas, camisetas, ropa interior, peluches y carteras, Doña Sandra espera que PRISMA le apoye ya que necesita surtir su negocio.
Doña Sandra su sueño es tener un local donde pueda vender su mercadería para el sustento de su familia.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Julio 2012
texts.en:
Sandra works selling used clothing and stuffed animals, offering her customers a variety of shirts, pants, shorts, skirts, as well as stuffed animals.  She has 10 years of experience.  She makes her sales on foot in her neighborhood and twice a week she goes to others to visit her customers that make up the majority of her orders.  She buys her merchandise twice a month in one of the city markets, taking advantage of the opportunity to sell towels, sheets, bags, cosmetics, and any other article her customers request.

Sandra is requesting this loan for the amount of 15,000.00 lempira (Honduran currency) to invest in the purchase of shirts, pants, skirts, T-shirts, underwear, stuffed animals, and bags.  Sandra hopes that PRISMA will support her since she needs to stock her business.

Sandra's dream is to have a shop where she can sell her merchandise to sustain her family.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – July 2012

loans.use: to purchase shirts, pants, skirts, T-shirts, underwear, stuffed animals, and bags for her business.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en: Leonardo is a father who has aimed to become successful in the future. He is 46 years old and has five school-age children. He has been a farmer for almost 18 years, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. He has aimed to increase his income to satisfy his family's needs and finance the education of his children. Due to a financial burden, he planned to expand his banana plantation to increase his production. He is asking for an additional capital of 20,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the maintenance of his crop production. He mentioned that through this loan, he can be able to plant more fruits and vegetables for sale. He is hoping that someday, he will have a fruitful harvest and give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the maintenance of his crop production.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es: Ana tiene 41 años de edad, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Nuevo Amanecer, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, es una familia muy unida y trabajadora. Ana desde hace 30 años comenzó con una pulpería, le costo ya que no tenia mucho capital ni la experiencia para realizarlo, trabaja en la pulpería apoyada por su esposo y la colaboración de dos de sus hijas, apertura el negocio a las 6:00 a.m. y cierra a las 10:00 p.m. y los fines de semana vende en el mayoreo. La ventaja de Ana es que el negocio le produce utilidades para el sostén familiar y pagar los compromisos, aparte que me permite educar y brindar salud cuando lo requiere toda la familia, además de poder servir a los vecinos vendiéndoles productos de primera necesidad. El préstamo que solicita lo necesita para la compra de arroz, azúcar, manteca, jabón, refrescos, churros, dulces, entre otros. Con la ayuda de este préstamo le facilitara el poder contar con recursos a bajos costos y hacer la inversión oportuna. Sus metas es avanzar en el aumento del inventario y hacer más grande el espacio físico de la pulpería. Ha recibido el apoyo de FAMA desde hace 10 años y ha cancelado sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Ana is 41 years old and is a member of the Nuevo Amanecer (“New Dawn”) group. She is married and has four children. It is a very united and hard-working family. Thirty years ago Ana opened a general store. It was difficult for her since she did not have any capital or experience. She works in the general store with the support of her husband and help of her two daughters. The store opens at 6am and closes at 10pm and on the weekends they sell wholesale. The advantage for Ana is that the business provides her with what she needs to support the family and pay the bills. It also allows her to pay for the education of and look after the health of all of the family. The business helps the neighbourhood by selling essential items. 

She is asking for a loan to buy rice, sugar, butter, soap, soft drinks, churros and sweets amongst other things. With the help of this loan she will be able to obtain resources at low cost and make the right investment. Her goal is to continue increasing her stock and increase the size of the store. She has been supported by FAMA for over 10 years and has made her loan repayments punctually.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise.

loans.name: Las Reynas Group

texts.es:
Buenas tardes!!!!!!!, tengan todos ustedes, saludos desde su hermano pais de Perú, hoy les presento al grupo formado por 8 socios, llamado LAS REYNAS, un grupo muy unido y formado por personas muy trabajadoras, que sacan adelante a su familia. una de estas sociasa es Yasvir Victoria, una mujer joven de 31 años casada, con dos hijos, el mayor de 11 años y el segundo con tan solo 4 años, vive con el padre de sus pequeños, quien se dedica a la albañilería, un trabajo muy poco remunerado en nuestro país. Es por eso que Yasvir, viendo que las carencias en su familia eran cotidianas, se decidió en formar su propio negocio y puso un puesto pequeño de venta de dulces de manera ambulatoria, al principio le fue dificil sacar adelante a su negocio y a su primer hijo, es por eso que su madre, con la que también vive, decide ayudarla con la crianza de su hijo, ella logró conseguir un sitio bien ubicado donde sus productos tenian mayor demanda, se ubicó frente a una Universidad que hay en su localidad, sus principales clientes son los jóvenes estudiantes universitarios de esa casa superior de estudios, como sus ventas mejoraron, solicitó el prestamo para la compra de más mercaderias como galletas, caramelos, snacks, gaseosas, etc.

Yasvir es cliente de EDAPROSPO ya un poco más de un año, está totalmente agradecida con KIVA y EDAPROSPO, por que apostaron por su negocio y creyeron en su palabra y en su sueño que era el de crecer en su negocio y darle calidad de vida a sus pequeños.

Yasvir viste con una casaca negra y polo blanco y es la primera de la derecha de la segunda fila.
texts.en:
Good afternoon!!!!! and greetings everyone for your brother country Peru. Today I present to you a group made up of 8 members called “LAS REYNAS”. It is a very united group and is made up of very hard-working people who want to help their families get ahead. 

One of these members is Yasvir Victoria, a young woman of 31 years of age who is married and has two children, the older of 11 years of age and the younger of just 4 years of age. She lives with the father of her children, who is a bricklayer, a job which is poorly paid in our country. For this reason Yasvir, seeing that her family had everyday needs which were not being met, decided to start her own business and opened a small stall to sell sweets in a mobile manner. At first it was difficult for her to make her business successful and look after her first child. For this reason her mother, with whom she also lives, decided to help her with looking after her son. She has been able to obtain a well-located place were her products are in higher demand. She has situated herself in front of the university of her town. Her main customers are the young university students. Since her sales have improved, she is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise such as biscuits, sweets, snacks and soft drinks. 

Yasvir has been a member of EDAPROSPO for just over a year, and is very grateful to KIVA and EDAPROSPO because they have supported her business and believed her word and in her dream which was to expand her business and give her children a good quality of life. Yasvir is wearing a black jacket and white shirt and is the first on the right side of the second row.

loans.use: to buy items such as sweets, snacks, soft drinks and biscuits.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Due to lack of job opportunities, Edward engages in vegetable production to earn a living and support his family's needs. He is 28 years old, married and has two infant-age children. He aims to earn and save more income for the future of his two children. He wants them to earn a degree and become professionals in the future. 

To increase his income, he planned to expand his vegetable production to increase his yields. Due to inadequate capital, he is asking for an additional 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed for the maintenance of his vegetable production. He is hoping that someday, he will improve his farming business and become financially stable to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed for maintenance of his vegetable production.
