His house is made of cement and has running water and electricity. Little by little improvements have been made but they have not arrived to his neighborhood. 

Victor has a stand where he sells vegetables and basic needs, which he sets up everyday in a well-known area such as his neighborhood plaza. The service that he provides is from the mornings until 4:00 in the evening because his neighborhood is a little dangerous and he must collect the unsold goods to store them in a safe place. With the loan that he is requesting, he is going to buy goods such as rice, sugar, flour by the quintal, foodstuffs, fruits, etc. He also hopes to fix up his house to open up his stand there and to be safer. He expects to increase his sales to pay back the loan punctually and continue working with D-Miro.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, flour, foodstuffs and preserved meats.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
This is Editha, 46, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Ernesto, a cook, and mother of her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Editha operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Editha earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, Editha is requesting a loan of  PHP 15,000. She will utilize the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Editha hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of giving her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings.

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Jesus, tiene 65 años de edad, ella es viuda y tiene 9 hijos. Ella es socia del grupo "Mujeres Solidarias", grupo que se encuentra en su décimo desembolso, caracterizadas por ser responsables y puntuales en sus pagos.
La Sra. jesus, se dedica desde hace cuatro años a la atención de su bodega de nombre "Cielo", negocio que inició gracias al apoyo de su hija, con la que inició éste trabajo, logrando en el transcurso del tiempo una independencia económica y cubrir sus primeras necesidades.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de productos de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, leche y otros.
texts.en:
Ms. Jesus, 65, is a widow and has nine children. She is a member of the "Mujeres Solidarias" [Women in Solidarity] group which is in its tenth disbursement, and is characterized by being responsible and punctual with their payments. 

Ms. Jesus has devoted herself, for the last four years, to tending to customers at her grocery store named "Cielo" [Sky], a business she began thanks to her daughter's support, with whom she began this work, achieving over time economic independence and the ability to cover basic needs. 

The loan she receives will be invested in the purchase of grocery products such as rice, sugar, and milk among other items.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, and milk for her store.

loans.name: Jose Dimas

texts.es: Jose tiene 50 años de edad y vive en Fortín un sector urbano de Guayaquil de poco tiempo de fundación. En este lugar hace varios años inicio su negocio de venta de productos farmacéuticos donde tenía lo indispensable y lo más solicitado, la idea le surgió porque siempre le a gustado ayudar a su vecindario y no había farmacias alrededor. En la actualidad su local está muy surtido y tiene competencia pero sus clientes son fieles por que les inspira confianza. La farmacia la abre desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, ofrece lo que es amevan, detan, mentol, vitaminas c, pañales, medicamentos, shampo etc. el atiende el negocio solo ya que su esposa es ama de casa y atiende a sus hijos, se siente productiva con la tienda es por eso que quiere ampliarla solicitando el crédito el cual empleara comprando medicamentos. Su meta a futuro es ampliar su negocio y poder contratar a alguien que le ayude con la atención para dedicarle más tiempo a su familia.
texts.en: José, 50, lives in Fortín, a recently-established urban sector of Guayaquil.  He started selling pharmaceuticals in this neighborhood a few years ago; he stocked the most indispensable, most in demand items.  He got the idea because he’s always liked to help out in his neighborhood and there were no nearby pharmacies.  His pharmacy is currently very well stocked and he has competition but his customers are very loyal to him because he inspires confidence.  The pharmacy is open from 8 in the morning until 7 at night.  He sells Amevan, Detan, menthol, vitamin C, diapers, remedies, shampoo, etc.  He tends to the business by himself because his wife’s a housewife and cares for their children.  He feels productive with the store and this is why he wants to expand it requesting the loan to buy medicine.  His future goal is to expand the business and to be able to hire someone to help him tend to customers so he can spend more time with his family.

loans.use: to buy medicine, vitamins, diapers, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Mariuxi Lorena

texts.es: Mariuxi a sus 33 años considero que de alguna manera debía ayudar en la economía familiar la cual estaba pasando por momentos un poco críticos, tomo la decisión de abrir en su domicilio una tienda de víveres y ofrecer sus productos en el bar de la escuela de la ciudad de Libertad que esta diagonal a su casa. Después de los permisos correspondientes empezó con la venta de comidas en el bar de esta forma a mejorado la situación económica en su familia. Ahora su tiempo lo distribuye en las mañanas atiende el bar en la escuela y en las tardes abre su tienda, algunas veces su esposo le ayuda ya que él es comerciante de mariscos y termina temprano la venta. Con el préstamo comprara productos para la tienda y víveres para la venta de comida en el bar. Espera a  futuro poder agrandar su tienda y abrir un local de venta de batidos en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Mariuxi, 33, determined that somehow or other she must help her family’s economy which was going through very critical moments.  She decided to open a home-based grocery store and to sell her products at a snack bar in a local school in the city of Libertad that is cattycorner from her house.  

Once she secured the necessary permits she started selling food in the snack bar and has been improving her family’s economic situation this way.  Now, she distributes her time spending mornings tending to the snack bar at school and then opens her store in the afternoon.  Sometimes her husband helps her since he’s a seafood merchant and finishes work early.  

She will use the loan to buy supplies for the store and food items to sell at the snack bar.  She hopes in future to enlarge her store and to open a blended fruit stand at home.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Ceferino

texts.es: El Señor Ceferino, habitante de la Concha junto a su  esposa e hijos han trabajado mucho  para salir adelante la esposa de don Ceferino es comerciante vende Frutas y verduras, tambien dos de sus hijos le ayudan con los gastos del hogar y a trabajar la tierra, actualmente don ceferino esta cultivando Piña y necesita darle mantenimiento para que sus piña sean de calidad y al momento de Venderlas se las pagen a un buen precio. Gracias a Afodenic quien atravez de fondo Kiva podra comprar los siguientes  insumos  para darle el mantenimiento devido: Urea, Completo, Geserox. Muy contento don Ceferino por la Confianza que le han Brindado y espera segir contando con este apoyo.
texts.en: Ceferino lives in La Concha with his wife and children.  They have worked hard to get ahead.  Ceferino’s wife is a fruit and vegetable merchant and two of his children also help with household expenses and to work the fields.  Currently, Ceferino is growing pineapples and needs to provide crop maintenance so that his pineapples will be good quality and will command good prices when sold.  Thanks to Afodenic through Kiva funds he will be able to buy the supplies needed to provide proper crop maintenance: urea, fertilizer and Geserox.  Ceferino is very happy about the trust being placed in him and hopes to be able to continue to rely on this support.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio César, tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero. Él está estudiando la carrera técnica de Inspección de Soldadura, carrera que tiene una duración de tres años de los cuales deberá estar culminándolo a fines de éste año. Es un joven muy competitivo, le gusta la carrera que ha elegido es por eso que se esfuerza al mñaximo para lograr superar sus metas.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en el pago de las mensualidades del instituto donde estudia.
texts.en:
Julio César is 23 years of age and single. He is studying for the technical degree of Quality Control in Welding, a course of studies which lasts three years which he should be finishing up by the end of this year. He is a very competitive young man and he likes the profession he has chosen so he gives maximum effort in order to be able to achieve his goals. 

The loan he receives will be invested in paying monthly fees at the institute where he is enrolled.

loans.use: to invest in the payment of monthly fees for his studies in Quality Control in Welding.

loans.name: Duo Raquel Group

texts.es:
DUO RAQUEL

Este grupo lo forman doña Dina Floridalma, ella tiene 2 hijos, y es casada, su esposo se dedica a la tapicería desde hace varios años, y nos cuenta que tiene un negocio de refacciones, y Chiles rellenos (envuelto con huevo de picado de verdura, ejote, papa, zanahoria y carne) nos cuenta que está muy contenta porque sus clientes han aumentado es por eso que está solicitando este crédito para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de chiles rellenos y más, ella espera que le puedan dar ese apoyo que ella necesita.
texts.en: Doña Dina Floridalma is part of the group "Duo Raquel" and has two children and is married. Her husband devotes himself to the upholstery business which he has done for a number of years. She tells us she has a fast food business making stuffed chile peppers (covered in egg and filled with minced vegetables, green beans, potatoes, carrots and meat). She tells us she is very happy because her clientele has grown, and so she is seeking this loan for purchasing ingredients for making stuffed chile peppers and other items. She hopes she may receive this support that she needs.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making stuffed chile peppers and other items.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 56 años, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su pareja es Jorge, con quien tiene seis hijos, quienes ya son mayores e independientes. Ahora viven en la casa que construyeron en el terreno que compraron juntos.
Su actividad es la venta de abarrotes en general como arroz, azúcar, aceites, fideos y otros, también vende gaseosas y golosinas. Para eso cuenta con una bodega instalada en su misma vivienda. Inició hace más de 3 años por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional, contando con un préstamo bancario, más un capital propio fruto de sus ahorros, los utilizó para comprar su mercadería en pequeñas cantidades, logrando hacerla crecer y aumentar. Le gusta su negocio, pues le permite estar en casa y contar con la tranquilidad de tener un ingreso económico, además del tiempo libre que lo puede emplear en el cuidado de su hogar.

Este es su préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes. Por eso se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en los créditos anteriores.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de abarrotes al por mayor, buscando los precios más bajos para obtener mejores ganancias. Él considera que a mayor cantidad y variedad, su negocio seguirá teniendo una buena acogida.
texts.en:
Rosa, 56, is a hardworking woman who very much wants to get ahead.  Her spouse is Jorge and they have six children who are all independent adults now.  They live in the house they built on the lot they bought together.

Her activity is selling groceries in general like rice, sugar, oil, noodles and others; she also sells soft-drinks and snacks.  To do so, she has a store installed at home.  She started it over three years ago because she needed to earn additional income.  She used a bank loan and some capital of her own from savings to buy merchandise in small amounts succeeding in making it grow and expand.  She likes her business because it allows her to stay home and gives her the peace of mind earning income provides; besides she can use her free time to care for her home.

This is loan #4 with MFP and she feels grateful for the financial support to make her plans a reality so she commits to make her installment payments like she’s done with previous loans.  She will use the requested 2500 new soles to buy groceries at wholesale looking for the best prices in order to earn higher profits.  She believes that with more variety and larger amounts her store will continue to be well-received.

loans.use: to buy mores stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es: Maria vive en Quevedo ciudad conocida por sus frutas y verduras, comenzó el negocio con poca mercadería y luego con lo que trabajaba compraba, fue así como su negocio creció poco a poco. Ella es madre de tres niños que están estudiando por lo que atiende el negocio sola. Actualmente ha podido ubicarse en la parte frontal de su casa donde saca un tablero y coloca las frutas en las cajas donde se las venden así se mantiene sin ningún estropeo. Se decidió por este negocio porque es de rápida venta ya que las frutas y verduras son de corta duración y sale rápido, también porque no da opción al crédito. En su puesto vende cebollas, pimientos, papa, choclos, toda clase de frutas de temporada, atiende desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche pero su día empieza a las 5 porque tiene que comprar los productos. Ella ha solicitado el préstamo para poder capitalizarse y así comprar las verduras y frutas que oferta. A futuro espera adecuar mejor un local lo que le permitiera mas descanso y mejoraría su servicio.
texts.en:
Maria lives in Quevedo, a city known for its fruits and vegetables.  She began her business with very little merchandise and later, with what she had gained by working, she bought more.  That is how her business grew, bit by bit.

She is the mother of three children who are studying, so she is the sole worker in her business.  Recently, she has been able to locate herself in the front part of her house, where she has a bulletin board and places the fruit in boxes where she sells them and thus she is able to maintain them without ruining any.

She decided upon this type of business because of the rapid sales, since fruits and vegetables have a short time in which they are good and they go bad very quickly.  Also this business doesn't give the option of credit.  At her place of business, she sells onions, peppers, potatoes, sweet corm, all different fruits in season, and she works from 7 in the morning until 8 at night, though her day begins at 5am because she has to go out and buy her products first.

She is asking for this loan in order to invest in her business and to buy the fruits and vegetables that are being offered.  In the future, she hopes to supply a better location that would allow her more time off and where she would be able to offer better service.

loans.use: onions, peppers, potatoes, sweet corn, and all types of fruit.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio empezó su vida comercial como pescador artesanal gracias a una pampa que recibió de parte de su padre, de esta manera pudo crecer económicamente y salir adelante con su familia. Pasado un tiempo aprendió el buceo por lo que empezó con el alquilar de equipos de buceo continuando con la pesca del pulpo y langosta. Ahora a sus 60 años realiza viajes turísticos y pesca deportiva trabajando en diferentes horarios junto a su hijo mayor a quien le gusta mucho esta profesión. El vive en Libertad junto a su esposa quien es ama de casa, uno de sus mayores preocupaciones por su edad es las enfermedades por lo que no está asegurado, en su negocio es a los ladrones quienes normalmente roban los motores de las lanchas. Con el préstamo Julio espera poder comprar redes, artículos de pesca para alquilar y darle mantenimiento a su lancha. Espera a futuro comprar otra lancha de fibra y un motor más potente.
texts.en:
Julio began his business as a small-scale fisherman, thanks to a region he was given by his father to fish, and in this way, he grew economically and helped out his family.  After a time, he learned diving and he began to rent out diving equipment, continuing to fish for octopus and lobster.  Now at age 60, he leads tourist voyages and sport fishing working at different hours alongside his eldest son, who really likes his profession.  He lives in Libertad with his wife, who is the keeper of the household.  One of his greatest worries is about his age and his health, and because he is not insured, he worries about the robbers who sometimes take the motors from boats.

With this loan, Julio hopes to buy nets, fishing equipment for rentals, and to do maintenance on his boat.  In the future, he wants to buy another boat made of fiberglass and a stronger motor.

loans.use: to buy nets and fishing items.

loans.name: Tres De Noiviembre  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal 3 de Noviembre está formado por 12 socias quienes viven por la parroquia Cumbe en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar de clima frió, por su geografía accidentada nos regala hermosos paisajes para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su centro parroquial tiene una arquitectura colonial y moderna. Su gente es amable y muy trabajadora se dedican en especial a la agricultura, cría de animales, al comercio y muchos laboran en la ciudad o han migrado a otros países en busca de un mejor futuro para sus familias.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Cumanda, tiene 27 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad, su primera hija está estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo presta los servicios como guardia de seguridad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá pero independientes.

Doña María Cumanda se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos ya que aun son pequeños, pero para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa se dedica al comercio de cobijas y edredones, esta actividad la desempeña hace 2 años y trabaja en sus tiempos libres y fines de semana.
 
Se encuentra en el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la
compra de cobijas y edredones para continuar con el negocio. 

Su meta es agrandar su negocio y tener un local propio.
texts.en:
The 3 de Noviembre communal bank is comprised of 12 members who live in the Cumbe parish in the city of Cuenca.   The city has a mountainous terrain and a cold climate. It is bathed by four rivers, which gift us with beautiful scenery to enjoy nature.   The parish center is a mixture of colonial and modern architecture. The people are kind and very hard-working. They make a living in agriculture, livestock breeding, and many people work daily in the city or have migrated to other countries looking for a better future for their families.

One of the members of this group is María Cumanda.  She is 27 years old, married, and has two children, ages six and two.  Her oldest daughter goes to a local school.  Her husband works as a security guard.  They do not have their own house, so they live in an independent manner in her mother’s house.

María Cumanda devotes herself to the household chores and the care of her children because they are still little.  However, in order to help her husband with the household expenses she sells blankets and quilts.  She has been engaged in this business activity for two years, and she works during her free time and on the week-ends.

This is her third loan with her communal bank.  She will use it to buy blankets and quilts in order to continue with the business.  Her goal is to make her business bigger and to have her own place.

loans.use: to buy blankets and quilts.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 22 años, es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor, además de tener muchas ganas de salir adelante. Es soltero, vive en la casa de su madre, con ella, su hermano, su cuñado y su sobrino.
Su actividad es la venta de comida rápida, como pollo broaster y frituras, para lo cual cuenta con un carrito freidor que instala en el frontis de su vivienda todas las noches. Inició hace más de 2 años, contando con el apoyo de su madre en la preparación y atención al público. Le gusta su negocio, pues le permite tener un ingreso económico y una ocupación, ya que le falta terminar sus estudios técnicos en computación y con las ganancias está pagando sus estudios, además de poder apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar. Está ahorrando para el futuro, pues su meta es constituir su propia empresa de reparación de computadoras.

Este es su préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP y se siente agradecido con el apoyo financiero para poder concretar sus planes. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera personas responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de utensilios de cocina, mesas y sillas. Así también ingredientes para la preparación de sus platillos, como papas, carne de pollo y verduras.
texts.en:
Jorge, 22, is a hardworking, enterprising man who very much wants to get ahead.   He’s single living in his mother’s house with her, his brother, his brother-in-law and his nephew.

His activity is selling fast food like Broaster chicken and fried snacks.   He has a cart with a fryer he sets up in front of his house every evening.  He started this over two years ago; his mother helps him both to cook and to tend to the public.  He likes his business because it allows him to earn income and have an occupation because he hasn’t finished his computer technician courses and is using profits to pay for his schooling.  In addition, he’s able to help his parents with household expenses.  He’s saving for the future because his goal is to build his own computer repair firm.

This is MFP loan #5 and he is grateful for the financial support he’s gotten to reach his goals.  Also, he’s comfortable in his communal bank because he knows the members and considers them to be responsible people.

He will use the requested 2500 new soles to buy kitchen utensils, tables and chairs as well as ingredients to prepare his dishes like potatoes, chicken and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, utensils, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Paola Estefania

texts.es: Paola tiene 23 años y vive en el norte de Guayaquil conocido como las Orquídeas, alquila un departamento junto a su esposo y su hija de 10 meses. Ella ayuda a su esposo con la economía del hogar vendiendo ropa, el negocio lo inicio junto a una tía a quien le ayudaba ganado una comisión por venta, una vez que aprendió el negocio se independizo con la ayuda de su esposo para el capital que necesitaba. Actualmente vende de lunes a domingos desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, esto lo hace porque ya tiene sus clientes. Entre los artículos que ofertan están interiores, jeans, blusas. De momento a Paola no se le a presentado ningún inconveniente ya que sus clientes le comunican los pedidos y ella los encarga y entrega. Espera obtener el crédito porque desea invertir más en la ropa para tener más ganancias. Su sueño es poder tener su casa propia  y terminar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en: Paola is twenty-three years old, and lives in Las Orquídeas in the north of Guayaquil. She rents an apartment with her husband and her ten-month old daughter. She helps her husband with the household finances by selling clothing. She started her business with an aunt whom she used to help while earning a sales commission. Once she learned the business, she started her own business with her husband’s help for the startup capital she needed. Currently, she sells clothing Monday to Sunday, from nine in the morning until six in the evening. She works this way because she already has customers. Among the articles she offers are undergarments, jeans, and blouses. Up until now, Paola has not had any problems because her customers let her know their orders, and she takes care of them and delivers them. She hopes to receive a loan because she would like to invest in more clothing so she can have greater earnings. Her dream is to be able to have her own house and finish her university studies.

loans.use: to purchase undergarments, jeans, and blouses.

loans.name: Manuel Gonzalo

texts.es:
Manuel Gonzalo, tiene 21 años de edad, el estudiante de la carrera de administración de empresas, viene cursando el segundo año de su carrera en la Universidad Cesar vallejo. Manuel Gonzalo desea que al terminar de estudiar pueda administrar su propia empresa y poder generar empleo, su madre es su mayor inspiración para sus deseos de superación profesional además desea retribuirle todo el esfuerzo que ha hecho para poder apoyarlo con el pago de sus estudios.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en el pago de sus mensualidades, ya que al cancelar el total podrá obtener un descuento.
texts.en:
Manuel Gonzalo is 21 years old and a student in the field of business administration.  He is currently in his second year of study at the University of Cesar Vallejo.  Manuel Gonzalo wants to finish his studies so that he can run his own business and create employment for others.  His mother is his greatest inspiration for trying to succeed professionally, and he also wants to give back something for all the strength and effort that she has put into helping him pay for his studies.

The loan he is receiving will be invested in the payment of his monthly tuition fees, since if he can make all of them he will get a discount.

loans.use: to pay his monthly fees for the college study of administration.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to his party center and to buy more soft-drinks to sell.

loans.name: Angela Emerita

texts.es: Angela vive en el Suburbio sector sur de Guayaquil, a sus 35 años se encuentra separa y vive sola ya que todos sus hijos son mayores de edad. Hace varios años empezó con la venta de ropa y cosméticos por catalogo gracias a una amiga quien le insistió para que lo hiciera, hoy en día vende a sus familiares, amigos y conocidos del barrio donde realiza sus recorridos. Entre los productos que oferta están los perfumes, desodorantes, blusas y pantalones. Realiza la venta de lunes a sábado a cualquier horario, le gusta la actividad que desarrolla ya que esta activa y sobre todo le da ganancias. Con el crédito espera comprar mercadería para la venta que le hace mucha falta. Su sueño más grande es poder tener su propia revista de modas por catálogos.
texts.en:
Angela lives in the suburban southern area of Guayaquil, and at age 35 finds herself separated from her spouse and lives alone, since all her children are grown up.  Several years ago, she began a business of clothing and cosmetics sales via catalog thanks to a friend who insisted that she should try it.  These days, she sells to her family, friends, and acquaintances in the neighborhood where she makes her route.  Among the products she offers are perfumes, deodorants, blouses, and pants.

She sells products from Monday to Saturday throughout the day, and she likes the work she does, since it allows her to be active and above all to make a profit.  With the loan she will receive, she hopes to buy merchandise that she really needs for sale.  Her greatest dream is to be able to have her own fashion review in catalogs.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, deodorants, blouses, and pants.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 31 años, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su pareja es Leonidas, quien se dedica al transporte, fruto de esa unión tienen tres hijos de 11, 8 y 3 años de edad.
Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de dulces y de una bebida regional denominada “masato” que se prepara a base de yuca. Los dulces los aprendió gracias a la enseñanza de un familiar, los cuales vende de forma ambulatoria, caminando por las diferentes zonas de su localidad. Se inicio en este negocio hace 6 meses, pero adicionalmente también vende productos de belleza por catalogo desde hace 8 años. Le agrada su nuevo negocio, pues le permite tener un ingreso económico para solventar la manutención de sus hijos, además de tener una ocupación, ya que no tuvo la oportunidad de terminar sus estudios y tuvo dificultades para conseguir un empleo. Viendo estas dificultades y las necesidades económicas se decidió por iniciar otro negocio a parte de los cosméticos. Ahora, viendo que logra terminar todos sus productos, tiene planes de invertir y abrir una fuente de soda en su casa.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con la institución MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Además de sentirse cómoda con su banco comunal, pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de ingredientes (azúcar, aceites, harina, almidón, mantequilla y otros) para la preparación de dulces a precio por mayor para así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sandra, 31, is a hardworking, determined woman who very much wants to get ahead.  Her spouse is Leonidas who works in transportation.  They have three children who are 11, 8 and 3 years of age.

She makes sweets and a regional beverage called “masato” that’s made from manioc to sell.  She learned how to make the sweets thanks to a family member who taught her; she sells them from place to place walking through various areas of her location.  She started this business six months ago but she’s also been selling cosmetics via catalogue for the last 8 years.  

She likes her new business because it produces income to cover her children’s food and it provides her with an occupation since she wasn’t able to complete her schooling and getting a job was difficult.  In face of these difficulties and her economic need, she opted to start another business in addition to the cosmetics.  Now, seeing that she’s able to finish all her products, she plans to invest in and open a soda fountain at home.

This is her fourth MFP loan and she’s very happy to know that she’ll have financial support because she will feel sure of making progress with her business.  In addition, she feels at ease in her communal bank because she considers it to be a united, supportive group.

She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy ingredients for her sweets like sugar, oil, flour, starch, butter and others at wholesale prices in order to earn higher profits.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her desserts.

loans.name: Lola

texts.es:
Lola tiene 48 años, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de amable y cordial. Está casada con Cesar, quien es contador de profesión, fruto de esa unión tienen dos hijos de 18 y 16 años.
}Ella se dedica al cultivo de palma aceitera, tiene un terreno de 10 hectáreas en las cuales tiene sembrado palma aceitera la cual está en producción, ya que lleva en el negocio poco más de 4 años y ahora se dedica a la cosecha y venta. Le gusta su negocio, pues le permite contar con un ingreso económico adicional con el cual solventar sus gastos, así como sentirse ocupada y una mujer empresaria, con muchas ganas de sobresalir. Por lo contrario, lo que no le gusta es cuando su motocarro se malogra y le ocasiona muchos gastos en vez de ganancias, pero eso no la desanima ya que cuenta con otros ingresos, con los cuales puede apoyarse.

Este es su préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Así como se siente a gusto con su banco comunal, pues los considera buenas personas.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de abono y herbicidas para el mantenimiento de sus plantas de palma aceitera.
texts.en:
Lola, 48, is a hardworking, determined woman aside from also being cordial and kind.  She’s married to Cesar who is an accountant by profession.  They have two children who are 18 and 16 years of age.

She grows oil producing palms.  She has a 10-hectare parcel planted with palms that are in production and she’s been in this business a little more than four years; she harvests and sells.  She likes her business because it produces an additional source of income to cover her expenses and she likes to feel useful and to be a businesswoman who very much wants to stand out.  On the other hand, what she dislikes is when her car breaks down and instead of profits she incurs costs.  But this does not discourage her since she has other income she can rely on.

This is MFP loan #6 and she expects to continue with her objectives.  She also feels good in her communal bank because she considers them to be good people.

She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy manure and herbicide to care for her oil palm crops.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn. She previously accessed a 17,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan that she utilized to purchase farm inputs needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and other tools for maintenance of the farm. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marilyn dreams that her business will grow and expand. She also wants to help her family financially. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase gardening and plant nursery supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Rosa empezó su negocio gracias a la ayuda del gobierno del Ecuador quien a través del una ayuda conocida como el bono de desarrollo recibió un capital para poder iniciar su negocio. Gracias al emprendimiento que tuvo con su tienda y su excelente administración de la misma ha incrementado su capital y sus ventas crecen día a día. A sus 29 años se siente satisfecha de haber conseguido muchos logros en poco tiempo es por eso que continua trabajando de lunes a domingo sin descanso y horario establecido. En su tienda ofrece gran variedad de productos como snacks, confiterías, víveres, arroz, azúcar etc., lo que va a comprar con el crédito cuando se lo otorguen. A futuro espera poder ampliar su local en Libertad, con la ayuda de su esposo y lo que reuniría de su negocio conseguirá su meta en poco tiempo.
texts.en:
Rosa began her business with the help of the government of Ecuador, as a result of aid known as the development bonus, she received funding to start her business.  Thanks to the entrepreneurial aid given to her business and to her excellent administration of it, she has increased her capital and her sales are increasing daily as well.  

At age 29, she feels satisfied to have been able to have such success in such a short time, and because of this, she continues to work every Monday through Sunday without resting, and on a firm schedule.  In her business, she offers a great variety of products, like snacks, sweets, produce, rice, sugar, etc. which she plans to buy more of with her loan when it is given to her.  In the future, she hopes to expand her location in Libertad with the help of her spouse and with what she is making from her business, she will achieve her goal in a short time.

loans.use: to buy snacks, sweets, produce, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Adera

texts.en: Adera is a 48-year-old mother of three children living Bundibugyo, Uganda. She sells second-hand clothes, and she got her initial capital after selling cocoa, which she grows. Inadequate capital to purchase stock is one main hardship she faces. She has a personal goal of educating her children to higher institutions, and moving her business to a more permanent location is her business goal. The purpose of the loan is to buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 32-year-old married man with three children, living in Kyenjojo in Uganda. For the past eight years he has been growing bananas for commercial purposes. He accumulated capital from selling maize and beans and bought land, which he is currently farming. He faces the problem of seasonal weather changes, theft, high fuel and transportation. He has a personal goal of buying a car for easy transportation, and a business goal of buying land to expand his banana plantation. Emmanuel needs the loan to buy land to expand his plantation.

loans.use: to buy land to expand his plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open her own exhibition.

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Lang is a 26-year-old married woman who permanently lives in Baray district with her family: her husband and one young kid. To earn a living, Lang is involved in a farming business as well as a hog-raising business. She primarily grows annual rice crops and spends the rest of her time raising piglets for fattening at home. Lang has been in this business for many years and typically generates around KHR 8,400 per day through her efforts. 

Lang wants to continually improve her current business and thus increase her household income. Due to a lack of capital, she has applied for additional capital of KHR 1,200,000 to purchase more piglets and feed. She has a strong determination to succeed in her business. She believes that her family living status will be better gradually onwards.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets and feed.

loans.name: Elina

texts.es:
Elina tiene 55 años, es una mujer muy decidida y empeñosa, además de alegre y amable. Su pareja es Eleuterio, quien se dedica a la construcción civil, y es el padre de su hijo de 13 años. Juntos viven en la casa que construyeron en el terreno que compraron con mucho esfuerzo a los largo de los años.

Ella se dedica a la venta de agua por tubería a sus vecinos, tiene un pozo de 80 metros de profundidad donde extrae agua limpia y pura. Inicialmente perforó su pozo para uso propio, pero viendo la necesidad y solicitudes de sus vecinos decidió instalar tuberías para hacerles llegar el agua hasta sus domicilios. Luego fueron acercándose más personas solicitando este servicio, creciendo su negocio y necesitando mayor capacidad en su tanque y la bomba sumergible para extraer el agua. Inicio hace más de 15 años, con un capital propio y hasta el momento le apoya su pareja, quien se encarga del mantenimiento de las redes de tuberías y limpieza del tanque de agua. Ahora se siente más tranquila económicamente y tiene planes de mejorar la infraestructura de su pozo y tuberías para servir a más personas.

Este es su préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Por lo que se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los anteriores créditos, de esa manera tener un buen record crediticio.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de tuberías y teflones para realizar el mantenimiento y ampliación de sus redes a nuevos clientes. También invertirá en el mantenimiento de la bomba de agua sumergible.
texts.en:
Elina, age 55, is a very determined and diligent woman.  She is also cheerful and kind.  Her life partner, Eleuterio, works in civil construction, and he is the father of their 13 year old son.  They live together in the house they built on land that they bought through a lot of effort over the years.

She sells piped water to her neighbors.  She has a well that is 80 meters deep from which she gets clean and pure water.  Initially she drilled the well for her own use.  However, seeing the need and the requests from her neighbors, she decided to install pipes to get the water to their homes.

Then, more people were approaching her and requesting this service.   Her business is growing, and she needs greater capacity in her tank and the submersible pump in order to extract the water.  She started over 15 years ago with her own capital.  So far her husband supports her by taking care of the maintenance of the network of pipes and by cleaning the water tank.   She is now more at ease financially.  She has plans to improve her well’s infrastructure and pipes in order to service more people.

This is her tenth loan with MFP.  She hopes to continue on with her objectives.  She pledges to make her payments, as she did with the previous loans.  This is the way to have a good credit record.

She will use the requested 2,000 soles to buy pipes and Teflon for the maintenance and amplification of the networks for her new customers.  She will also invest in the maintenance of the submersible pump.

loans.use: to provide maintenance on her water pump and to enlarge her network.

loans.name: Khoem

texts.en:
Khoem was photographed at side of her own house situated in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She lives there with her spouse and two single children. She is 29 years old and an industrious woman who devotes her full time to a farming business as well as to her household. She has been farming rice since 2005 to make a living. Khoem also has some skills in making some types of bamboos baskets for additional income. She does this work at home, especially when she has free time from farming. However, the income she earns is just to meet the needs for her daily food. 

Khoem’s husband, who is the main income provider of the family, plans to work as a paid laborer over a six-month period in a neighbor country in order to make his family financially stabe. Working as a paid laborer in the neighbor country will offer him a higher payment than what he does in his own country. With regard to this, Khoem decided to ask for a loan from lenders in order to help her husband. She wants to obtain a loan in the amount of KHR 1,500,000 to supplement her savings to pay for document charges and his passport. Khoem hopes that she and her husband will be able to uplift their family out of poverty and provide a good living standard to all of her children someday.

loans.use: to pay for document charges and the passport of her husband.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 35-year-old married man with four children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He trades cattle and has been in this business for 15 years. He is faced with challenges of price fluctuation and inflation. 

Moses has personal goals of building a permanent home and educating his children. His business goal is to expand his business into new market areas. Moses wants a loan to buy cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohamad is a university student in his last year with a major in Computer Science. He has been paying for his own education and now he hopes to get the loan so he can graduate and go for his Master’s degree.

loans.use: To pay for his semester so he can graduate

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
This is Lita, 48, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Gerly, her business partner, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Lita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Lita dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Alessandro

texts.es:
Alessandro tiene 28 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y empeñoso, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Aun es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en compañía de sus padres y sus tres hermanos en la casa de sus padres.
Su actividad es la venta de comidas típicas de la región, como “juanes” (arroz envuelto en una hoja), pollo frito, arroz chaufa y otros. Para eso, todas las noches se instala en el frontis de vivienda donde pone unas mesitas y sillas para atender a sus clientes (sus vecinos y transeúntes). Lleva realizando esta actividad desde hace 4 años, logrando hacerse conocido y solicitado por su buena sazón, atiende con la ayuda de madre y un ayudante, ocasionalmente. Adicionalmente, tiene un empleo de medio tiempo, por las mañanas, en una empresa encuestadora, contando de esa manera con varios ingresos económicos.

Este es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP y está muy a gusto con su banco comunal, pues lo considera un grupo unido y responsable en sus pagos.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de los ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas (arroz, azúcar, aceites, etc.) y utensilios como platos, vasos y demás para su negocio.
texts.en:
Alessandro is 28 years old and is a very hardworking and dedicated person with a lot of motivation to succeed.  He is single and has no children.  He loves together with his parents and three siblings in the home of his parents.

His business is in the sales of traditional foods of his region, like "juanes" (rice wrapped in a leaf), fried chicken, mixed rice, and others.  For this purpose, every night he places himself in the front part of the house, where he has placed some small tables and chairs to wait upon his customers (his neighbors and others).  He has been working at this business for the past 4 years, succeeding in making himself known and requested because of his great seasonings.  He waits on customers with the help of his mother and one assistant, occasionally.  In addition, he has a part-time job in the mornings, in a polling office, and this helps him to make some money.

This is his third loan from MFP and he really likes his community bank, since he considers it to be a very united and responsible group about thier payments.

With the money he asks for, 1,500 Soles, he will invest in buying ingredients for the preparation of his foods (rice, sugar, oils, etc.) as well as utensils like plates, cups, and the rest for his business.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients necessary for the preparation of his food, and also to buy utensils for the kitchen (plates, cups, etc.).

loans.name: Gadi

texts.en: Gadi is a 42-year-old gentleman living in Kagadi, Uganda. For seven years he has been selling maize and beans and the business has enabled him to provide the basics for his family. He started this business with capital from the proceeds of growing maize and beans. He says inadequate capital is a factor affecting the business. He would like to educate his children and also own a food store that can sustainably supply the region. Gadi wants a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Saimir

texts.en:
Saimir is 29 years old, recently married, and lives in central-eastern Albania. Over the last four years, he has been operating an auto repair/car wash service and the profit has been going well, especially the last couple of years, when the number of residents in the region has been growing rapidly due to their return from Greece, to which they emigrated some years ago.
Saimir is requesting a loan for the first time, to purchase an air compressor.  He believes that by adding a new compressor, he will be able to serve more and, undoubtedly, make more profit.  He also plans to expand his business and hire someone to help him. 
Saimir would like to thank all Kiva lenders and let them know that he appreciates their kindness.

loans.use: To buy an air compressor

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a 57-year-old married man with five children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a farmer and has been in this sector for 6 years. He started the business by growing a few tea seedlings at home and later bought extensive land here. He now grows tea on a large scale. 

Justus wants a loan to buy tea seedlings for planting. He is faced with the challenges of seasonal weather changes and the high cost of aggro inputs. 

Justus has personal goals of educating his children and buying land to grow more tea.

loans.use: to buy tea seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent is a 42-year-old gentleman who lives in Kagadi, Uganda. For three years he has been trading in produce, specifically maize and beans. He started this business with capital from proceeds from growing maize and beans. He says inadequate capital is a factor affecting his business, as there is a wide and ready market. He would like to educate his seven children, buy a car to facilitate transportation, and own a large food store in town. Innocent wants a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Lina

texts.es:
Lina tiene 54 años, es una mujer trabajadora y entusiasta, además de alegre y extrovertida. Está  casada con Landes, quien se dedica al transporte, y es le padre de sus tres hijos. Vive con su hijo Iván, de 30 años de edad, en la casa que construyeron en un terreno que fue herencia de su pareja.

Ella se dedica a la costura y confección de prendas de vestir y lencería para damas, caballeros. Oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional. Se inició como independiente hace 19 años con una máquina de coser que compró con su propio capital, instalándose en su vivienda, en la actualidad ya tiene dos máquinas para diferentes acabados. Considera que su negocio es bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja, además le gusta porque se distrae y se siente una persona productiva. 

Este es su préstamo número 8 con la institución MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntal con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Además de sentirse a gusto con los miembros de su banco comunal, pues los considera personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 3500 nuevos soles, comprará dos máquinas recubridoras valorizadas en 200 y 350 nuevos soles cada una. También comprará materiales de costura (telas, hilos, elásticos y otros), buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Lina is 54 years old and an enthusiastic and hard-working woman, who also is happy and extroverted.  She is married to Landes, who is in transportation, and he is that father of her three children.  She lives with her son Ivan, who is 30 years old in the house they built on a parcel of land that her partner inherited.

She is involved in the sewing and creation of clothing and lingerie for women and men.  This is a job which she learned by studying in an occupational education center.  She began to work independently 19 years ago with a sewing machine that she bought with her own money, installing it in her own home, and now she has two machines that she uses for different finishes.  She thinks her business is very useful for the good income that it gives her, and she also likes it because it is a distraction and makes her feel like a productive person.

This is her 8th loan with MFP, so she promises she will be punctual with her payments, just as she has been in the past.  In addition to feeling happy about the other members of the community bank, she thinks they are responsible and sympathetic.

With the money she asks for, 3,500 Soles, she will buy two refurbished machines valued at 200 and 350 Soles each.  Also, she will buy sewing materials (fabrics, threads, elastic, and others), looking for lower prices and buying in bulk.

loans.use: to buy two new machines for her sewing business and also sewing materials.

loans.name: Renegia

texts.en:
This is Renegia, 56, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Eddie, a pedicab driver, and is a mother to her four children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Renegia manages her Side Car transportation business. She has three units of side cars or bicycle carts that carry up to two passengers to their destination within the community. Her regular customers are workers and employees in the community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, Renegia is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000. She will utilize the loan to pay for spare parts and maintenance of the pedicab unit. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Renegia hopes to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of the pedicab unit.

loans.name: By

texts.en:
By appears in the photo with her husband. Both of them are in the same business, of cultivating rice crops on about two and a half hectares of farmland. From the business, they are able to raise their five children and can afford to send them to school. By is 54 years of age and she has been farming for more than 30 years. With her many years of experience, By is expert in taking care of her rice crops and ensuring abundant harvests each year, except for the year of a big flood. However, the way she does farming is still based on the traditional method. 

Due to the rainy season, By has a lot of farm work to complete and she also needs additional capital to pay for her operating expenses. To help her in the business, she would like to borrow some funds from Kiva lenders to pay for plowing fees, labor costs, and to purchase fertilizers to care for her crops. She has been with HKL six times already and she paid off those loans successfully. This will be her seventh loan and she hopes to receive it, to continually improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees, labor costs, and to purchase fertilizers to care for her crops.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.en:
Narciso is a hardworking and decent man. He is 40 years of age and the father of three children. His wife helps him in their farming business. They own a small plot of land where they grow rice. They were blessed with this source of income, which needs extra attention and labor to provide a good income. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizers, seeds to sow and pesticides to maintain his plants. 

He wishes to improve their living conditions through this loan to secure the education and future of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds to sow and pesticides to maintain his plants

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis vive en Quevedo donde tiene una venta de mariscos la cual empezó hace varios años, aprendió el negocio trabajando con un amigo y luego se independizo. Reunió un capital con el cual pudo adquirir un triciclo el cual acondiciono para la venta. El negocio lo realiza con varios amigos quienes se reúnen y salen a pescar luego comparten la pesca y realizan la venta de manera individual. Realizan la labor de esta manera ya que así pagan a por porcentajes el alquiler de la lancha y minoran sus costos. Entre sus productos están el pescado de mar que le cuesta $1.20 y vende a $ 4.70 el pescado de rio $ 1.00 y vende a $ 2.50 y el camarón de $ 2.00 vende a $ 4.00 la libra, el negocio es rentable cuando hay pesca. Tiene 3 hijos que están estudiando en la escuela fiscal y su esposa le ayuda en la venta. El crédito que solicita es para tener capital y poder comprar los productos, le gustaría a futuro tener un carro para mejorar el negocio y poder hacer fletes mejorando su economía.
texts.en:
Luis lives in Quevedo where he has a seafood stand which he began several years ago. He learned the business working with a friend and later he became independent. He collected some capital with which he could buy a tricycle which he outfitted for his stand. 

His work is done with several friends who get together to go fishing, later sharing the fish, but selling individually. Doing the work in this way they are sharing the rental fee of the boat and lowering their costs. 

Among their products are ocean fish that cost $1.20 and sell at $4.70, and river fish that are $1.00 selling for $2.50 and the shrimp that are from $2 selling at $4.00 a pound. The business is profitable when there is fish. 

He has three children that are studying in the government school and his wife helps with sales. He is asking for a loan in order to have capital to buy products. He would like in the future to have a car in order to improve his business and to be able to provide freight to improve his finances.

loans.use: to buy fish and shrimp

loans.name: Nyakyanika 11 Women Group

texts.en: Damas is a 29-year-old married man with four children living in Masindi, Uganda. For the last six years, he has been trading in fish. Price fluctuations and inflation hinder his activity. His dream is to build a permanent house and move his business to a more permanent location. Damas intends to use the loan to buy fish to sell. He is a member of the above-mentioned group, whose members guarantee each other in order to access a loan.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok, aged 38, manages a farming business and a hog-raising business. She lives in Siem Reap province with her spouse and four children. She has been working in this field for 16 years. Despite her hardships, Sok hopefully commits herself to improving her current businesses and someday improving her standard of living.

As of now, Sok is requesting a loan in the amount of USD 500 to buy the fertilizers and feed required for her businesses. She hopes to increase her income through this loan, which will allow her to provide the basic necessities for all her children, especially education.

loans.use: to buy the fertilizers and feed required for her businesses.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a 29-year-old married man, with two children.  He lives in Kagadi, Uganda.  A teacher by profession, he has been in service for two years. 

He has personal goals of educating his children up to the University and building a permanent house to live in.  Elisa intends to use the loan to buy cement, iron sheets, sand, and bricks for building his house.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron sheets, sand, and bricks for building his house.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is from Zarqa, in Jordan.  She is the mother of two; her husband  works as a blacksmith. 

Amal works in trading from her home, selling bed covers to her neighbors.  She hopes to get a loan so she can increase the variety of her products and enlarge her customer base.

loans.use: To increase the variety of her products.

loans.name: Saby

texts.es:
Saby tiene 33 años, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, con muchas ganas de sobresalir.  Está separada del padre de su hija. Ahora vive en casa de sus padres, con ellos y su hija de 8 años.
Su negocio es una librería, para eso arregló un espacio de su vivienda donde implementó una vitrina con los artículos que vende, de esa manera se ahorra el gasto de alquilar un local. Su librería lleva más de 5 meses de funcionamiento, tiempo en cual ha llegado a ser muy conocida y concurrida, contando con el apoyo de su esposo para la atención al público, en sus ratos libres. Por otro lado, también se dedica a la venta de madera que envía a la capital. Considera que ambos negocios le son rentables por las buenas ganancias que le dejan, además tiene la tranquilidad de brindarle lo mejor a su pequeña hija, y sentirse una mujer productiva.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, por lo que se siente agradecida por la confianza que ponen en ella.
Con el préstamo de 1200 nuevos soles comprará más artículos de librería, de variados modelos y a precio por mayor. Considera que a mayor variedad más acogida tendrá su negocio.
texts.en:
Saby is 33 years old and is a hardworking and entrepreneurial woman with a lot of motivation to succeed.  She is separated from the father of her daughter.  She now lives in her parents' home with them and with her 8 year old daughter.

Her business is a bookstore, and for this she rearranged her house and placed a glass case in it with all the items she sells.  In this way, she avoids the cost of renting another space.  Her bookstore has been in business for more than 5 months, in which time she has become well known and popular, relying on the support of her husband to do publicity in his free time.  In the mean time, she also sells wood, which she sends to the capital.  She thinks both businesses are a great advantage for the profits they give her, and she also has the means to give the best to her daughter and feels like a productive woman.

This is her second loan with MFP, and she feels thankful that they have placed their confidence in her.

With the loan of 1,200 Soles, she will buy more bookstore items, of a variety of types, at a bulk sales price.  She thinks that with a greater variety of items, her store will be more desirable.

loans.use: to buy more stationery items to increase her supplies.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana is a 37-year-old mother of five.  She lives with her husband and kids in a rented apartment. 

Hana works as photographer at a photography studio, in addition to having her own camera and working on her own after work. She hopes to buy a new camera so she can start her own studio and help her husband with their expenses and household.

loans.use: To buy a new camera and start her own studio.

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en:
Chhay is 63 years old.  She is a single parent who is responsible for four children: two married children and two single children. She wishes to see her children have higher education in their future, so she has striven to work hard to support them.

Chhay does farming, and she would like to borrow KHR 700,000 to purchase fertilizers to put in her soil.  

She hopes this loan will enable her maintain her business and increase the household income. She is confident to pay her loan back on time as scheduled.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to put her soil.

loans.name: Federico

texts.es:
Federico tiene 36 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y emprendedor. Su pareja es Greysi, la madre de su único hijo, Osmar de 13 años. Viven los tres juntos, con su madre, su hermana y un sobrino, en la casa de su madre.
Tiene una pequeña bodega en su vivienda donde atiende las necesidades de sus vecinos, quienes son sus principales clientes. Pero también se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su motocarro. Con la bodega se inició hace más de 20 años y la considera rentable por las ganancias que le deja, ya que por la zona no hay más personas que tengan este negocio y la variedad de productos que él ofrece. Le gusta porque se distrae y se siente un hombre  productivo, pues logra pagar los gastos del hogar, ya que tenía la necesidad de ampliar sus ingresos. 

Este será su préstamo número 16 con la institución MFP y se siente contento de poder contar con un apoyo de capital de trabajo y como desea seguir contando con esta ayuda, se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de abarrotes de primera necesidad para surtir su bodega, como arroz, aceites, gaseosas y golosinas.
texts.en:
Federico is 36 years old and a hardworking and entrepreneurial man.  His partner is Greysi, the mother of his only son, Osmar, aged 13 years.  The three of them live together with his mother, sister, and one nephew in his mother's house.

He has a small grocery store in his home, where he attends to the necessities of his neighbors, who are his primary customers.  But he is also involved in the business of transportation, transporting passengers in his motorcar.  With the grocery he began more than 20 years ago, he thinks he's doing well, since it brings in a profits, and in his area there aren't any other people who have this type of business or the variety of products that he offers.  He likes the work because it distracts him and he feels very productive, and he is able to pay the household expenses, since he needs to have a greater income.

This will be his 16th loan with MFP and he feels content that he is able to count on the support of working capital, and since he wants to be able to continue having this help, he promises to make timely payments on his loan.

With the amount he is asking for, 1,500 Soles, he will invest in groceries of the most necessary kinds to fill his store, like rice, oils, drinks, and sweets.

loans.use: to buy more groceries, drinks, and sweets for his shop.

loans.name: Arquimedes

texts.es:
Arquímedes tiene 49 años, es un hombre bueno y trabajador. Está casado con María, de 51 años, con quien tiene cinco hijos, de los cuales, cuatro ya son mayores e independientes, y solo Carolina, de 15 años, está a su lado. Él vive con ellas, en su casa propia, la que forjó con mucho esfuerzo y donde trabaja mucho para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.

Él se dedica a las actividades en sector agrícola, específicamente a la siembra de productos regionales como plátano, arroz, yuca y otros. Tiene una chacra propia donde acondiciona en el terreno preparándolo para que genere los mejores productos en la temporada de cosecha. Lleva 15 años trabajando con este negocio y aún recuerda que al principio padeció mucho, sin embargo siguió adelante y pudo lograrlo. Siente que es mucho mejor trabajar de manera independiente que hacerlo bajo la autoridad de otras personas, como lo hacía antes, ya que asegura que siempre fue víctima de abuso laboral. En los momentos que va a su chacra tiene la ayuda de algunas personas que contrata y de quienes se siente muy agradecido, ya que le apoyan mucho para poder realizar bien su trabajo. Afortunadamente le está yendo bien, ya que lleva siempre presente consigo un lema que dice: “Las personas cosechan lo que siembran” y agrega “en el lugar que siembran”, frase que asegura él aplica a todas las áreas de su vida. Espera que su situación económica siga mejorando para ir ahorrando lo necesario para que pueda llevar una vejez tranquila al lado de su pareja.

Este es el crédito número 6 que tiene con MFP, por ello agradece a las personas que hacen posible su crédito. Además se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, como lo hizo en anteriores créditos. Y está muy contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus miembros son muy unidos y responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, 500 nuevos soles, comprará abono para fertilizar sus tierras, también semillas de arroz para poder iniciar con una nueva producción.
texts.en:
Arquímedes is 49 years old. He is married to María, 51, and they have five children, four of whom are now adults and independent. Only 15-year-old Carolina is at their side. He lives with them in their own house that he built with a great deal of effort, and where he works hard to be able to offer them a better quality of life.

He farms; specifically growing regional products such as plantain, rice, yuca and other crops. He has his own small farm where he conditions the land, preparing it so that it produces the best crops in the harvest season. He has been working in this business for 15 years, and still remembers that in the beginning he suffered a lot. However, he kept going and managed to succeed. 

He feels that it is much better to work independently than to do so under the authority of other people as he did before, since he says that he was always the victim of worker mistreatment. 

On the occasions that he goes to his small farm, he has the help of some people that he hires, and for whom he feels very thankful, as they greatly support him in being able to properly carry out his work. 

Fortunately, it is going well, as he always keeps in mind a motto that says: “People reap what they sow," and he adds: "in the place they sow," in a phrase that he says applies to all areas of his life. He hopes that his financial situation keeps improving, so that he can gradually save what he needs to be able to lead a quiet old age at his partner's side.

This is his sixth loan with MF, so he is grateful to the people who make his loan possible. Furthermore, he promises to once again make his installment payments on time, as he did with previous loans. He is also very happy to belong to his communal bank, as all its members are very responsible and they are a close-knit group.

With the amount of 500 nuevos soles applied for, he will buy manure for fertilizing his land, as well as rice seeds for starting a new crop.

loans.use: To buy manure and rice seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy organic manure for her cabbage garden.

loans.name: Mithaq

texts.en:
Mithaq is a university student with a major in information technology. She is in her fourth year, and she has been paying for her own education.

She wishes to get a loan to pay for her final year and graduate.

loans.use: to pay her fees for her final year at university.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre bueno y amable, tiene 52 años y es padre de nueve hijos, de los cuales seis ya son independientes, mientras que tres aun son menores. Lamentablemente se separó de su esposa y sus tres hijos de 15, 12 y 7 años ahora viven con ella. Sin embargo, eso no significa que él no cumpla con sus responsabilidades paternas, por lo que de manera semanal les lleva productos y artículos necesarios para que puedan tener una vida tranquila y sin necesidades. 

Francisco tiene un trabajo muy dinámico, pues tiene que estar en constante movimiento de un lugar a otro. Se va a diferentes lugares de su distrito e ingresa a las chacras, granjas y caseríos en busca de animales para comprarlos, una vez que obtiene los animales se dirige al mercado principal de la ciudad donde los vende. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 15 años y es una actividad que le permitió, hasta el momento, poder brindar todo lo mejor a su familia. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que puede disponer de su tiempo como mejor se le acomode, además de poder viajar a muchos lugares. En los años que lleva trabajando ha ganado amplia experiencia en técnicas de ventas, lo cual le permite vender con rapidez, sin necesidad de invertir mucho tiempo.

Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y está muy contento de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero para aumentar su capital de trabajo. Por otro lado, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, como lo hizo en los anteriores créditos que tuvo. Y se siente seguro por pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado, 1500 nuevos soles, comprará más animales para seguir llevándolos a vender en los mercados y camales de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Francisco is a friendly, good man. He is 52 years old and the father of nine children, six of whom are independent, while three are still minors. Unfortunately, he is separated from his wife, and his three children, ages 15, 12 and 7, now live with her. Nevertheless, this does not mean that he does not fulfill his paternal responsibilities because every week he takes them items they need so they can have a worry-free life.

Francisco has a very dynamic life in that he is in constant motion, going from one place to another. He goes to different places in his district, entering fields, farms and villages in search of animals to buy and once he gets the animals he goes to the city’s main market where he sells them. He has been doing this work for 15 years and it is a task that up to now has enabled him to provide the best for his family. He enjoys his work a great deal because he can organize his time as he wishes and he can also travel to many places. During the years he has been working he has gained broad experience in sales techniques, which enables him to sell quickly without a need to invest much time in the process. 

This is his fourth loan from MFP and he is very content knowing that he has financial support to increase his working capital. He promises, once again, to make all his payments on time, as he has done with previous loans. And he feels secure because he belongs to his communal bank where everyone is very responsible and supportive.

With the sum requested,  S/. 1,500, he will buy more animals to continue taking to sell at the city’s markets and slaughterhouses.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to continue his sales at markets or slaughterhouses.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 45 años, es un hombre muy trabajador, además de alegre y sociable. Está casado con Nelith, la madre de sus dos hijas. Ahora viven los cuatro y una nieta, en la casa que compraron con el fruto de su esfuerzo.
Él se dedica a la venta de gaseosas de variados sabores y marcas, para eso cuenta con una refrigeradora que compró con un préstamo y la instaló en su casa, desde donde atiende a sus clientes. Con su primer préstamo de MFP pudo realizar sus primeras compras y viendo la acogida que tuvo con su negocio y las ganancias que le dejaba, las reinvirtió logrando comprar en mayores cantidades. Antes de empezar no tenía problemas económicos, pero sí el deseo de contar con un ingreso económico adicional, para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar.

Este es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP y está agradecido con la oportunidad de contar con un apoyo financiero, así se sentirá más seguro para avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado, comenta que le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal para tener una línea de crédito que le ayude a concretar sus planes de negocio.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más gaseosas de diversos sabores, buscando precios más bajos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Juan is 45 years old and is a very hardworking man who is also happy and sociable.  He is married to Nelith, the mother of his two daughters.  Currently, the four of them and one niece live together in a house that he bought as the fruit of his labors.

He works in the sales of soft drinks of many different flavors and types, and for this he relies on a refrigerator that he bought with a loan and installed in his house, where he waits upon his customers.  With his first loan from MFP, he was able to make his first investments and selling what he had gotten, he made his business and the profits left to him, he reinvested to successfully buy in greater quantities.  Since beginning, he has not had economic problems, but he wants to continue to have an additional income to support his spouse with the household expenses.

This is his 3rd loan with MFP, and he is thankful for the opportunity he has to count upon the financial support, and this helps him to feel more secure in advancing his business.  He also says that he likes working with his community bank to have a line of credit that helps him to firm up his business plans.

With the amount that he has asked for, 2,500 Soles, he will invest in buying more sodas of different flavors and look for better prices for his bulk buying.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to continue in his business.

loans.name: Gilmer

texts.es:
Gilmer tiene 29 años, tiene dos hijos llamados Nadia y Gilmer de 5 y 3 años respectivamente. Su pareja es Marli, de 21 años, todos viven en la casa que cuida hace 3 años, la misma que tiene en custodia bajo un tiempo indeterminado.

Él trabaja como conductor de motocarro. Su trabajo consiste en trasladar a los pasajeros a su destino de manera rápida y segura, todas las personas que solicitan su servicio terminan muy contentos y agradecidos por el trato amable que ofrece y porque cobra el precio justo por su trabajo, sin realizar cobros exagerados. Lleva en esta actividad 5 años y le gusta mucho, aunque asegura que al principio le fue difícil trabajar porque tenía que enfrentar los comentarios negativos de algunas personas y porque no conocía la ciudad completamente.
