Ahora realiza su trabajo de manera óptima y sus ingresos se han incrementado. Espera algún día comprarse un motocarro más para continuar en el logro de sus ideales.

Este es su crédito número seis con MFP y está muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para aumentar su capital de trabajo. Por otro lado, se compromete, una vez más, a  cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos. Y se siente satisfecho de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado, 1000 nuevos soles, refaccionará su motocarro cambiando el toldo y todo el tapizado, también comprará algunos repuestos para su mejor funcionamiento.
texts.en:
Gilmer is 29 years old. He has two children called Nadia and Gilmer who are 5 and 3 years old respectively. His partner is Marli, who is 21 years old. They live in the house that they have been caring for for 3 years, having it in their custody for an indefinite period.

He works as a motorcycle taxi driver. His work consists of transporting passengers to their destination as rapidly and safely as possible. Everyone that uses his service ends up very happy and grateful for the friendly treatment he offers and because he charges a fair price for his work, without adding inflated charges. He has been doing this work for 5 years and he likes it a lot, although he says that at first it was hard work because he had to face the negative comments of some people and because he did not know the city completely. Now he does his work in the best way and his earnings have increased. He hopes some day to buy a car in order to be able to continue achieving his goals.

This is his sixth loan through MFP and he is very happy knowing that he will have financial help in order to expand his working capital. At the same time, he promises, once again, to complete his payments punctually as he has done with previous loans. And he feels satisfied belonging to his communal bank, as everyone is very responsible and supportive.

With the requested amount, 1000 soles, he will refurbish his motocycle changing the awning and upholstery, and also buying some spare parts to improve performance.

loans.use: to change the awning and upholstery of his three-wheeler and also to buy spare parts for repair jobs

loans.name: Yosra

texts.en: Yosra is a very committed woman with lots of ambitions. She lives in Wihdat which is in the east part of Amman. She works as a hairdresser from her home in addition to selling various products. She hopes to get a loan so she can refurnish one of her rooms to prepare it for receiving her clients and serving them and also to display her products for sale.

loans.use: to refurnish one of her rooms to prepare it for receiving her clients

loans.name: Asam

texts.en: Asam is 40 years old and married with eight children. He works hard to provide for his family. He runs a bookshop and sells accessories in Taiz, Yemen. He requested a loan of 300,000 YER from AMB to purchase more books, phone recharge cards, etc. He has been running his business for 10 years and he aspires to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more books, phone recharge cards, etc,. for his business

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
This is Jennifer, She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Jennifer hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Fredy tiene 39 años, es un hombre con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Le gusta mucho trabajar por el bien de sus seis hijos, los que tuvo durante los 16 años de convivencia junto a su pareja Elvira. Vive en un terreno familiar, en él que habitan también sus hermanos con su familia completa, cada uno en su casa propia.

Fredy tiene mucha habilidad para el trabajo y realiza múltiples funciones, pero principalmente se dedica a la venta de jugos elaborados con frutas tropicales. Todos los días se dirige al mercado principal de la ciudad para conseguir las frutas más frescas para elaborar los jugos que luego pone a la venta en un puesto que tiene cerca de su casa. Lleva en esta actividad cerca de 15 años, trabaja durante toda la mañana y considera que es una actividad rentable porque le genera buenos ingresos gracias a los clientes que ha logrado consolidar con el paso de los años. Adicionalmente, vende frutas en la vereda de su casa, durante las tardes y es ahí donde recibe el apoyo de su pareja, quien colabora con él en la atención. Lleva también 15 años en este rubro sin encontrar problema alguno. Por si fuera poco, trabaja como mototaxista (taxi en motocarro) por las calles de su ciudad, tiene un vehículo propio, el cual no solo lo usa como movilidad sino también como fuente de trabajo, lleva en este rubro cerca de 10 años. Su deseo a futuro es establecer una juguería más confortable y amplia.

Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y agradece a todos aquellos que lo hacen posible. Asegura que seguirá siendo puntual en sus pagos, como lo hizo en créditos anteriores. 
Con el monto solicitado, 1000 nuevos soles, comprará sacos de fruta, principalmente naranjas y maracuyá y otros ingredientes como algarrobina, miel y bolsas de cancha dulce para continuar vendiendo sus deliciosos jugos.
texts.en:
Fredy is 39 years old and is a man eager to get ahead. He enjoys working for the good of his six children, whom he has had during his 16 year common law marriage with his partner, Elvira. He lives on family land, where his siblings and their families also live, each in his/her own house.

Fredy is very skilled at work and performs many jobs, but he mainly dedicates himself to the sale of juices he makes with tropical fruit. Everyday he goes to the city’s main market to obtain the freshest fruits to make the juices that he then sells at a stall he has near his house. He has had this business for around 15 years and works at it every morning. He feels that his business is profitable because he generates a good income, thanks to the customers he has succeeded in attracting over the years. In addition, he sells fruits on the sidewalk in front of his house during the afternoons and there his partner helps him wait on customers. He has also had this business for 15 years, without any problem. As if that were not enough, he also works as a “mototaxista” (a driver of a three-wheeler van taxi) throughout the streets of the city. He has his own vehicle, which he uses not also as a means of transportation, but also as a source of work. He has been a taxi driver for 10 years. 

His wish for the future is to establish a more comfortable and larger juice bar.

This is his fourth loan from MFP and he is grateful to all those who have made it possible. He assures that he will continue being punctual in his payments, as he was with previous loans. With the sum requested, S/. 1,000, he will buy sacks of fruit, mainly oranges and passion fruit and other ingredients such as “algarrobina” (black carob tree syrup), honey and bags of “cancha dulce” (sweet roasted corn kernels) in order to continue selling his delicious juices.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and other ingredients that he uses to make his juices.

loans.name: Sincerlita

texts.en:
This is Sincerlita, 51, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a mother to her children. At this time, she is working hard to be able to cover their everyday financial expenses.

Sincerlita operates an internet café business. There is more need, now than before, for services like these as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who take advantage of her services for school requirements. She also has people who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume or any office documentation, as well as people who would just love to surf the net and any social network.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in profit every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Sincerlita dreams to have a good life and to be able to help her loved ones. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Pjeter

texts.en:
Pjeter is in his mid-seventies, married and has seven grown-up children. He lives in the northern east part of the country at the moment; but he and his family lived in a rocky mountainous region before coming to their current location where life was very difficult for all of them whether financially or emotionally. 

Upon their arrival in the new location, Pjeter started his own business in livestock and has been selling milk and baby calves to local markets ever since. The business has been going well, according to Pjeter, yet, he had to help his children with the profit he made, and therefore, there is not very much left for him to use to repair the damaged stable. This is the reason why he is requesting a Kiva loan now in hopes that lenders will help him out in this matter. 
Pjeter has been a client of VisionFund Albania for long time now and has proved that he is a very responsible person.

loans.use: To repair a damaged stable

loans.name: Jorge Washington

texts.es: Jorge tiene en Libertad una pequeña distribuidora de tanques de gas domésticos. Empezó el negocio cuando se jubilo de la marina donde prestaba sus servicios. Es un trabajo en el que siempre tiene clientes por lo que labora todos los días desde las 8:30 de la mañana hasta las 18:00 pm. La compra la solicita  a las grandes distribuidoras para luego vender por unidad ya que así lo indican las autoridades, compra el cilindro a $ 2.00 y la vende a $ 2.50. El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar más cilindros y tener en stop ya que hay meses que escasea el producto. A futuro espera poder ampliar su casa y hacer más grande su depósito.
texts.en: Jorge is a supplier of small domestic gas tanks in Libertad. He began this business when he retired from the Navy where he rendered his services. It’s a job that always has customers and so he works every day from 8:30 in the morning until 6:00pm. He buys his orders from the large distributors and later sells them by unit, as the authorities suggest, buying the cylinders at $2.00 and selling at $2.50. He is requesting a loan in order to buy more cylinders to have on hand as there are some months that the products are scarce. In the future he hopes to be able to expand his house and make his stockroom larger.

loans.use: to buy gas cylinders

loans.name: Rous

texts.en:
Rous is 39 years old and married to Phal, aged 41. Together, they have two children who are currently studying in a local school in the Baray district, Kompong Tom province. Rous and her husband work together at the rice field to ensure an abundant harvest. Also, they have their own individual businesses such as hog-raising, firewood trading, and fishing, from which they can supplement their main income. Rous has been in the farming and hog-raising business for many years. 

Due to financial difficulties, Rous would like to borrow some funds from Kiva lenders to support her in her farming business. She wants to obtain KHR 1,000,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and rent a tractor to till the land. This loan will allow her to maintain her business and she hopes to produce a good output from the land.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and rent a tractor to till the land.

loans.name: Raddad

texts.en: Raddad is a university student who lives in Karak with his parents and siblings. He wishes to get a loan so he can pay for his own education and continue with his studies. He will pay for his semester so that he won’t burden his parents.

loans.use: to pay for his semester

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is Edna, 43, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Emelito, her business partner, and father to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Edna operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Edna earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Edna is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Edna dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, which is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and expand her product inventory

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
This is Rowena, 31, resident of  Pasay city, Philippines. Her husband is Rogelio, a businessman, and father to her three children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Rowena operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, and then sells them with a little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothes and other similar products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rowena hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years and draw her family more closely to God. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, which is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en: Rogelio is 46 years old and is engaged in a farming business. He wants to uplift his family out of poverty but with simple farming as a source of income it is difficult for him to achieve what he wishes for. In particular it is hard as he suffers from an insufficiency of funds to continue his business. However he is full of hope. He decided to request a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy rice seeds, pesticides and to use in paying for the labor cost of his co-farmers. Rogelio is hoping that through the loan, hard work and determination, his wish will soon be attainable.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and pesticides, and to pay for the labor cost of his co-farmers

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 41 years old and is married. She operates a "sari sari store," which is the common name for a variety store, in her village, where she sells canned goods, noodles, sugar, cooking oil and spices. She has had this business for four years. 

Cresencia earns PHP 2,000 from the business each week, and this income is put back into the operation of her store so it will be maintained and eventually grow for her family's needs. She is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, sugar, candies, crackers, and soft drinks to attract more customers to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, sugar, candies, crackers, and soft drinks for her store

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn, 38, resident of Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Arvel, her business partner, and father to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marilyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marilyn hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, which is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jabier

texts.es:
Jabier tiene 37 años, es hombre muy jovial y trabajador. Está casado, desde hace 13 años, con Linett, de 34 años, con quien tiene tres hijos de 13, 11 y 9 años. Todos viven en la casa que pudo forjar con mucho esmero, esfuerzo y arduo trabajo para que toda su familia pueda tener un techo en el que viva tranquilamente. 

Él está dedicado al sector agrícola, específicamente se dedica a la siembre de cultivos de corto período, de acuerdo a la temporada y a las condiciones del clima en su región. Trabaja en esto desde hace 15 años, él mismo se encarga de la siembra, cosecha y la venta de todo lo que obtiene de su chacra, y durante el periodo de crecimiento de sus cultivos trabaja como obrero en chacras vecinas y recibe un pago por ello. Una vez que obtiene sus productos los vende en el mismo campo o traslada todo al mercado. Los productos que siembra pueden ser arroz, plátano, yuca, frijol, verduras o algunas frutas. Le está yendo muy bien, aunque algunas veces el extenuante sol le hizo pensar en desistir de su trabajo y tirar la toalla, sin embargo ha sabido acomodarse a la situación y ahora realiza su trabajo con buenos resultados y con la mejor actitud.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y se siente muy agradecido con todos los que hacen posible su crédito. Además se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y continuar trabajando de la mejor manera con su banco comunal.
Con el monto solicitado, 1000 nuevos soles, comprará estacas de yuca y contratará a otra persona para que le ayude en la siembra de este producto.
texts.en:
Jabier is 37 years old. He is good-humored and hardworking. He has been married for 13 years with Linett, 34 years old, with whom he has three children who are 13, 11, and 9 years old. They live in the house that he built with much care, effort and hard work so that the whole family could have a roof and live peacefully.

He works in the agricultural sector, specifically he works planting short cycle crops, according to the season and the weather conditions in his region. He has been doing this for 15 years, being in charge of planting, harvesting and selling all that he obtains from his farm, and during the period that his crops are growing he works as a laborer on neighboring farms and receives payment for it. Once he gets his products he sells them in the field or takes them to market. The products he grows can be rice, bananas, cassava, beans, vegetables and some fruit. He is doing very well, although some times the enervating sun makes him think of stopping his work and throwing in the towel, none the less, he has known how to adapt himself to the situation and now does his work with good results and with the best attitude. 

This is his second loan through MFP and he feels very grateful with everyone who makes his loan possible. In addition, he agrees to make his payments on time and to continue working in the best way with his communal bank. With the amount requested, 1000 soles, he will buy cassava cuttings and he will hire another person to help him to plant this product.

loans.use: to buy cassava cuttings and to pay the person who will help him plant the product

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An, aged 46, is shown here in front of her house in the Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She is responsible for four children, three of whom are under her care, while the other one is already married. An operates a rice farm as the major business of the family, and, at the same time, she makes and sells Khmer cake house to house in her community every day for additional income. From these activities, she is able to make around $3.60 to support her family, while her husband earns about $3.20 from fishing.

With the amount of $600, An would like to purchase a plot of land for housing. She won’t use it for herself, but it’ll be used by her married child, who currently doesn’t have her own house. She hopes that this loan will be given to her as her third loan to better her living conditions and solve her financial difficulties. She appreciates the constant support of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land for housing.

loans.name: Midius

texts.en: Midius is a 30-year-old mother of five, ages between 4 and 15 years old. She buys and sells cattle. She also operates a retail shop to supplement her income. She wants to borrow 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings to restock more cattle to sell. Her dream is to earn more money such that she can give her children a good education and invest for the future when she will no longer be active in work. Her major challenges at the moment are limited capital and unpredictable weather changes which make cattle rearing a difficult job. With the loans she will be accessing from Ugafode, Midius hopes to realize her dreams with time.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto tiene 43 años, es un hombre emprendedor, honesto y muy trabajador. Su pareja desde hace 9 años es Marilú, con quien tiene tres hijos de 17, 8 años y la última de tan solo 6 meses de nacida llamada Cielo.
Se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en motocarro. Lleva en esta actividad cerca de 10 años, trabaja solo y a diario renueva sus energías para trabajar con mucho optimismo y siempre dando lo mejor de sí para que al final del día pueda disfrutar de sus ganancias. Le gusta mucho lo que hace, aunque asegura que al principio le fue difícil porque no conocía la ciudad completamente y se perdía en su trayecto. Pero ahora realiza su trabajo de manera óptima y sus ingresos se han incrementado. Espera comprarse otro motocarro nuevo y poco a poco constituir una empresa dedicada al alquiler de vehículos.

Este es el crédito número 5 que tiene con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está muy comprometido a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Y está muy contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 1000 nuevos soles, comprará algunos repuestos y accesorios que necesita para refaccionar su motocarro reparar el motor.
texts.en:
Humberto is 43 years old and is an honest, enterprising, and very hard-working man.  His partner of 9 years is Marilú, and together they have three children.  Their two oldest children are ages 17 and 8, while their youngest is only 6 months old and is named Cielo.

Humberto makes a living transporting passengers in his motorcycle taxi.  He has been in business for about 10 years.  He works alone, and begins every day with renewed energy and great optimism so that he can put in his best effort and then enjoy his earnings at the end of the day.  He likes what he does for a living, but says that it was difficult at first, since he didn’t know the city completely and sometimes got lost on his route.  Now, though, Humberto does his job very well and his income has increased.  He hopes to purchase another motorcycle taxi so that he can gradually build up a vehicle rental business.

This is Humberto’s fifth loan with MFP, and he is grateful to everyone who has made his loans possible so that he can continue with his goals.  He is very committed to making his payments on time.  He is also very happy to belong to his communal bank, since all of the members are very good, kind, and supportive.  

Humberto will use the 1000 soles he has requested to purchase some parts and accessories that he needs for refurbishing his motorcycle taxi and for repairing the motor.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
This is Luis, 48, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. He is married to Gemma, a housewife and the mother of their two children. Luis, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Luis operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. His store is located adjacent to his house. He also operates a loading station and water refilling machine. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php 600 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Luis hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of giving his children a good education. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in the business.

loans.name: Chourn

texts.en:
Chourn, aged 27, is married with two lovely young kids. She happily lives in the Reussey Keo district with her family. She is a good housewife and also an industrious farmer who owns a few plots of farmland for growing rice. Her husband is a construction worker who earns $5.00 on average per day. 

Due to the lack of a vehicle for commuting, Chourn’s husband has encountered difficulties and has to spend money for his daily transportation costs. In this regard, Chourn would like to help her husband and to cut down on unwanted expenses, so she is asking for a loan of $300 to add to her savings to purchase a used motorcycle for her husband to travel to his work, as well as for home use. Chourn aims to send her children to college after they finish high school.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for her husband to travel to his work, as well as for home use.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 42 years old. She finished college but could not find a better job, so she decided to build up a business in front of the elementary school. 

She is a sari-sari (variety) store owner and she sells candies, soft drinks, biscuits, juice, and "pancit and sopas" (noodles and chicken dish). She usually earns here all the expenses to finance their daily needs. 

She is requesting a loan amount of PHP 10,000 to buy grocery items and raw ingredients for her “pancit and sopas" to sell in her store. The people in their community are always looking for those goods and that’s why she wants to have stocks of these goods. 

She hopes that her business will further grow so that she can provide for all the needs of her school-aged children and let them finish all their desired courses someday.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and raw ingredients for her "pancit and sopas" to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ederwin

texts.en: Ederwin is 31 years old, responsible, and very dedicated to his family. He always looks out for the best things for his two children. For more than eight years, Ederwin has run a farming business. He plows the land, plants seeds, and cut grasses on his farm.  This is how he dedicates himself to his family. Now, he is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides. He hopes that this loan will generate a better income with which to provide for his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Julma

texts.en:
Julma is 49 years old and is married. She is a mother who is engaged in her general store business in the village of Mambabanga. She has been in this business for several years now. 

Julma wants to re-stock her sari-sari (general) store business. That is why she is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, candies, assorted bread, and condiments to resell. 

Julma believes that through her patience and determination, her business will grow further and secure her family living situation.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, candies, assorted bread, and condiments to resell.

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im is a resident of the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She was born and grew up there in a low-income family farm. Because of the financial constraints of the family at that time, Im quit her studies at primary school level in order to help her parents in their business. 

She has been doing farming for many years as she is now 40 years of age. She is married to a local farmer and gave birth to three single children. To elevate her standard of living, Im also devotes herself to a hog-raising business. She raises a few piglets for fattening and sells them to local butchers after a 3-4 months period of raising.

Im decided to seek additional capital to pay for her farming operating expenses. She would like to have KHR 600,000 to pay for labor costs in planting her rice crops. 

With the help of the loan, Im will be able to manage a good business and complete her farm work at the right period of time. She hopes that she will obtain a fruitful harvest in the upcoming season.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs in planting her rice crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for pet shop accessories and items needed in her business.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es:
Emerita tiene 59 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y empeñosa. Está separada del padre de sus 11 hijos, que en su mayoría ya son independientes. Ahora vive sólo con sus tres hijas y dos de sus nietos, en la casa que compró con mucho esfuerzo.
Su actividad es la venta de comidas (desayunos y almuerzos). Para eso cuenta con un espacio acondicionado en su vivienda donde instala, todos los días, mesas y sillas para la atención de sus clientes; además de da pensión (contrato por alimentos) a los trabajadores de las empresas de la zona. Realiza este negocio desde hace más de 8 años y cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijas  para la atención de los clientes. Le gusta lo que hace, pues ha logrado hacerse conocida en la zona por su buena atención y su dedicación al trabajo. Por lo contrario, lo que no le agrada es cuando llueve demasiado y dificulta el tránsito, pero no se desanima, por tanto tiene planes continuar y concluir con el acabado de las paredes y el piso de su local para dar una mejor comodidad de sus comensales.

Este es el préstamo número 8 que tiene con la institución MFP.  Comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal, pues le gusta el trabajo que realzan apoyando a las personas.
Con el monto solicitado, de 3000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus comidas; como arroz, azúcar, aceites y demás.
texts.en:
Emerita is 59 years old. She is a hardworking and tenacious. She is separated from the father of her 11 children, most of whom are independent. Now she lives alone with her three daughters and two of her grandchildren, in the house she bought with hard effort.

Her activity is the sale of meals (breakfasts and lunches). To do this she has outfitted a space in her housing, where she sets up, every day, tables and chairs on behalf of her customers, and in addition she gives pension (contracting of meals) to the workers from the neighborhood businesses. She has been in this business for more than 8 years and with the help of her daughters she attends to her clients. She likes what she does, and has become known in her area for the good service and her dedication to work. On the other hand, what she doesn’t like is when it rains too much and makes the going difficult, but it doesn’t discourage her, therefore she has plans to continue and to finalize finishing the walls and the floor of her facility in order to provide more comfort to her dining guests.

This is her eighth loan that she has through the MFP institution. She comments that she feels good about the communal bank, because she likes the work that they do helping people.

With the requested amount of 3,000 soles, she will invest in the purchase of the necessary ingredients in order to prepare her meals, such as rice, sugar, oils and more.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients to prepare her meals

loans.name: Yosra

texts.en: Yosra is a very smart and active business owner who lives in Wihdat with her sons. Yosra is a conservative person, so she asked one of her sons to take her place in the photo. She owns a company that sells cleaning materials and detergents. She would like to get this loan so she can buy another distributing car and expand her market share. She will be able to reach more clients and customers.

loans.use: to buy another distributing car for her company

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
This is Patricia, She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another loan, 50,000 PHP, for her to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily expenses and business. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Patricia hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Merlito

texts.en: Merlito is 37 years old and married to Jenelyn. The couple has been blessed with two children. Right now, Merlito is asking for a loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos to buy new tires for his transport motorcycle. He is grateful because the profit he generates from his business is useful for their daily needs. Merlito hopes to save money for the education of his children. He is hoping that his children will be able to finish their schooling someday.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his transport motorcycle

loans.name: Bethsy

texts.es:
Bethsy tiene 36 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora. Está casada con Emerson, de 33 años, con quien tiene dos niños; Emerson de 7 y Renzo de 4 años, ellos son su motor para seguir trabajando día a día y así lograr brindarles lo mejor.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de abarrotes. Tiene una tienda en su casa donde a diario van sus clientes a buscar los productos de primera necesidad; acuden muchas personas, pues ella abre desde muy temprano y tiene de todo para ofrecer. Lleva 6 años en este negocio y trabaja con la ayuda de una sobrina. Le gusta mucho su actividad, pues a parte de generarle buenas ganancias, es otro ingreso, ya que ella es docente en una institución educativa cerca de su casa. Aunque ahora le está yendo bien, no siempre fue así y tuvo que padecer mucho para poder tener lo que tiene ahora. Espera seguir trabajando con su tienda para seguir progresando.

Este es el préstamo número 7 que tiene con la institución MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con sus cuotas de manera puntual, como lo hizo en los anteriores créditos que tuvo. Y le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos los integrantes son personas muy responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, 1500 nuevos soles, comprará abarrotes y mercadería conformada por azúcar, arroz, aceite, huevos, pan, entre otros, para ampliar la variedad de productos que ofrece en su tienda.
texts.en:
Bethsy is 36 years old and is a very friendly and hard working woman. She is married to Emerson, who is 33 years old. With him, she has two children, Emerson who is 7 years old and Renzo who is 4 years old. They are the driving force for her to continue working everyday and be able to give them the best. 

Her work consists of grocery sales. She has a store in her house where her clients go everyday to find basic products. Many people come, so she opens very early in the morning and has everything to offer them. She has been doing this business for six years and works with the help of a niece. She likes her work a lot; in addition to generating good earnings, it is additional income since she teaches in an educational institution near her home.  Although it is going well for her now, it was not always like this. She had to suffer much in order to have what she now has. She hopes to continue working with her store to continue progressing.

This is her seventh loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she will have financial support since she will feel certain of advancing her business. On another note, she is committed--once again--to make her payments on time as she has done with the previous loans that she has had. She likes being part of her communal bank because all of the members are very responsible and supportive people. 

With the amount requested (1500 nuevos soles), she will buy groceries and merchandise like sugar, rice, oil, eggs and bread, among other items, in order to expand the variety of her products that are offered in her store.

loans.use: to buy groceries (rice, sugar, oil, eggs, etc) to increase her store's merchandise.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel es una mujer emprendedora, amable y trabajadora, tiene 31 años y vive con Betman, de 31 años, con quien tiene tres hijos; Blanca de 18, Carlos de 10 y la menor Luciana de 5 años.
Su especialidad son los pasteles, tortas, dulces y otros prostres que prepara en el taller artesanal que tiene en su casa, sólo trabaja para pedidos especiales y siempre está a la expectativa de los diferentes clientes que tiene para poder cumplir a tiempo con los encargos que le hacen. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 6 años y tiene la ayuda de su hija, a quien intenta enseñar todos los secretos de su negocio. Le gusta mucho lo que hace pues tiene tiempo para poder dedicarse a su familia y cuando hay buenos pedidos tiene también buenas ganancias, tiene muchos planes en mente pero por el momento solo desea poder formalizar su negocio y empezar a hacerlo crecer.

Este es su crédito número 12 con MFP, por tanto agradece la confianza que depositan en ella para acceder a este crédito. Además se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en créditos anteriores. Y se siente muy feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus miembros son buenos clientes y muy responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, 3800 nuevos soles, comprará ingredientes, insumos y materiales, como azúcar, moldes, colorantes, soportes, pirotines y otros artículos que requiere para seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Maribel is an enterprising, kind, and hardworking woman.  She is 31 years old and lives with Betman, who is also 31.   They have three children: Bianca is 18 years old, Carlos is 10, and their youngest, Luciana, is 5.

Maribel’s specialties include cakes, tarts, sweets, and other desserts that she prepares in her artisan workshop, which is located in her house.  She only works on special orders, and always waits for her customers to place the orders so she can complete them on time.  She has had this business for 6 years and has help from her daughter, whom she is trying to teach all of the secrets of her business.  Maribel really likes what she does for a living, since she has time that she can devote to her family, and when she has large orders she also has the potential for large profits.  She has many plans in mind, but for now she just wants to formalize her business and start making it grow.  

This is Maribel’s 12th loan with MFP, and she is grateful for the trust that has been given her so she can take out this loan.  She promises to make all of her payments on time, as she has done with her previous loans.  She is also happy to belong to her communal bank, since all of the members are very good and responsible.  

Maribel will use the 3800 soles she has requested to purchase ingredients, supplies, and materials she needs to continue with her work; these include sugar, pans, food coloring, stands, baking cups, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and supplies for making cakes and other desserts.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio tiene 65 años, es un hombre amable, bueno y muy dinámico. Su pareja, desde hace 38 años, es Teodolinda, quien lo apoya en todo lo que hace y junto a ella tuvo cinco hijos, quienes ya son mayores e independientes. Durante mucho tiempo ha trabajado para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, ahora que ya son mayores sólo desea tener una vejez tranquila a lado de su cónyuge.

La ciudad de Pucallpa tiene un clima muy caluroso, esta característica hace que sus pobladores estén en búsqueda constante de bebidas naturales y refrescantes. Julio prepara los refrescos más deliciosos de las mejores frutas tropicales y los acompaña con postres como queques, gelatina, tortas y otros gustitos que deleitan el paladar de sus clientes. Tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado más concurrido de la ciudad, atiende desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, cualquier persona que llega a su establecimiento termina satisfecho y con ganas de volver pronto porque sus postres son exquisitos. Él mismo prepara todo lo que vende y gracias a los más de 10 años que lleva en esta actividad ha podido acentuar el gusto y sabor perfecto que caracterizan a sus postres.

Este es su crédito numero 14 con MFP, por tanto agradece la confianza que ponen nuevamente en él para acceder al crédito que necesita para continuar con sus objetivos y crecimiento. Además está muy decidido a cumplir con sus pagos de manera puntual, como lo hizo hasta ahora en sus créditos anteriores. Le agrada mucho formar parte del grupo al que pertenece, es uno de los más antiguos y casi fundador y conoce a todos los integrantes.

Con el monto solicitado, 2000 nuevos soles, comprará frutas, maíz morado, gelatina, flan, harina, leche, mantequilla, huevos y todo lo necesario para continuar preparando los postres que pone a la venta en su negocio.
texts.en:
Julio, 65, is a nice, good and dynamic man. His partner of 38 years is Teolinda who is very supportive of all that he does. They have 5 children together, who are older and independent. For a long time, he has worked hard to offer his children a better quality of life; now that they are older, he wants to live peacefully at his partner’s side.  

The city of Pucallpa has a very warm climate and this is why its habitants are in constant search for refreshing, natural drinks. Julio prepares the best refreshments from the best tropical fruits and offers desserts like cake, gelatin, tortes and other treats that delight his clients’ palates.
He has a small post in the busiest market of the city. He serves from 8 in the morning to 7 at night. Anyone who arrives at his establishment ends up satisfied and wanting to come back because his desserts are exquisite
He makes everything he serves and thanks to over 10 years of service, he has been able to accentuate the perfect flavor and taste that characterize his desserts.

This is his 14th loan with MFP and he is grateful to them for again confiding in him enough to receive another loan that he needs to continue with his growth and objectives. Also, he’s very committed to paying back his loan on time, as he’s done with his previous loans. He enjoys being a member of the group he is part of; he’s one of the longest-standing members, almost a founder, and he knows all of the members.

With the loan of 2000 soles that he has requested, he’ll buy fruit, purple corn, gelatin, flan (crème caramel), flour, milk, butter, eggs and everything he needs to continue preparing the desserts that he sells at his business.

loans.use: buy fruit and the ingredients he needs to prepare his juices and desserts.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita tiene 42 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, siempre va en busca de nuevas y mejores oportunidades. Tiene cuatro hijos junto a su pareja desde hace 24 años llamado Carlos, el último de sus hijos tiene tan solo 5 años y necesita de toda la protección atención y cuidado que solo le pueden ofrecer sus padres. Todos viven en la casa que construyó gracias al esfuerzo de su cónyuge y al fruto de sus ahorros obtenidos en sus respectivos trabajos.

Todos los días Felicita se despierta muy temprano para atender su pequeña bodega, sus clientes principalmente son sus vecinos y acuden a su tienda para comprar todos los abarrotes necesarios para la preparación de los alimentos diarios; como pan, huevos, azúcar, arroz, plátanos, verduras y otros. Tiene su negocio en su misma vivienda y es la única bodega en su barrio, es por eso que sus ventas son muy buenas y sus ganancias siempre son bastante rentables y satisfactorias. Empezó hace 2 años y trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo. Anteriormente vendía agua envasada, pero no tenía buenos resultados por lo que optó por constituir la bodega que ahora tiene. A pesar que le va muy bien siente que no es suficiente, por eso complementa su negocio diario vendiendo comida por las noches en la vereda de su casa. Afortunadamente también le está yendo bien en esta actividad, pero las intensas lluvias han ocasionado que algunas veces no pueda vender lo suficiente, es por eso que ahora quiere construir un pequeño local para más adelante consolidar un restaurante. 

Este es su préstamo número 14 con la institución MFP, siempre se caracterizó, dentro de su grupo, como una persona responsable y está feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan para poder realizar una buena inversión. Además está segura de que seguirá cancelando sus cuotas a tiempo como lo hizo hasta ahora, pues está muy comprometida con el grupo al que pertenece y no desea dejar una mala impresión, ni a ellos ni a la institución.

Con el monto solicitado, 1500 nuevos soles, comprará calaminas para techar su local de venta de comida. También comprará abarrotes y verduras para continuar vendiendo en su bodega.
texts.en:
Felicita, 42, is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who is always looking for new opportunities. She has four children with her partner of 24 years, Carlos, and her youngest child is only 5.  The child needs all the  protection, attention and care that can only be offered by the parents.  They all live in the house that her partner built, thanks to his effort and with the earnings from their respective jobs.

Felicita wakes up very early every day to be at her small grocery store.  Her customers are principally her neighbors and they come to her store to buy all the necessary items to make their daily meals, such as bread, sugar, rice, bananas, vegetables, etc.  Her business is in her own house and it’s the only grocery store in the neighborhood.  That is why her sales are so good and her earnings are always profitable and satisfactory.  She started 2 years ago and her husband helps her.  Before, she sold bottled water but that didn’t work well and so she decided to set up the store that she has.  Besides that it’s going well, she feels that it isn’t enough so to her business  she added selling prepared food every night from outside her house.  Luckily this is also going well but the intense rains have resulted in the situation where sometimes she can’t sell enough.  That is why she wants to build a small stand so she can set up a restaurant in the future.

This is loan number 14 with MFP.  She has always been characterized in her group as a responsible person and she is happy because of the opportunity offered her to make a good investment.  Besides she is sure that she will continue making the payments on time as she has done up to now.  She is very involved with her group and she doesn’t want to give a bad impression, neither to them nor to the institution.

She will use the requested amount of 1500 new sols to buy tin to put a roof on the stand where she sells food.  She will also buy groceries and vegetables to keep selling in her store.

loans.use: to buy tin to put a roof on the stand where she sells food.  She will also buy groceries and vegetables to keep selling in her store.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
This is Gina. She previously accessed an 47,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
Gina would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Gina hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is a responsible mother who is engaged in her sari-sari store business. She is 48 years old and is married to Edward. They have been together since 1979. The couple helps each other to sustain the needs of her children. 

As of now, Melinda is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 to buy condiments, canned goods, noodles, and soft drinks to sell. Melinda hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business. 

As she said, through hardship and patience, she does everything to make her family's life better.

loans.use: to buy condiments, canned goods, noodles, and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Ana Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Ana vive en Playas con su familia que está formada por su mamá, hermano e hija ya que es divorciada, su casa es de caña la cual cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz esto se debe a que su zona está en próxima regeneración. Ella empezó a trabajar en el comercio desde muy joven empezando con la venta de bisutería ambulante ya que sus padres no tenían muchos recursos, a ella siempre le ha gustado trabajar por eso su negocio ha ido creciendo con el paso del tiempo. Actualmente tiene una tienda en su vivienda en la cual vende de todo un poco como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar por libra, enlatados, embutidos, productos de limpieza etc., también ropa por catalogo cuando le hacen los pedidos. No tiene horario fijo pero normalmente empieza desde las 6:30 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche no cierra el negocio ya que cuando ella no se encuentra su mamá o hermano le ayudan con la atención. espera obtener el préstamo para comprar la mercadería que necesita para su tienda le gustaría a futuro poder ampliar su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos .
texts.en:
Ana lives in Playas with her family which is made up by her mother, brother and daughter. She is divorced and her housed is made of reeds, in which she has water and electricity. This is due to the fact that her neighborhood is in the next set of improvements. She began to work in commerce when she was very young, beginning with the itinerant sale of imitation jewelry because her parents did not have many economic resources. She has always liked working. Because of this her business has continued growing with the passage of time. 

Currently she has a store in her house in which she sells a little bit of everything including rice, sugar by the pound, canned goods, preserved meats, cleaning products, etc. She also sells clothing from catalogs when customers place orders with her. She does not have a set schedule but she normally begins at 6:30 in the morning and goes until 9:00 at night. She does not close her business because when she is not around her mother or brother help her attend to the store. She hopes to receive the loan to buy the goods that she needs for her store. She would like to be able to expand her business and improve her income in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, canned goods, preserved meats and cleaning products.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie offers homemade rice and bignay wine. She has been in this type of business for five years up to this time. Annie is also engaged in a hog-raising business wherein she raised 60 piglets, six fattening pigs and 10 sows. According to her, through her hog-raising business, she was able to educate all of her six children. She is really blessed because all of her children are professionals and have their own families.

Annie would like to gain her own income so she has been doing all her best in order to earn a living. At her age, still she enjoys making rice and bignay wines. Annie's gained profits goes to the daily maintenance of her hogs, for the salaries of her three helpers and for maintenance of her two hectares of rice field. So she is in need of additional capital in the amount of 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), which will be used to buy more bignay fruits to be able for her to supply all her buyers because her product sold out immediately due to the great taste of the wines she offers. 

She hopes that her requested loan amount will be granted in order to provide her customers with quality service and be able to export her product into other countries. She knows that she could achieve all her goals through Him and her patience in making her business grow.

loans.use: to buy more bignay fruit for her wine-making business.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina tiene 35 años, siempre fue una mujer pujante y soñadora, es alguien que le gusta cumplir con lo que se propone. Está casada con Lucio, de 46 años, con quien tiene un hijo de 19 años.
A diario ella sale muy temprano de su hogar y se dirige a un mercado muy concurrido de la ciudad donde tiene un pequeño puesto de condimentos o también como se les conoce en la región como “especerías”. Allí prepara diferentes combinaciones de condimentos para poder venderlos a sus fieles clientes que siempre van a comprar en su puesto, ya que ahí encuentran buen trato, precio justo y sobre todo una regalito de su parte. Lleva realizando su trabajo por 12 años y siempre trabajó sola como hasta ahora. 

Este es su préstamo número 15 con MFP. Siempre fue muy buena socia en su banco comunal donde la quieren mucho por ser muy responsable y solidaria. Agradece a quienes le brindan el préstamo que requiere para seguir aumentando su negocio y está convencida de que seguirá siendo puntual y pagará sus cuotas a tiempo como lo hizo en todos los préstamos que tuvo hasta ahora.

Con el monto solicitado, 1000 nuevos soles, comprará ingredientes, condimentos y especias para aumentar su variedad de productos, entre ellos: comino, pimienta, guisador, ajos, culantro, embutidos, etc.
texts.en:
Karina, 35, has always been a vigorous woman and a dreamer. She likes to accomplish what she proposes. She is married to Lucio, 46, with whom she has a 19-year-old son.

Every day she leaves her house early in the morning to go to the busiest market of the city where she has a small kiosk of condiments or as it's known in the region, "spicery". There she prepares different combinations of condiments in order to sell them to her loyal clients who always go to buy at her kiosk because they are treated well, her prices are fair and above all, they get a little gift from her. She's had her business for 12 years and has always worked alone.

This is her 15th loan with MFP. She has always been a good associate of her Communal Bank, where they love her because she is responsible and supportive. She is grateful to those who have offered her the loan so she can continue growing her business; she's certain she will continue being punctual with her payments as she's done with her previous loans.

With the loan she has requested, she will buy condiments and spices to increase her variety of products, such as cumin, pepper, turmeric, garlic, coriander, stuffing, etc.

loans.use: buy the ingredients and spices she needs to prepare the condiments that she sells.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
Mary tiene 40 años, es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante y muy trabajadora, tiene cuatro hijos de 22, 20, 17 y 8 años junto a su pareja llamado Emilio. Viven en la casa que pudieron construir gracias al intenso trabajo y muchos meses de ahorro.

Su trabajo es la venta de ropa, prendas que consigue viajando a la ciudad capital cada quince días o mensualmente. También se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y productos de aseo personal como perfumes, talcos, cremas y accesorios de mujer como aretes, collares y otros. Realiza esta función desde hace 14 años y le va muy bien, ya que siempre consigue vender toda su mercadería y afortunadamente la puntualidad en el pago por parte de sus clientes le ha ayudado a contar con el dinero necesario para continuar renovando su mercancía con frecuencia. Este trabajo lo hace generalmente los sábados, domingos y feriados, ya que durante la semana se dedica al cuidado de niños en su casa bajo un programa estatal denominado “Wawa-Wasi” y por lo cual también recibe una remuneración. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que le permite manejar su tiempo con libertad y espera que su economía continúe en ascenso por el bien de toda su familia.

Este es su crédito número 14 con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad brindada. Por lo que se compromete, una vez más, a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual y muy responsable como lo hizo en los créditos anteriores que tuvo. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, pues todos sus integrantes son personas muy buenas y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, 900 nuevos soles, comprará una docena de polos, pantalones, camisas y blusas, en diversos modelos tallas y colores.
texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old. She is a woman who has a great desire to get ahead and is very hard working. She has four children of 22, 20, 17 and 8 years of age with her partner named Emilio. They live in a house that they were able to build thanks to hard work and many months of saving. 

Her work is in the sale of clothing. She gets the apparel by traveling to the capital city every 15 days or monthly. She also makes a living selling cosmetics and personal hygiene products such as perfume, powders, creams and women's accessories like earrings, necklaces and others. She has done this work for 14 years and it is going very well for her. She is always able to sell all her merchandise and fortunately her customers punctual payments have helped her to rely on the money necessary to continue updating her merchandise often. She generally does this work on Saturdays, Sundays and during holidays because during the week she is committed to caring for children in her house under a government program entitled "Wawa-Wasi". Through this she receives a salary. She likes her work a lot because it allows her to freely manage her time. She hopes that her economic situation continues upward for the well-being of her whole family.

This is her fourteenth credit with MFP and is therefore thankful for the opportunity provided. As such, she is once again committed to paying her dues on time and responsibly as she has done with the previous loans that she has had. She is very happy with belonging to her communal bank. All of its members are very good and supportive people. With the amount requested of 900 nuevos soles, she will buy a dozen polo shirts, pants, shirts and blouses in various styles, sizes and colors.

loans.use: to buy a dozen polo shirts, pants, shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 51-year-old married man and has four adult children. He lives in Aden, Yemen. 

For the past 17 years, he has owned and operated a taxi service, and he has a good reputation among customers then he sold the taxi. He would like to buy a bus because he thinks the project is a profitable one, but he needs more support to cover the costs of purchasing the bus.

He is requesting a loan of 350,000 YER to help him cover the costs of buying the bus. This will increase his efficiency and improve the family's income.

loans.use: to buy a bus for transportation

loans.name: Merci

texts.es:
Merci tiene 41 años, es una buena mujer, amable y emprendedora, le gusta mucho estar en constante actividad y siempre trabaja arduamente para brindar una mejor calidad de vida su familia. Ella vive en su casa propia donde comparte su vida con Alcides, de 49 años, su pareja y padre de sus cuatro hijos: Gilma de 23, Frank de 20, Eloy de 28 y Leydi de 5 años. 

Su trabajo es la venta de bebidas en su pequeño, pero muy surtido bar. Su negocio está en su misma vivienda, donde acondicionó un espacio para atender a sus clientes. Durante las mañanas la actividad en su local es muy poco fluida, pero con el transcurrir de las horas y el incremento de la temperatura, por el fuerte sol de la zona en la que vive, hace que se acerquen a su establecimiento muchas personas en busca de alguna bebida refrescante. Trabaja al lado de su pareja, quien le ayuda en la atención. Siente que le está yendo bien, ya que cuando empezó, hace 11 años vendía poco, porque solo se dedicaba a vender gaseosas, con el transcurrir del tiempo empezó a vender otro tipo de bebidas y eso ahora le permite tener mejores ganancias.

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP y está muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando para poder continuar con su trabajo. Además se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como en los otros créditos que tuvo. Por otro lado, menciona que se siente muy cómoda trabajando en su banco comunal, ya que sus compañeros son responsables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado, 3000 nuevos soles, comprará 40 cajas de cerveza, de distintas marcas, y 30 cajas de gaseosas, en diferentes presentaciones. Con el dinero que le reste comprará madera para arreglar las paredes de su local.
texts.en:
Merci is a good, friendly, and hardworking 41-year-old woman. She likes to constantly be busy, and is always working hard to achieve a better quality of life for her family. She lives in her own home, where she shares her life with 49-year-old Alcides, her partner and father of her four children: 23-year-old Gilma, 20-year-old Frank, 28-year-old Eloy, and 5-year-old Leydi.

Merci's job is selling drinks in her small but well-stocked bar. Her business is in her home, where she has dedicated a space for serving her customers. During the mornings, the bar isn't very busy, but as the hours pass and the temperature increases due to the strong sun in the area where she lives, many people come to Merci's establishment in search of a refreshing drink. She works together with her partner, who helps to serve customers. Merci feels that her business is doing well, because when she started 11 years ago, she only sold soda and had lower sales. As time passed, she began to sell other kinds of drinks, which now allows her to earn more.

This is Merci's sixth loan with MFP, and she is very grateful for the financial support she has received that has allowed her to continue her work. She again promises that she will be able to promptly make her payments, as she has done with the other loans she has had. Merci also says that she feels very comfortable working with the community bank, because the people are caring and responsible.

With the loan of 3000 nuevos soles, Merci will buy 40 crates of different brands of beer, and 30 crates of different kinds of soda. With the rest of the money, she will buy wood to repair the walls of her small bar.

loans.use: to buy 40 crates of beer and 30 crates of soda, as well as to repair the walls of her small bar.

loans.name: Monathmt Rayt Al-Atfal Group

texts.en:
This group is called Monathmt Rayt Al-Atfal and consists of four men who employed in a Child welfare organization. They took a loan of 200,000 YER.

Abdullah is a 43-year-old. He is employed in a Child welfare organization and gets a low salary that is not enough to cover his needs. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new laptop. This will help him to enhance his skills in using the computer and to finish his work reports on time, which will ensure better conditions for him at work and improve his income.

loans.use: to cover the costs of purchasing a new laptop for his personal use

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 52 years old. She is married and has two children. To make a living, Gloria provides motorcycle transport services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for many years and earns approximately 300 Philippine pesos (PHP) daily. Right now, Gloria is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which she will use to purchase equipment to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to improve her business

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly is 31 years old, an elementary school graduate who has no opportunity to finish his education due to poor living conditions. 

In spite of this, he still has the courage to develop his own family. As of now, he is married to Mila and is living through her farming. He is working hard for this source of income because he is preparing for future children. He wants to exceed current profits for his children. For this reason, he is asking for a loan amount of 20,000 PHP to buy seeds to plant, fertilizers and pesticides. He hopes that he can yield and earn a higher income than he is used to for his children's future.  He also hopes to save money for his continuing business.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Yusra Group

texts.en: This group is called Yusra which consists of four members: Tagia, Nasim, Habh, and Goot.  They live in Sana'a, Yemen. They are ladies and took out a loan of 250,000 Yemeni rial (YER). Tagia is a house wife and works very hard to provide her family with everything they need.She took out a loan of YER 50,000 from AMB to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house

loans.name: Al-Sabah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-sabah and consists of 4 ladies: Sabah, Jamila, Mkia and Anisa, who live in Sana`a, Yemen.

Sabah is a 37-year-old married woman (she is the woman who carries a red handbag). She lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She is an employee with a monthly salary which she uses to support her family. 

Sabah is applying for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase a fridge. She aspires to buy a house to live in with her family. She is aiming to have a business store to gain more profits so she has the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy a fridge for her house

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en: Abdu is a hardworking man who sells fruits and vegetables every day. He works in Sana'a, Yemen. He is 40 years old and is the married father of nine children who now live independently. He started his business long ago on a movable wheelbarrow usually containing a tomato basket and one other basket of potatoes with small a mount then then he expanded his business and opened a vegetables and fruits store. He bought more vegetables and fruits and the profits were helpful. He uses loans so that he can buy a greater variety of vegetables and fruit. In addition, this has been helping him to cover his family expenses. He applied for a loan of YER 200,000 from Al Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB). He will use this new loan to buy vegetables and fruits so that he can continue making his sales.

loans.use: to purchase enough vegetables to meet his clientele's demand

loans.name: Arij Group

texts.en:
This group is called Arij. It consists of 4 ladies--Tagiah, Arij, Azhar and Samirh--who are relatives and live in Sana`a, Yemen. 
Arij, 34 years old, is a married housewife and has four children. She lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She has been a sewer for 6 years and started a small tailoring business at home. She learned how from her family, and thanks to that she has been able to generate an income with which she contributes financially to her family in order to improve their quality of life. Now she wants to expand the business and make more clothes, so she has applied for a 60000 YER loan from AMB in order to buy sewing machine in order to be able to take more of her customers’ orders. In the future she wants to have her own tailoring workshop.

loans.use: to buy sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Al-Wafa Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-wafa and consists of six ladies who are Saidh, Aisha, Afrah, Dlila, Zahra and Afrah, and one man who is Rabia. Each one has  a different business and they live in Sana`a, Yemen. They took a loan of 340,000 YER.

Zahra is 40 years old and is a married woman who has 5 children who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She has been in the sewing trade for four years. This activity enables her to provide for her own needs and also to help out with the family's expenses. With a view to increasing her working capital to prepare for the festival season, she is requesting a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to buy fabric products for sewing. Her ambition is to open a large sewing workshop.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for her business

loans.name: Lesly

texts.es:
Lesly tiene 31 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy responsable. Su pareja es Jonás, de 37 años, con quien tiene dos hijos de 12 y de 3 años. Ella vive a lado de su familia, en la casa de sus suegros, es ahí donde a diario brinda lo mejor a su familia, ya que desea darles una mejor calidad de vida.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de verduras de la región como culantro, ají dulce, yuca, tomates entre otros. Tiene un puesto en el mercado principal de la ciudad y realiza este oficio desde hace 5 años, durante las mañanas, ya que también se desempeña como secretaria en un aserradero ubicado, por las tardes, en este trabajo tiene recién un mes. Le gusta lo que hace, ya que le permite tener buenos ingresos; a veces saca un porcentaje alto de las ventas de verduras, pero algunas veces solo gana para solventar los gastos del día. Espera que en un futuro cercano pueda tener un negocio de venta de comidas en un puesto que tiene libre al costado de su puesto en el mercado.

Este es su segundo crédito con la institución MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos y crecimiento programado. Además está muy decidida a cumplir con sus pagos, como lo hizo hasta ahora en sus créditos anteriores. Y le agrada mucho pertenecer a su grupo, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy puntuales y responsables.

Con el monto solicitado, 600 nuevos soles, comprará mayor cantidad de verduras para ofrecerlas a la venta y empezará a comprar lo ingredientes necesarios y algunos utensilios para iniciar su negocio de venta de comida.
texts.en:
Lesly, 31, is a very responsible and enterprising woman. Her partner is Jonas, 37, with whom she has 2 children, 12 and 3 years old.
She lives with her family at her in-law’s house. It’s there that she offers her family her best on a daily basis, as she wants to give them a better quality of life.

Her work consists of selling vegetables from the region like coriander, sweet chilies, manioc and tomatoes, among others. She has a stand in the principal market of the city and has been in this line of work for 5 years, working in the mornings; in the afternoons, she has been working as a secretary in a sawmill for the last month. She enjoys what she does, as it provides her with a good income. Sometimes she makes a high percentage on the vegetable sales, but other times she only makes enough to pay for daily expenditures. She hopes that in the near future she can have a food sales business in the empty stand that’s beside hers in the market. 

This is the second loan she has requested with MFP as she hopes to continue with her planned objectives and growth. Also, she’s very committed to meet her payments as she’s done up to now with her previous loan. She enjoys very much being part of her group because they’re all very punctual and responsible.

With the loan she has requested of 600 soles, she’ll buy a bigger quantity of vegetables to then put up for sale and she’ll begin to buy the necessary ingredients and a few utensils to start her new food sales business.

loans.use: buy more vegetables so she can continue selling them and also to start implementing her new food sales business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is from the village of Mambabanga. She is 47 years old and married to Elmer, a farmer in their village. To earn a living, Rosalinda is engaged in her sari-sari store (variety store). This couple works hard to meet the needs of their children. Rosalinda wants to expand her business. In this regard, Rosalinda is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, assorted bread, candies and condiments to sell. She dreams of fully providing for her children's needs in school as they complete their education which will be serving as the key to a bright future for them.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, assorted bread, candies and condiments to sell

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.en:
Jaafar is a 50-year-old Lebanese married man who is living with his wife. They have three children; one is working and two others are still attending school. He’s the one responsible for his family and looking to enhance their way of living. He has big responsibilities especially paying his children’s study fees. 

He has owned a pick up for the past 29 years. His job consists of selling products, fruits and vegetables to the neighboring villages upon request. With all these years of experience, Jaafar became expert in his field and more than this, able to respond rapidly to his clients' demands. 

Today, to increase his earnings, Jaafar is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the needed quantity of provisions and fruits for his business to be able to improve his sales. This will certainly boost his revenues and develop his job. In the future, he plans to hire someone to work on his behalf.

loans.use: to purchase products and fruits for his business.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
