A diario acomoda en su refrigeradora sus bebidas para que esté al gusto de sus clientes, pero los fines de semana aprovecha en vender comidas, platos típicos de la región y de algunos otros lugares, ya que su experiencia y buena sazón le permite preparar los platos que le soliciten. Lleva realizando la venta de gaseosas desde hace 2 años y la venta de comida, recién hace un año; trabaja con la ayuda de su hermana para dar una atención rápida y cordial. Recuerda que al principio le fue muy complicado realizar su trabajo ya que no podía hacerlo sola, es por eso que buscó ayuda y ahora su negocio marcha adecuadamente.

Este es su crédito número 8 con MFP y está muy agradecida de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son personas muy responsables y solidarias.

El monto solicitado, 1500 nuevos soles, lo destinará a la compra de cajas de gaseosas y cervezas, su inversión semanal varía entre 500 a 700 soles en una sola compra. En cuanto a la preparación de comidas, puede invertir aproximadamente 200 a 300 soles en la compra de los ingredientes como carnes, yucas, carbón, condimentos y otros.
texts.en:
Crhis is 30 years old and she is a friendly woman and a hard-worker.  She has been with Miguel (who is 35 years old) for 4 years and they have a young son who is 4 years old.  They live in a house that they rent and where she works and educates her son for whom she wants to provide a good education and a better quality of life.

She sells food, soft drinks, and beer.  She keeps the drinks in her refrigerator so that they are cold, the way her customers like them.  On the weekends she goes out to sell her dishes, which are typical for the region.  She goes to other areas to sell them.  Because of her experience and the good flavors in her dishes, she prepares the dishes that her customers want.  She has been selling soft drinks for two years and her dishes for one year.  She works with her sister's help so that she can provide fast and friendly service.  She remembers that when she first began her business, it was very difficult to do everything on her own.  She found help and now her business has markedly improved.

This is her eighth loan with MFP and she is very thankful to know that she has financial support.  She already feels more secure to continue to grow her business.  She promises, again, to comply with the payment schedule and pay punctually as she did with her previous loans.  She is happy to belong to the community bank as all of the members are responsible and supportive people.

This loan of 1500 soles will enable her to buy boxes of soft drinks and beer.  Her weekly expense in buying these drinks varies from 500 to 700 soles in a single purchase.  To prepare her dishes, she will invest approximately 200 to 300 soles in the purchase of the ingredients such as meat, yucca, coal, condiments, and other things.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her dishes and to purchase boxes of soft drinks and beer.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana tiene 39 años, es una amable mujer, emprendedora y muy sociable, se quedó viuda hace algún tiempo, pero eso no le impidió para continuar brindándole a su única hija, llamada Sindy, todo lo necesario. Ellas viven en su casa propia, compartiendo sus días al lado de su abuela. 

Juliana tiene como negocio principal la venta de pescado. Durante mucho tiempo vio la manera de sobresalir y realizó todo tipo de trabajos hasta que llegó a la actividad a la que ahora se dedica. Se inició con la ayuda de una de sus amigas, quien le ofreció un espacio a su lado en su puesto del mercado principal de la ciudad y ahí empezó; ahora tiene su propio puesto. Inicialmente sentía que la falta de costumbre generaba que no vendiera lo necesario por sí misma, pero el paso del tiempo le ha brindado la suficiente experiencia para lograr buenas ganancias al finalizar el día. Vende desde hace 12 años y ofrece todo tipo de pescados de todos los tamaños y precios. Inicia su labor a las 4 de la mañana y culmina al llegar el mediodía. Complementa este negocio, trabajando por las tardes en su casa, vendiendo gaseosas y hielo, y eventualmente realizando trabajos de costura. Juliana ha aprendido mucho de todas las experiencias que ha vivido, en su trabajo es muy querida por sus compañeros ya que siempre lleva una sonrisa en su rostro y una palabra de aliento. Su deseo es establecer una tienda de abarrotes en su casa y espera lograrlo en corto tiempo. 

Este es su crédito número 7 con MFP y está muy contenta y agradecida por el apoyo que está recibiendo. Por otra parte, se compromete a continuar pagando sus cuotas de manera puntual y responsable. Le agrada pertenecer a su banco comunal, del cual es socia fundadora, porque sabe que todos son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 1500 nuevos soles, comprará los pescados más solicitados en la región para continuar vendiendo.
texts.en:
Juliana is 39 years old, she is a friendly woman, and she is entrepreneurial and very social.  She has been a widow for some time, but this does not prevent her from providing everything that her only daughter Sindy needs.  They live in their own home and share their days with Sindy's grandmother.

Juliana sells fish.  For a long time she looked for a way to survive and tried working in lots of different jobs until she found the best one for her, which she now spends her time doing.  She began with the help of one of her friends who offered her a space at her side in the central market in the city.  Now she has her own stall.  At first she felt that she could not sell enough to generate enough money, but now after some time, she has learned how to earn a good income by the end of the day.  She has sold fish for 12 years and offers all types of fish in many sizes and prices.  She begins working at 4 AM and finishes at noon.  To complement this work, she works in the afternoons at home selling soft drinks and ice and sometimes by sewing.  Juliana has learned a lot from her life experiences and is loved by her friends that say she is always smiling and always has encouraging words for them.  Her dream is to open a grocery store in her home and she hopes this will happen soon.

This is her seventh loan from MFP and she is very happy and thankful for the support that she has received.  She promises to continue making payments punctually and responsibly.  She is happy to belong to the community bank because she knows that the members are responsible and supportive.

With this loan of 1500 soles, she will buy the most demanded fish in the region so that she can continue selling.

loans.use: to buy more fish so that she can continue with her sales.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 32-year-old married man with three children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a teacher by profession, appointed by the government. He has been in service for seven years. 

He has the challenge of having a low salary, which cannot sustain him and his family. His personal goals are building a permanent home and educating his children. He also has a business goal of buying land to grow crops to supplement his salary. Paul wants a loan to buy land to grow crops.

loans.use: to buy land to grow crops.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a modest person with a strong personality. She lives with her husband and two children in the village of Del Pilar.

Josephine is engaged in a hog-raising business that primarily involves hogs for breeding. It is a business she started 13 years ago. Now, she needs to increase her business, and this is why she is taking out a loan of 30,000 PHP in order to buy feed, vaccines, and additional hogs to raise. This business helps her because it's the only source of income she has to raise her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and additional hogs to raise.

loans.name: Lita

texts.es:
Lita tiene 50 años, es una mujer dinámica y muy entusiasta. Está casada y tiene cinco hijos que ya son mayores. Actualmente vive en su casa propia junto a dos de sus hijos y su cónyuge.
Su trabajo consiste en la venta de zapatos y ropa, para ello sale a visitar a sus amigos, vecinos y familiares en busca de venderles alguna prenda o calzado. Lleva realizando este trabajo por más de 8 años y durante este tiempo aprendió muchas cosas que utiliza para mejorar cada día. Cuando no está trabajando en las calles se dedica a vender en su casa, ya que tiene una vitrina y un mostrador donde exhibe su mercadería. Todos los artículos que pone a la venta son enviados desde otra ciudad mediante su esposo, quien se encarga de seleccionar los mejores modelos para luego enviárselo en grandes bolsas. Trabaja sola y se siente muy cómoda haciéndolo, ya que le permite tener tiempo para estar a lado de sus hijos y no descuidar las tareas de su hogar.

Este es un crédito individual que tiene con MFP y está muy contenta y agradecida por el apoyo financiero que les están brindando. Además está convencida que seguirá siendo una cliente responsable y puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Con el monto solicitado, 3000 nuevos soles, comprará ropa, zapatos y algunos otros artículos para seguir ofreciendo nuevos diseños y modelos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lita is 50 years old. She is a dynamic and very enthusiastic woman. She is married and has five children who are already adult. Currently, she lives in her own house along with two of her children and her husband.

Her job consists of selling shoes and clothing. For this, she goes out to visit her friends, neighbors and relatives with the aim to sell to them some clothes or shoes. She's been doing this job for more than eight years and during this time she has learned many things that she uses to improve every day. When she is not working in the streets, she is dedicated to selling from her house since she has a glass case and a counter where she exhibits her merchandise. All of the items that she puts on sale are sent from another city by her husband who is in charge of selecting the best models to then send in large bags. She works alone and feels very comfortable doing so since it allows her to have time to be at her children's side and to not neglect her house work.

This is an individual loan that she has with MFP and she is very happy and thankful for the financial support that they are providing. Additionally, she is convinced that she will keep being a client who is responsible and punctual with repayments. With the amount requested, 3000 new "soles," she will buy clothing, shoes and some other items to keep offering new designs and models to her customers.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothing to continue her sales.

loans.name: Thlk

texts.en:
Thlk, aged 54, is married and lives in the Baray district with her spouse and three of her children, while the oldest is married and lives separately. Thlk is a hard-working mother who devotes her full time to farming. This allows her to raise her children and send them to school. 

Recently one of her children started attending college; this encourages her to work tirelessly in the field to earn more income to support his education. She grows rice and seasonal vegetables on two and half hectares of farmland. Thlk aims to support her children’s education until they earn a bachelor's degree. She has a strong belief that through this they might have a better future and stay out of poverty.

Due to insufficient funds, Thlk has applied for a second loan of KHR 1,000,000 to add to existing money to pay the tuition fees of her son. She hopes that Kiva lenders will give constant support to her family. She promises to repay her loan on time as she did for her first cycle. She is very happy and appreciates the lenders.

loans.use: to pay tuition for her son.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 42 años, es una mujer amable, buena y emprendedora. Tiene cuatro hijos de 26, 23, 19 y 15 años, todos están estudiando. Juntos viven en su casa propia, compartiendo el deseo y las ganas por salir adelante.
Su trabajo consiste en la venta de pescado fresco. Todos los días se dirige al puerto de la ciudad para adquirir su mercadería al por mayor, luego se encarga de distribuirlos por especies y tamaños, y finalmente los pone a la venta por kilos. Tiene su puesto en el mercado, ahí vende durante toda la mañana, mientras que por las tardes regresa a su casa llevando lo que le sobra para venderlos allí, mientras realiza algunas funciones del hogar. Lleva 23 años en este negocio y lo conoce a la perfección, y se ha convertido en una excelente administradora de sus ganancias. Para más adelante desea obtener un puesto de ventas más grande y un bote de pesca para que se abastezca por sí misma.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibirlo. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, y le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias entre sí.
El monto solicitado (S/.1000) lo invertirá en la compra de pescados de las especies más solicitadas, su inversión diaria varía entre 400 a 500 soles por un total de 70 a 80 kg de pescado aproximadamente.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old. She is a friendly, good and entrepreneurial woman. She has four children who are 26, 23, 19 and 15 years old. All of them are studying. Together, they live in her own house, sharing the desire to get ahead.

Her job consists of selling fresh fish. Every day she goes to the port of the city to acquire her merchandise at wholesale. Then she is in charge if dividing it by species and size, and finally she puts them on sale by the kilo. She has a stall in the market. There she sells all morning while in the afternoon she returns home taking what is leftover to sell there. Meanwhile, she performs housework. She has 23 years experience in this business and she knows it to perfection and has become an excellent manager of her earnings. For the future, she wishes to obtain a bigger stall and a fishing boat so she can stock on her own.

This is the first loan with MFP so she is thankful for the opportunity and confidence put in her. At the same time she promises to complete her payments punctually and is thankful to be part of the community bank that she belongs to since she has seen that its members are responsible and united people.

The amount requested (S. 1000) will be invested in the purchase of the most popular fish. Her daily investment varies between 400-500 soles for a total of approximately 70-80 kg of fish.

loans.use: to buy more fish to continue her sales.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 47 years old and married. Yolanda’s husband is a farmer who grows rice and corn in the Philippines. Yolanda is engaged in a hog raising business, primarily hogs for breeding. Sometimes Yolanda has difficulty feeding her pigs. That’s why she decided to request a loan of P10,000 to buy feed for the pigs.

She hopes to maintain her business for the future of her family. She will manage her business well and earn a higher income so she can save some of it for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her pigs

loans.name: Rufiji Group

texts.en:
Bahati is single and in his mid 20s.  He has been selling chips for two years. He works from 9:00 a.m to 9:00 p.m daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will his 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to sell more chips and started selling chicken and fried bananas.  He has paid for household expenses and was able to repay all his loans successfully. He now wants a loan to  buy a sack of Irish potatoes and cooking oil. His dream is to one day own a hotel.

Bahati will share this loan with his loan group, "Rufiji," with 21 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a sack of Irish potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 31 years old, married, and has one infant. They live in a rural community planting and harvesting rice and vegetables and raising livestock for sale. 

Due to financial constraints, she and her husband want to improve their rice farming business to increase their yields. They have been operating their farm for almost five years. They usually earn a profit of P40,000 in every harvest season, which they spend on food and clothing. They also save some for the future of their child. 

To improve their farming business, Merlyn is asking for an additional P50,000 to buy fertilizer and insecticide needed in rice farming. They are the hoping this loan will help a lot in the improvement of their farming business and are hoping they will have a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide needed in rice farming

location.town: Brgy. Tuao South, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcayaa

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en: Reynaldo is 42 years and a father.  He is engaged in a hog-raising business. He has been in this business for three years. He earns about PHP 5,500. At this time, Reynaldo is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000 to buy feed and vaccine to sustain his hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccine to sustain his hogs

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a hard-working mother, who aims to become financially stable and to give her family a better future. She is now 48 years old and has two children. She owns and manages a general store to generate income, while her husband manages their rice farming business. She has operated this business for three years and usually earns a profit of PHP 300 a day, which she usually spends on their basic necessities.

Marissa planned to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' needs, but due to financial difficulty, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 20,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods, sugar, oils, soaps, bread, shampoo and candies to sell in her store. She mentioned that this loan will help her to improve the business and make her dream come true.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, sugar, oils, soaps, bread, shampoo and candies to sell in her store

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar is a father who raises his family in a rural community. He owns and operates 3 hectares of rice field in their village. He is now 52 years old and has three school-age children. He aimed to improve his rice farming business to increase his yields and income and to satisfy his family's needs and support the education of his children.

Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Cesar needs to increase his income to meet his family needs. He planned to expand his rice plantation to ensure higher production, but due to inadequate capital, Cesar is asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticides needed for his rice farming business. He believes that his patience and strong determination will enable him to improve his farming business and he hopes that he will have a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides needed for his rice farming business

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 49 años, es madre de tres hijos, de los cuales dos ya son mayores, y sólo Gabriela, de 17 años, vive a su lado y depende de ella para su educación. Se quedó viuda hace ya mucho tiempo y desde entonces tuvo que hacerle frente a todas las necesidades del hogar sola.

Desde que falleció su esposo vio la necesidad de seguir generando ingresos a su hogar para solventar los gastos básicos, es así que tomó el control del negocio que antes administraba su esposo, ahora se encarga de sacar adelante un taller de torno (rectifica y reparan motores lineales). Lleva realizando este trabajo por 14 años, tiene a su cargo a cuatro mecánicos que se encargan de hacer el trabajo más pesado. Le gusta mucho lo que hace, pues se considera una buena administradora y se siente contenta porque brinda la oportunidad laboral a más personas y eso le es gratificante. Espera continuar con su trabajo, pero necesita cierto capital económico para poder seguir comprando algunas herramientas y equipos necesarios para que sus trabajadores continúen brindando un servicio de calidad.

Este es su crédito número 16 con MFP y se siente muy agradecida por la oportunidad financiera que le están brindando para avanzar con su negocio. Por su parte, se compromete, una vez más, a seguir siendo una socia cumplida en el pago de sus cuotas. Está muy satisfecha trabajando junto a los miembros de su banco comunal, ya que todos son muy solidarios y muy responsables.
Con el monto solicitado (2000 nuevos soles) comprará fierros, ejes, planchas metálicas y otros materiales y herramientas para implementar su taller de soldaduras.
texts.en:
Martiza is 49 years old. She is mother to three children of whom two are already adults and only Gabriela, 17, lives at her side and depends on her for her education. She has been a widow for a long time and since then has had to cope with all of the necessities of the home by herself.

Since her husband passed away, she saw the need to keep earning income for her home to pay for basic expenses. In this way, she took control of the business which previously was managed by her husband. Now she is in charge of carrying on with a workshop (rectifying and repairing linear motors). She has been performing this work for 14 years. She manages four mechanics who are in charge of doing the heaviest work. She likes what she does a lot since she thinks she is a good manager and feels happy because she provides job opportunities to more people and this is gratifying. She hope to continue with her work but she needs some economic capital to be able to keep buying some tools and equipment necessary so that her employees can continue providing quality of services.

This is her 16th loan with MFP and she feels very thankful for the loan opportunity that they are providing to advance with her business. For her part, she promises, one more time, to keep being a member who repays on time. She is very satisfied working alongside members of her community bank since all are very united and very responsible.

With the amount requested (2000 new soles), she will buy iron, axes, metal plates and other materials and tools to implement in her welding workshop.

loans.use: to buy iron, axes and other materials and tools for her welding shop.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
This is Elena, 59, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Alex, a businessman. They manage their household while operating the business. Elena works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Elena operates a buy-and-sell business. She buys second-hand furniture, repairs it and sells it for a small profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances, electronic devices, and clothing. Customers like the low prices and the many options they are offered. Her customers are her neighbors and local community.  She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her continue, she is requesting a Php10, 000 loan. She will use it to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands.  

Elena dreams of giving her children a good education through her hard work. She meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more quantities and varieties of products needed in her business.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita expresses her commitment and full devotion to her business and to her family as well. Perlita has operated a small sari-sari (variety) store for three years. The profits earned from her business allow her to pay her family's monthly electric bill and to fulfill their daily needs. 

Perlita wants to strengthen her business but has insufficient funds, so she is asking for a loan of 35,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, vinegar, and other basic kitchen supplies. She wants to stock more items in her store to meet all her customers' requests. In the future, Perlita aims to have a large store to earn more revenue.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, vinegar, and other basic kitchen supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, meat, junk foods, canned goods, noodles, candies and soaps for sale

loans.name: Mt-Kipengele Group

texts.en:
Mariam,  who is in her late 30s is single with two children who go to school.  She has had a Grocery business selling for three years now. She works from 3.00 pm to 11.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy a stock of drinks such as crates of beer, sodas, drinking water and has paid all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to start selling juice and water at wholesale price. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group "Mt-Kipengele" with 19 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy juice and water and sell at wholesale price.

loans.name: Top Class Group

texts.en:
Subira, who is in her late 30s is married with one child who goes to school. She has had a food business and bites selling for ten years now. She works from 6.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase sales of food and has paid all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to increase and expand selling of food. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own hotel.

Subira will share this loan with her loan group "Top Class" with 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase sales of food.

loans.name: Luch

texts.en:
Luch is 29 years old and is married with two children who are currently attending to local school. He is a diligent in farm work, including fishing in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. He has been working in this field for almost 10 years, earning in the neighborhood of USD 3.00 per day. Luch is very glad because his wife helps him earn income for their family. She acts as a fish fresh and lotus fruits vender in a market of the province.

With the amount she has requested, Luch would like to purchase a boat with its machine for fishing activities. This will enable him to increase the volume of his productivity and he hopes that he’ll be able to generate more household income to satisfy his living needs.

loans.use: to purchase a boat with its machine for fishing activities.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Don Carlos tiene la edad de 38 años, casado, de oficio comerciante, su esposa trabaja junto con él, tiene dos hijos de 12 y 15 años de edad que cursan la secundaria.
Estudio Administración de Empresa, y su esposa para secretaria, desde joven trabajo junto a su papa, quien era de oficio joyero con su propio negocio, el cual dejo de herencia su taller de joyería, y hasta hoy sigue ofreciendo sus trabajos en prenda de oro y platas. 
Con las ganancias comenzo a comprar ropa nueva, ropa interior, cosméticos, el cual logro un pequeño tramo en frente de la joyería, siendo su esposa quien lo administra, a si ambos han venido logrando adquirir, mejores ganancias, y mejor experiencia.
Con este préstamo comprara 31 kilate de Oro, para seguir haciendo sus prendas y ofertar variedad a sus clientes. Obteniendo mejores ventas.
texts.en:
Carlos is 38 years old, married, a merchant, and his wife works with him. He has two children of 12 and 15 years of age who attend school.

He studied Business Administration, and his wife to be a secretary. Since he was young he worked alongside his father, who was a jeweler with his own business. The jewelry store was left to him through inheritance and today he continues offering his work of gold and silver jewelry.

With the profits he began to buy new clothing, underwear, cosmetics, putting it in a small area at the front of his jewelry store, with his wife who manages it, and together they get derive better earnings and a better experience.

With this loan he will buy 31 carat gold, in order to continue making his jewelry and to offer variety to his customers, obtaining better sales.

loans.use: to buy gold by the carat to make a variety of gold jewelry

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong, age 28, has been involved in farming and fishing business for almost eight years with full support from her husband. Since she started these businesses, Kong can manage her household expenditure and sent all of her children to school. Kong is married with two single children. 

Due to insufficient funds, she is requesting a loan in the amount of KHR 500,000 to purchase a boat for fishing. She hopes that this loan will be granted to her to develop her living standard and satisfy her daily needs. She is thankful to lenders because their loans are very helpful and impact her life in a positive way.

loans.use: to purchase a boat for fishing.

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im is from Baray district, operating three businesses to satisfy her family basic necessities. She is engaged in hog-raising, rice farming, and rice trading. Im manages her time very well for each business. After the bustle of farm work completed, Im turns to focus on hog-raising business. She raises pigs and piglets for both slaughter and offspring. As usual, she is able to earn around KHR 44,000 each pig after selling. During the harvest period, Im uses all her generated income to purchase rice from local farmer in a suitable price, and then she will resell to her new and frequent customers for profit in the future. She is now 53 years old, widowed, and a responsible mother of three children. All of them are married already.

Im is now asking for an additional capital from Kiva lenders to invest in her rice trading business in the upcoming harvest season. She will use the loan to purchase rice to stock in her own rice-storage for the future sale.  She believes that this investment will allow her to make her business more viable and double her household income. She can save it for the future of her family as well as for her current businesses.

loans.use: to purchase rice to stock in her own rice-storage for the future sale.

loans.name: Karafuu Group

texts.en:
Regina, who is in her early 35s is married with three children whose still goes to school.  She has been selling drinks like juices, beers, sodas business for three years now. She works from 8.30 am to 6.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy more stock, pay household expenses, school fees and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to start selling juice at wholesale price.  Her dream is to one day be able to build her own grocery.  

She will share this loan with her loan group "Karafuu" which has a total of 18 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back the loans.

loans.use: to sell juice at wholesale

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohamad from Madaba is an owner of a shop that provides all necessities for weddings and various events. He hopes to get a loan so he can get a car for his shop and be able to cover the needs of his shop and reach more clients and customers.

loans.use: to get a car for his business

loans.name: Brak

texts.en: Brak is 34 years of age, married, has two school-aged children. He work as local farmer in Baray district and at the same time, he operates a buy-and-sell recycled materials to add to his main source of his income. He rides his old bike from house to house with a bamboo basket at the back for keeping the materials. Sometimes he needs to go far away from his community to collect them. Brak wants to save money for his children’s education as they are preparing for secondary school level. For this reason, he needs additional capital to invest in recycled material business in order to increase his income. As of now, he is asking for a loan of KHR 800,000 to use as sufficient capital for the purchase of recycled materials. With this fund, Brak will be able to purchase more materials than what he did and this will make his business more profitable. He is very thankful for unending help from kind lenders.

loans.use: to use as sufficient capital for the purchase of recycled materials.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
This is Jerry, 38, who is a resident of Caloocan, Philippines. He is married to Eleonor, a housewife and the father of his children. Together with his wife, he manages his household while operating his business. Jerry operates a junk shop and he works hard to continually provide an income for his family's everyday expenses.  Trash is not actively sorted in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage piles and trash bags searching for recyclable materials such as metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. These materials are sold to junk shops for a small profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries, factories, and others similar places. Jerry's regular customers are his neighbors and local community members and he earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales daily. 

Jerry is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan buy trash from collectors to help him continue to operate his business. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. Jerry fervently hopes that his children will be able to have a good future through all his hard work. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. Groups gather weekly to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for recycled materials for his business

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong, a 32-year-old resident of Siem Reap province, has three children, all currently attending school and in need of daily allowances. Kong, a hard-working woman always seeking ways to generate income for her family, is involved in rice farming, hog-raising, and other supplementary jobs from which she is able to make revenue to satisfy their living needs. She has been engaged in these businesses for over ten years; her supportive husband appears in the above photo with her in their own home.

Kong, who would like to acquire more pigs for breeding in her backyard pigpen, is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders through HKL to purchase more to raise. After a three-month period of breeding, she hopes to obtain plenty of piglets that she can raise to increase her income to better her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase three pigs for breeding purposes.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en: Zahra is a mother of 4 kids and lives with her family in Karak which is south of Jordan. She sells basic food products to her neighbors from her own home and she wishes to get a loan so she can increase the variety of products and be able to cover her neighborhood’s needs.

loans.use: to increase the variety of products

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
This is Carmelita, 25, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Rany, her business partner, and mother to her children. Together with her husband, Carmelita manages her household while operating her business. She operates a variety store and works hard to continually provide an income for her family's everyday expenses. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy a sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. Carmelita earns a profit by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and selling them retail. Her regular customers are her neighbors and local community members and she earns a minimum of 500 PHP in daily sales. 

Carmelita is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income with her loan. Carmelita hopes to grow her business and dreams of improving her family's future with all of her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. Groups gather weekly to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 57 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora. Está casada hace 29 años con su compañero de toda la vida, Marcelo de 60 años, y con quien tiene cinco hijos, a quienes brindó lo mejor para su educación. Ahora ella vive junto a su esposo en su casa propia donde a diario trabaja mucho para así poder tener una vejez tranquila.

Uno de sus trabajos consiste en la venta de comida. Desde muy temprano se dirige al mercado para conseguir lo ingredientes más frescos y de buena calidad que requiere para la preparación de los potajes que luego realiza en su casa. Recibe la ayuda de una de sus hijas que vive cerca a su casa. Lleva en este trabajo 10 años y le ha traído muchas satisfacciones, como por ejemplo establecer una pequeña tienda de abarrotes que ha construido hace 6 años en un espacio de su casa en el que ofrece todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad. Durante las mañanas atiende en su bodega y por las tardes prepara todo lo necesario para salir a vender comida en la vereda de su casa, a partir de las 5 de la tarde hasta las 10 de la noche aproximadamente. Le gusta mucho lo que hace pues siempre considero que su pasión fue la atención al público y el trato directo con ellos, es por eso que todos sus trabajos han tenido esta orientación.

Este es su préstamo número 19 con MFP, por lo que agradece a las personas que hacen posible su acceso al crédito que requiere para continuar con el logro de sus metas. Se compromete, una vez más, a pagar de manera puntual sus cuotas como lo hizo en sus créditos anteriores. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal del cual tiene la satisfacción de ser fundadora y reconoce la responsabilidad y solidaridad de cada uno de sus miembros.

Con el monto solicitado, 3000 nuevos soles, comprará abarrotes, como arroz, azúcar, aceite, embutidos, leche, huevos y otros productos que requiere para incrementar la cantidad de artículos de su bodega.
texts.en:
Nancy is 57 years old. She is a very friendly and hard working woman. She has been married for 29 years to her life companion, Marcelo, who is 60 and with whom she has five children to whom they provided the best for the education. Now she lives alongside her husband in their own house where she works a lot daily to be able to have a tranquil old age.

One of her jobs consists of selling food. From very early, she goes to the market to buy the freshest and best quality ingredients that she needs to make the dishes she then prepares at home. She receives the help of one of her daughters who lives close to her house. She has be doing this job for ten years and it has brought her a lot of satisfaction, like, for example establishing a small grocery store that she built six years ago in a space in her house in which she offers all types of basic need products. During the mornings, she tends to her store and in the afternoons she prepares everything necessary to go out and sell food in the sidewalk of her house, from 5-10PM.

This is her 19th loan with MFP for which she is thankful to the people who have made it possible for her to access the loan that she needs to continue to achieve her goals. She promises, again, to pay punctually, as she did with her previous loans. Ans she is very happy to belong to her community bank of which she has the satisfaction of being the founder and recognizes the responsibility and solidarity of each one of its members.

With the amount requested, 3000 new "soles", she will buy groceries like rice, sugar, oil, canned goods, milk, eggs and other products that she needs to increase the quantity of items in her shop.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and basic products to stock her store.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani lives in Madaba, which is south of Amman, and she is a university student majoring in managerial information systems. She is a conservative young lady and she asked her mother to take her place in the photo.

Amani pays for her own education and is requesting a loan to pay for her upcoming semester. Additionally, she will buy some new clothes to suit her university life.

loans.use: pay for semester fees at her university

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn, 42, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Rolando, her business partner, and mother to her child. Together with her husband, Jocelyn manages her household while operating her business. She operates a small convenience store and works hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy a sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. Jocelyn earns a profit by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and selling them retail. Her regular customers are her neighbors and local community members and she earns a minimum of 500 PHP in daily sales. 

Jocelyn is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income with her loan. Jocelyn hopes to grow her business and dreams of improving her family's future with all of her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. Groups gather weekly to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Peniel Group

texts.es:
El grupo Peniel está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es María Concepción quien inicio lavando y planchando con las ganancias y los prestamos invirtió hace 7 años en una paca de ropa usada. En la actualidad además de vender ropa usada tiene dos caponeras. 
Las otras integrantes son Reyna quien tiene una pulpería y vende sopa los fines de semana; y Silvia quien vende pan dulce, simple, picos, bolillos, tortas…etc.
texts.en: The "Peniel" group is made up of three hardworking and entrepreneurial people. One of them is María Concepción who began washing and ironing. With the income and the loans, seven years ago she invested in a pack of used clothing. Currently, in addition to selling used clothing, she has two rickshaws. The other members are Reyna who has a grocery store and sells soup on the weekends and Silvia who sells pastries, cakes, rolls, etc.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, dairy products, eggs, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Chhoem

texts.en:
Chhoem is a 39-year-old woman who lives in Kampot province. She is a widow and responsible for two school-aged children, both of whom need daily support. For the past 20 years, Chhoem and her sister have operated a business selling dried and smoked fish in the local market, earning approximately 22,000 KHR each day. She is very diligent in her farm work and fish-selling activities to support her children’s education. Chhoem hopes to educate her children through high school. If she can afford to send them to college, she will give her children the opportunity to become professionals.

Chhoem is requesting a 1,500,000 KHR loan to purchase more fish. She believes that her loan will help her to satisfy her customer's needs and make her business more viable and profitable. Chhoem will save her income for the future expansion of her business as well as for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn, 35. She is a resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She has a child and at this time, she is working hard to be able to send her child all the way through college. Like most Filipino parents, Jocelyn believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Jocelyn operates an Internet café business. There is more need now than before for services like these as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who require her services for school requirements. She also has people who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume or any office documentation; as well as people who would just love to surf the 'net and any social network. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 450 Philippines pesos (Php) in profit every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy an additional computer, mouse, keyboard, mouse pad and other supplies for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Jocelyn dreams to be able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
This is Amparo, 53, a resident of Cavite, Philippines. She has one child who goes to school. Amparo operates a small convenience store and works hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy a sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. Amparo earns a profit by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and selling them retail. Her regular customers are her neighbors and local community members and she earns a minimum of 500 PHP in daily sales. 

Amparo is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income with her loan. Amparo hopes to grow her business and dreams of improving her family's future with all of her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. Groups gather weekly to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Imari Group

texts.es:
El grupo IMARI lo conforman cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Aura Antonia quien se dedica a la venta de frijoles cocidos y comida. Ella inicio lavando ropa con las ganancias y los prestamos fue invirtiendo en otra cosa. 
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para su negocio como frijoles, hueso, perecederos (yucas, quequisque, chayote, tomate, cebolla…etc.)
Las otras integrantes son Yessenia del Carmen quien elabora tortillas, Damaris tiene un taller de costura  e Iris se dedica a la venta de comida.
texts.en:
The group IMARI comprises four hardworking, entrepreneurial people. One of these women is Aura Antonia, who sells cooked beans and foods. She began by washing clothes and invested the profits and proceeds from loans in another business. The loan will be used to buy supplies for her business such as beans, bonemeal, and perishable produce (yuca, taro, chayote, tomato, onion, etc.). 

Damaris has a dressmaker's shop, and Iris sells prepared foods.

loans.use: to buy beans, bonemeal, and perishable produce (yuca, taro, chayote, tomato, onion, etc.)

loans.name: Cesia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cesia lo conforman cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Brenda del Socorro quien vende tortillas desde hace 15 años primeramente vendía frutas y luego invirtió en tortillas. El crédito lo invertirá en maíz, cal, leña, bolsas…etc.
Las otras integrantes son Argentina quien vende leña y frijoles, Matilde quien vende productos y comida, y María Auxiliadora vende enchiladas y platanitos desde hace 4 años.
texts.en:
The Cesia Group is made up of four hard-working and enterprising people.  One of them is Brenda del Socorro who has sold tortillas for 15 years, after first selling fruit and then later investing in tortillas.  She will invest the loan in corn, lime, firewood, bags, etc.  

The other group members are Argentina, who sells firewood and beans; Matilde who sells products and food; and Maria Auxiliadora, who has sold enchiladas and bananas for four years.

loans.use: to invest in corn, lime, firewood, bags, etc.

loans.name: Pin

texts.en:
Pin, aged 40, is a resident living in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She is a hopeful and self-believing woman. She strives to work harder in farming to pursue the quality of life she dreams of having: comfortable standard-of-living conditions. 

Aside from rice husbandry, Pin is also involved in hog-raising as a business for additional income. She raises a few piglets in her backyard pigpen and she plans to stall more pigs for their offspring. 

Due to inadequate capital, Pin decided to seek a loan in the amount of 1,200,000 Camobidian riels (KHR) to purchase pigs and feed. Pin feels agreeable because the funds from lenders will allow her to go a long way toward succeeding in her business. 

Pin is already married but she doesn’t have any children now. She wishes to have one soon.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and feed.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
This is Marlyn. She previously accessed a 50,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marlyn dreams of growing her business in the coming years and hopes to give her family a good future through all the hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 48 years old and is married to Charlito. She is a mother. For the past eight years, Annabelle has been engaged in a food vending business and she earns about 350 PHP daily. She is happy with her business because it enables her to provide for her family's needs. 

Annabelle is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy fish balls, fried dumplings (kikyam), and hot dogs to sell. She believes she will be able to expand her business and increase her income with the financial support she is requesting.

loans.use: to buy fish balls, dumplings, and hot dogs to sell

loans.name: Lindita

texts.en:
Lindita is 38 and married. She has three children ranging in age from 2 to 12 years old. Her family lives in the central east of Albania, in a rocky mountain village that geographically makes the life of inhabitants harder to live. Yet, many families here have taken micro-loans from VisionFund Albania to start up businesses or improve their living conditions, with Lindita being one of them. 

She started a livestock business around five years ago. Since then, she has been selling dairy products to the locals and has been pleased to some extent with the money she earns through it, “Yet, there are lots of challenges, that at times I think I will never overcome,” Lindita says. 

This is the third time she is requesting a loan from the same institution, yet this time is different because this is a Kiva loan. Lindita wants to buy a milk cow with this loan in hopes of increasing the dairy production and, of course, the earnings.

Lindita is someone who is respected by all in her village.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Darwin Lenin

texts.es: Darwin tiene 22 años de edad, es casado y tiene 1 hijo, es una persona muy amable, servicial y alegre, y tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación en la que trabaja en conjunto con su esposa, inicio hace seis años vendiendo productos como ser: azúcar, arroz, y otros productos de uso domestico, luego fue surtiendo su negocio con otros productos que los mismos clientes le recomendaban vender. Inicio a trabajar por cuenta propia y en el transcurso del tiempo aprendió a manejar su negocio. Su horario de atención inicia a partir de las 6:00 a.m. y culmina a las 7:00 p.m. Darwin solicita este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de productos como ser: arroz, azúcar, refrescos, dulces, churros, carnes, papel higiénico, detergentes, jabón, entre otros. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá surtir su negocio y seguir teniendo una fuente de ingresos que le ayude al sostenimiento de su familia. Su meta es mantener su negocio activo y una familia feliz. Darwin es el primer ciclo de recibir el apoyo de FAMA mediante los préstamos obtenidos y ha mantenido un  buen comportamiento de pago.
texts.en:
Darwin, 22, is married and has a son. He is friendly, obliging, and happy. He has a small grocery store in his house where he works with his wife. He began six years ago selling household items such as sugar and rice and later added stock items suggested by his customers. He began as an entrepreneur and over time learned how to manage his business. The store opens at 6 a.m. and closes at 7 p.m.

Darwin is requesting this loan to buy products such as rice, sugar, sodas, candies, churros, meats, toilet paper, detergents, soap, and other items. This loan will allow him to stock his business and continue a good income stream that will help support his family. His goal is to maintain his business and keep his family happy. This is Darwin's first loan cycle with FAMA; he has a good record of payment on previous loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea is 51 years old and married with five children, three of whom are single and two who are married. She happily lives with her husband and her three single children in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. For over 25 years, Chea and her husband have been working as farmers and she is an expert in farming practices. With her perseverance and hard work, she continually develops her business to ensure a high productivity. 

Chea is requesting a 2,000,000 KHR loan to both invest in her rice farm and begin a recycling business. She lacks the capital to begin her recycling business and will use her loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticide and also to purchase recycled materials. Chea hopes that she will be able to uplift her standard of living gradually through her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticide and begin a recycling business

loans.name: Mercedes Aurora

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal Proyección 2000 se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, rodeada por maravillosas playas y de un clima cálido y agradable, con mujeres hermosas y luchadoras que día a día tratan de sacar adelante a sus familias.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mercedes, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  20, 16 y 8 años de edad, estudian en universidad, colegio y escuela, todos ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es empleado público.
 
Nuestra amiga estudia leyes en una universidad local y tiene una tienda en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos, tanto de primera necesidad como también ciertos productos de papelería y de bazar, ella además también vende ropa por catalogo ventas que realiza en la universidad donde estudia, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 16h00 en su tienda y luego ella se desplaza a la universidad donde estudia, sus hijos y su esposo le ayudan en su tienda cuando ella tiene que ir a estudiar porque cuando ella está en su casa ella es quien está en su local. Tiene más de tres años  que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, otros productos de primera necesidad y ropa. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 9 años y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo.

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The communal bank Proyección 2000 meets every 15 days in the beautiful city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi. It is surrounded by marvelous beaches and has a warm and friendly climate, with beautiful and hard working women that make an effort everyday to move their families forward. 

In this place we can find Mercedes. She is 38 years old, is married and from this relationship she has three children of the ages of 20, 16 and 8. They study in the university, secondary school and primary school and they all live with her. Her husband is a public employee. 

Mercedes studies law in the local university and has a store in her house. There, she sells all types of products, from basic needs to paper products and products found in variety stores. In addition she sells clothing by catalog. She makes those sales in the university where she studies. She works daily from 6:00 in the morning until 4:00 in the evening in her store and then she goes to the university where she studies. Her children and husband help her in the store when she has to study because when she is in the house, she is also in her business locale. She has done this work for three years and it is going very well for her. 

She is going to use this loan to stock up her store. She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, other basic needs and clothing. She has been in this communal bank for nine years and she likes it because she has made more friends in the group. Her goals are to continue moving forward in her business and for her store to grow more each day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, other basic products and clothing.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.en: Jhonny's livelihood comes from rice farming. Planting and harvesting rice allows him to gain 15,000 PHP during harvest season twice in a year. Jhonny lives with his wife and three children in Sampaguita. He aims to increase crop production, that is why he would like to borrow a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy rice seeds to grow and fertilizers for sustenance. With enough sustenance from the rice field, Johnny will continuously produce good crops and sell them to traders.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds to grow and fertilizers for sustenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo and his wife have managed a farming business for almost 20 years and they still aim to improve their crop production. Romeo has two children that motivate him to strive harder in making the business grow. Romeo also pays for laborers who help him plant and harvest rice to sell. 

Romeo is now asking for 35,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

With continuous effort, hard work and patience in the business, Romeo is confident that he will achieve a successful farming business for the welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Aurelyn

texts.en:
Aurelyn is from the village of Del Pilar. She is married to Rolando and the couple is thankful because they have been blessed with three children. For the past three years, Aurelyn has been running a sari-sari (variety) store and she earns about 300 PHP daily. 

Aurelyn is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy additional grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, condiments, and assorted bread to sell in her sari-sari store. She is hoping to have a more stable business someday and that’s why she is patiently working hard to earn income and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, condiments, and bread to sell

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.en:
At age 54, Alfonso still works hard in his farming business. He plants and harvests rice to sell to traders. This is the family's primary source of income. He usually gains 15,000 PHP each harvest season twice a year. Alfonso would like to maintain a good harvest, that is why he is now borrowing a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and moluscicides used in sustaining crops so they will produce abundantly. 

In the future, Alfonso hopes to keep growing as a successful farmer and educate his two children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and moluscicides used in farming

loans.name: Adihodegbemabou Jeannette

texts.fr: Veuve et mère d'un enfant âgé de 06 ans, scolarisé dans une école de la place, Adihodegbemabou Jeannette a une domestique qui l'aide dans l'exécution de ses tâches quotidiennes. Elle a une boutique où elle vend des boîtes de couscous, des boîtes de conserve, des palettes de boissons en cannette et d'autres articles depuis quelques années. Elle fait ses approvisionnements dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et sa clientèle composée essentiellement des habitants du quartier. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de répondre favorablement à la demande de ses clients, Adihodegbemabou Jeannette a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev en vue de maximiser son profit et de payer à la scolarisation de son enfant. Elle envisage fournir des soins médicaux adéquats pour son enfants et subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
A widow and mother of a 6-year-old child, who is in a local school, Adihodegbemabou Jeannette has a housekeeper who helps her in carrying out her day-to-day tasks. She has a shop where she has been selling containers of couscous, canned foods, pallets of canned drinks, and other items for a few years. She stocks up at one of the markets in Benin, and her customer base is composed essentially of those living in the neighborhood. 

With the goal of bolstering her business and responding favorably to the demands of her customers, Adihodegbemabou Jeannette requested and obtained a micro-loan at Finadev with the aim of maximizing her profit and paying for her child's education. She envisions providing adequate medical care for and meeting the needs of her child.

loans.use: to buy 2 boxes of couscous, 4 boxes of canned foods, 20 pallets of canned drinks

loans.name: Grey Elizabeth

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal Proyección 2000 se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, rodeada por maravillosas playas y de un clima cálido y agradable, con mujeres hermosas y luchadoras que dia a dia tratan de sacar adelante a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora  Grey tiene 40 años de edad, y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijas todas mayores de edad, la menor de ellas aun vive con ellos y  estudian en universidad. El marido se dedica a varias actividades.
 
Nuestra amiga se dedica a la venta de productos de Avon (productos de belleza y perfumería) y ropa de todo tipo. Su forma de venta es puerta, trabaja todos los días en las tardes, nos cuenta que la mayoría de sus productos los vende bajo pedidos que  le realizan sus clientes,  lo que más vende son los perfumes y la ropa de damas. Lo que es ropa lo va a  comprar cada 15 días Guayaquil y Quito cada vez que necesita, lleva en el negocio más de 3 años y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar productos Avon y ropa ya que tiene varios pedidos. Lleva más de 2 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos cada vez aumenta su negocio.
 
Su meta es seguir adelante en su trabajo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Proyección 2000 meets every 15 days in the beautiful city of Portoviejo, the Manabi capital surrounded by marvelous beaches and a warm and agreeable climate, with beautiful women and hard-workers who from day to day try to get their families ahead in life.

This is where Señora Grey, 40 years old, lives and maintains a common-law marriage in which she has three daughters, all of whom are older and the youngest of which still lives with them and studies in university.  Her spouse makes a living through various activities.
 
She makes a living selling Avon products (beauty and perfume products) and clothing of all sorts.  Her method of sales is to go door-to-door, and she works every day in the afternoon.  She says that the majority of her products are sold through orders placed by her customers.  What she sells most are the perfumes and the women's clothing.  She goes to buy the clothing every 15 days in Guayaquil and Quito, whenever it is necessary.  She has more than three years of experience in the business and it is going very well.

She is going to use this loan to buy Avon products and clothing since she has multiple orders.  She has spent more than two years in the communal bank and likes it because the loans increase her business every time.  

Her goal is to progress in her work.

loans.use: to buy Avon products and clothing.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
This is Juanita, 44, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Perpekto, a driver, and a father to her children. She together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Juanita maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is purchased in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, Juanita is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Juanita fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products needed in her business

loans.name: Luz Margarita

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal Proyección 2000 se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, rodeada por maravillosas playas y de un clima cálido y agradable, con mujeres hermosas y luchadoras que día a día tratan de sacar adelante a sus familias.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Luz, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Nuestra amiga se dedica al comercio, vende productos naturales y su forma de venta es bajo pedidos ya que ella cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que siempre le compran sus productos. Trabaja de tres a cuatro días por semana y en horarios variados ya que no tiene un horario definido sino cuando alguien la llama o cuando está desocupada, ella dela a crédito y les va cobrando por semana o por quincenas,  los productos que más vende son los que ayudan a limpiar el organismo y los que dan energía, lleva más de 12 años en esta actividad ya que a ella siempre le ha gustado el comercio.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más de sus productos naturales ya que tiene varios pedidos por entregar. Está en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios  y está muy contenta porque gracias a los créditos que ha recibido de la  Fundación Espoir ha podido mejorar su negocio. 

Su sueño es seguir hasta donde Dios se lo permita.
texts.en:
The communal bank Proyección 2000 [Project 2000] meets every two weeks in the beautiful capital city of Portoviejo, which is surrounded by incredible beaches and boasts of good weather. The lovely, dedicated women members work hard each day to provide for their families. Luz, 54, is married and has three adult, independent children from her marriage. Her husband is a farmer.

Our friend Luz is a merchant who sells natural products by order and has a substantial number of loyal customers. She works three to four days a week on an informal schedule based on when her customers call or when she is not busy. She extends credit and collects every week or 15 days from her customers. Her best selling products are those that cleanse the body and increase energy. She has been a merchant for 12 years and has always enjoyed business.

She will use this loan to buy more natural products to fill her orders. She has been a member of the communal bank since its inception and is very pleased that the loans from Fundación Espoir have helped her grow her business. Her dream is to follow the path God opens to her.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of coffee and herbal products needed in her business.

loans.name: Alcanzando Nuestras Metas Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Yolanda, tiene 40 años, vive con su pareja y tienen 4 hijos, de los cuales 2 aun están bajo su cuidado.Ella es socia del grupo "Alcanzando Nuestras Metas", que está en su sexto desembolso, éste grupo es muy responsable y puyntual en sus pagos.
La Sra. Yolanda se dedica desde hace un año a la administración de su pequeño negocio de cabinas de internet, el cual inció contando con un pequeño préstamo, poco a poco ha ido aumentando la cantidad de equipos y mejorando el servicio. Sus hijos la apoyan y se turnan para poder atender el negocio.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en el pago del servicio de mantenimiento de sus equipos de cómputo. Ella al igual que los socios del grupo "Alcanzando Nuestras Metas" están muy agradecidos con los inversionistas de Kiva ya que gracias a sus aportes ellos tienen una oportunidad de crecer económicamente y poder cumplir sus metas, sobretodo contar con un negocio que los ayude a cubrir los gastos de estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 40, lives with her partner and has 4 children, two of whom are still in her care. She is a member of the group "Alcanzando Nuestras Metas" [Achieving Our Goals], which is in its sixth loan cycle. The group is very responsible and makes its payments promptly. For a year, Yolanda has managed an internet booth business, which she began with a small loan. Slowly, she had added equipment and improved service. Her children help her by taking turns working at her business. The loan will be used to pay for computer maintenance.

She and the other members of "Alcanzando Nuestras Metas" are very grateful to Kiva lenders because their support gives the members an opportunity to grow financially and to accomplish their goals, especially to have businesses that cover the cost of educating their children.

loans.use: to pay for computer maintenance.

loans.name: Domitila De Jesus

texts.es:
La Señora Domitila es una persona muy trabajadora dedicada a su negocio, vive con su esposo y sus hijos. En el departamento de Choluteca en el sur de Honduras. Y tiene más de 15 años de tener este negocio de venta de Ropa de segunda mano.
Doña Domitila el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra ropa americana, Como pantalones, blusas, camisas, shorts, ropa interior y camisetas. De esta manera incrementara más sus ventas.
Doña Domitila con el préstamo espera incrementar sus ventas y atender mejor a sus clientes. Espera tener mejores ingresos y así tener mejor forma de vida.
Sus sueños es poder terminar de darles el estudio a sus hijos.
Choluteca, Honduras - Julio del 2012
texts.en:
Domitila is a very hard worker who is dedicated to her business.  She lives with her husband and children in the Choluteca department of southern Honduras.  She has been running her used clothes business for over 15 years.  

Domitila will invest this loan to purchase american clothes such as pants, blouses, shirts, shorts, underwear, and t-shirts.  This way she will increase sales.  She also hopes to increase sales and better serve her customers.  She hopes to increase revenues thus giving her a higher quality of life.  Her dream is to help her children finish their education. 

Choluteca, Honduras - July 2012

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, shorts, underwear, and t-shirts for her business.

loans.name: Tith

texts.en:
Tith is 52 years old, living in a thatched house located in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. Local villagers in this area focus mainly on agricultural business including crop husbandry, especially rice, raising livestock, and the fishing business. As others, Tith is one of the farmers who prefers to grow rice to other crops. She has been doing this business for over 30 years. Tith is married and has four children. She gives thanks to her hard work and patience which allow her to raise and send all her children to school.  

In order to better her living conditions and to satisfy transportation needs of her family, Tith would like to take out a loan of 800 USD to purchase a motorcycle for household use. This purchase will help Tith’s family easily and quickly gain access to the surrounding area and also reduce some expenses on public transportation services.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for household use.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en: Saleh lives in Zarqa. He is a university student at a private university. He pays for his education through working and he is a very hard worker. He hopes to get a loan to help him pay for his next semester and continue with his studies and graduate to work in his own field.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is a 30-year-old married woman who has been living in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. Sok is engaged in a farming business to support her living, primarily growing rice and potatoes on her own farmland. She has been working in this field along with her spouse who is very helpful and supportive in maintaining the farm. Sok has two dependent children who are studying and in need of daily allowances.

Due to insufficient funds, Sok has applied for a loan in the amount of KHR 2,000,000 for renting a tractor to till the land. Also with the borrowed amount, she will purchase seeds to sow on her soil. This loan will take part in developing her current business. She believes that with the help of the loan, she will be able to have a fruitful harvest in the upcoming cropping season. Sok comes to HKL for the first time to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to rent a tractor to till the land and to purchase seeds.

loans.name: Zohreya

texts.en:
Zohreya is a conservative woman, which is why she asked her son to appear in the photo instead of her.
Zohreya is a 47-year-old mother of 6 children, married for the second time after her first husband passed away. Her 6 kids are from her first marriage. She works from her home in trading and selling various products to her neighbors and friends. She wishes to get the loan to bring in more bed covers and cosmetic products so she can start an independent store for trading in the future.  She hopes to afford a better life for her kids and to help her husband with the expenses and bills.

loans.use: to bring in more bed covers and cosmetic products

loans.name: Norma Delia

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal Proyección 2000 se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, rodeada por maravillosas playas y de un clima cálido y agradable, con mujeres hermosas y luchadoras que día a día tratan de sacar adelante a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Norma, tiene 50 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. El marido es radiotécnico. 

Nuestra amiga aprendió belleza hace varios años en una academia de esta ciudad y logro el titulo de artesana, para obtener sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijos hace varios años instaló en su casa un salón de belleza, allí ella realiza diversidad de trabajos como tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas entre otras cosas.
